author: {'steamid': '76561198061574337', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1584575083}
review: It's a good one. Pretty quick, almost wish it was longer. However, there are multiple endings so it gives a good amount of replay-ability. Also a plus: Horatio's design is really cool.
developer_response:
Thanks for the kind words! Any longer and we might never have gotten the darn thing done, but I think the consensus is that it could've used one more multi-room area (one thought was that rather than an emergency elevator out of the Council Tower, you would've gone on a cable car to the Cathedral and worked your way down and out from it -- that was part of the original design, but we didn't have time).

We did do a little spin-off story, which isn't more game content, but might scratch the itch a little: http://primordia-game.com/fallen.html

Thanks again for the review!

author: {'steamid': '76561198056674230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1012, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1012, 'last_played': 1450343549}
review:
A wonderful point-and-click adventure game. Set in a post-apocalyptic earth where the only trace of mankind's existence is the machines they left behind, you play as Horatio with his sidekick Crispin as you wander the wastes looking for a means to survive while also asking how far one will go to do so. Aesthetically this is a beautiful display of pixel art that is reminiscent of HR Giger, and the dialogue is charming and thought-provoking. 

On a personal level, this game made me quite emotional and will forever sit in a special place in my heart. A full hearted recommendation from an internet rando.
developer_response: Beautiful to read. Thank you so much for giving our wayward creation a home in your heart.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981656660', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 612, 'last_played': 1582810809}
review: Primordia has crazy difficult puzzles which at times seems illogical, but the game hit me with a huge nostalgia trip to point and click adventures of old. Great pixelart in all it`s glory, well put together story, plenty of humour and magnificent world building.
developer_response: Thanks for the kind words and the puzzle perseverance!

author: {'steamid': '76561198016989249', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1582780653}

author: {'steamid': '76561198045149759', 'num_games_owned': 652, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 547, 'last_played': 1582326111}
review:
This world has soul. Every character doesn't look shallow. Texts are written in rich language variety which is very interesting though a little challenging because English is not my first language. Bonus point for letting me as player have a hint from time to time from Crispin.

I am sorry I ignored this game in my library since July of 2013. But now I can absolutely recommended it to anyone who loves quality Point & Click games (think of Gemini Rue, A New Beginning)!
10/10
developer_response: Many thanks for the beautiful review -- it's hard to believe that English is not your first language, given you graceful language.  So glad you enjoyed the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198239216034', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1043, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 254, 'playtime_at_review': 714, 'last_played': 1710879741}

author: {'steamid': '76561198005376219', 'num_games_owned': 795, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 568, 'last_played': 1581446903}
review:
I initially HATED this game. I started playing almost 4 years ago in 2016 but got stuck shortly after arriving in the Metropol section. I felt the puzzles were too hard and the graphics didn't help with finding items. On and off over the next few years I tried to continue but never made progress. Yet during that time I finished almost every other WadjetEye game (Gemini Rue, Technobabylon, Unavowed, etc)

Yesterday I tried again, but what do you know - my save games were suddenly CORRUPTED and I had to RESTART the whole game.  Right there and then I wanted to leave a NEGATIVE review for this game. But seeing the "Overwhelmingly Positive" rating, I figured there must be something worth playing to the end for.

So I was determined to finish the game this time, and I started playing from the beginning. 
And miraculously I managed to REACH THE END without a guide within a day. :o

Now that I've finally completed this game, I can say the story and writing is definitely worth a playthrough. The characters, dialogue and world building are some of the best ever. However the puzzle design is really hit or miss. Many times I felt I solved a puzzle through luck instead of logic. So be warned - you'll probably get stuck a lot. (The puzzles are still probably easier than 90s Sierra games you could get into a totally uncompletable state with Sierra games).

Overall for me the pros outweigh the cons, so I'm giving this a recommend to people who enjoy point-and-click adventure games with very challenging puzzles.
developer_response:
I'm amazed, and grateful, you persevered and left a positive review!

The saved game corruption was a result of radically updating the game a few months ago to make the engine more compatible with modern machines, to integrate French, German, and Spanish translations, and to fix various bugs throughout.  Sadly, the engine we used (AGS) breaks saves if the game is updated in a way that changes what it stores in memory, which generally means that any major patch breaks saves.  We felt like the imposition on players' saves was outweighed by having a better version of the game for existing and future customers.

Anyway, I'm so glad you stuck with it, and better yet, enjoyed it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198060702821', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 507, 'last_played': 1581198578}
review:
A nice point and click adventure game centered around puzzle solving. The setting is interesting and there are some gems there among the puzzles. Took me approximately 6 hours to beat but not terribly long once you skip all cutscenes and know the puzzles. But at that point, why would you even play it?

Game is divided up into 2 different "acts" each with it's own areas which narrows down where you will search for clues. And I really like how there are some different ending sequences based on some of your choices.

Bottomline, if you like these types of games then give it a go. I wish there was more to the game but really enjoyed some of the puzzles and the setting.
developer_response:
Thanks! Really glad you liked the puzzles!

I'm pretty sure that if you know the puzzles and skip everything skippable, you could beat the game in under an hour (I think the speed run record is in the 30-minute range), but as you say, better to just not play the game at all at that point. :)

I'm not sure if it will satisfy your "wish there was more" itch, but we did do a spin-off story called "Fallen," which you can get for free here: http://primordia-game.com/fallen.html

author: {'steamid': '76561198094319806', 'num_games_owned': 274, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 801, 'last_played': 1580936546}
review: Amazing adventure. great puzzlles. Great story. great atmosphere.
developer_response: Thanks! Always glad to see the puzzles mentioned as a feature -- to me, it's one of the defining parts of adventure games, but there's an increasing tendency to reduce or eliminate them in favor of story. (I like story, too, being primarily a writer myself, but an adventure game without puzzles is like an ice cream sundae without the ice cream!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198060613700', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1483394531}
review: An experience like no other is the way id describe my experience in Primordia. Everything about the art, the music, and the story gives me goosebumps just thinking about it. I would recommend this game to anyone who has a few hours to spare. This is a game best spent when fully immersed into its world. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197986430789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1559005277}
review:
Primordia is one of the few games that left me wanting more, to the point where I bought this game on Gog as well as Steam! (I've completed it twice on the GOG version).

¬†The game's world is fantastic, set in a post-apocalyptic future where mankind has fallen. Nothing in this game feels out of place, the music, voice acting and even visual style all clicked together to create an immersive experience.

Unfortunately, this is the only game set in the "Primordia" universe however the creators have produced a short story called "Fallen" which has left me hungrier for more content.

My only real gripe would be the game's resolution/pixel art. Personally, I'd liked for a higher resolution such as what was seen in "Full Throttle Remastered"

If you're¬†into the old SCUMM point and click adventure game with a rich story and atmosphere then pick this up!
developer_response: Thanks so much for the wonderful review, and for your great generosity in playing Primordia on GOG and Steam! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198142188381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1576800488}
review: Not my favourite game but I enjoy the classic look and traditional point & click adventure style.  The dialogue is great and the concept is very cool.  The only issue I had is this game was pretty hard and the ending didn't turn out like I would have wanted (and I'm not going to replay it.)  Worth checking out for the adventure game enthusiast!
developer_response: Glad you enjoyed it, notwithstanding your reservations. We did make a conscious choice not to offer a save-the-world type ending because -- given the state of the world and the means available to the protagonists -- we didn't think there was any way that such a scenario would be plausible. The story is meant to be more about how to strive against bleak circumstances with dignity and decency, and less about those circumstances being wholly reversed.  The consequence is an ending that is maybe less of an upper than is typical for a post-apocalyptic story (which, strangely, often have the tenor of the Great Flood in Genesis, i.e., that mostly destroying the world will just lead to a righteous rebirth), but it's the ending I wanted to give, even if not the ending everyone wants to receive. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198058517573', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1580163161}

author: {'steamid': '76561198448493754', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1580069941}
review:
This is one of my top 10 point and click games. (Almost all of those are made by Wadjet eye games as well)
The art style is incredible, being both desolate and beautiful all at the same time. The characters are funny and well written. The world that the story sets up captivates you as you try and unravel the mysteries of the past and the present. And the puzzles make sense! All the problems you'll have in this game can easily be solved without a wiki if you just give it time and try everything. 8/10, will definitely play again.
developer_response: So glad you enjoyed it, and that the puzzles all felt logical and fair!

author: {'steamid': '76561198015399055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1579971875}
review:
Very engaging, meaningful narrative with music to match in a perfect graphics style full of delightful characters voiced by thoughtful, caring actors. 

Anyone expressing dissatisfaction with the difficulty of the puzzles did not properly utilize the notes automatically kept by the character, or perhaps did not realize Crispin was the perfect subtle hint/reminder system. I've found any game released by Wadjet Eye does it's best to encourage the player, not punish. I will purchase and play every single one for that reason (and many, many others).
developer_response: Thanks so much for the generous review! I‚Äôm glad the datapouch and hint system were well received‚Äîit does seem like some players miss them, so hopefully your review will be a useful nudge. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197974844621', 'num_games_owned': 459, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 519, 'last_played': 1544178392}
review: With fantastic world-building, immersive and compelling storytelling, beautiful artwork and interesting puzzles, this point-and-click adventure game is a superb contribution to the genre. The voice acting is excellent, the story is well-paced and the post-apocalyptic atmosphere will draw you in for hours. The mystery of the world in which the story takes place is both intriguing and dystopian. Whether you are new to point-and-click adventure games or a seasoned veteran from the 90's classics, this game is a must-play.
developer_response: Thanks for the wonderful (and wonderfully written) review! So glad you liked the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198166706675', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1703728186}

developer_response: We're pleased you discovered it, too! Thanks for giving it a shot, and sharing your kind words.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043367536', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 956, 'last_played': 1567195301}
review: One of my fav games of all time, best click and point ever made. Music, ambiance and history impeccable. I just want one thing from the devs: pls make a translation for brazilian portuguese, since i'm not fluent in english, i can't understand all things from the history of this masterpiece.
developer_response: Thanks for the generous words and support! We've tried a couple of times to get the game translated to Brazilian Portuguese, but neither has gotten very far.  (All of the translations are done by fans, we don't really have the resources to hire professional translators -- cheap "professional" translations of games are horrible, fan translations are actually much better.) We've always gotten great support from Brazilian and Portuguese fans, and it's a big market, so we'd love to do it some day! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198104675671', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 641, 'last_played': 1675322657}

author: {'steamid': '76561198060841444', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 691, 'last_played': 1398777936}
review:
Primordia is a really lovely classic Point and Click adventure game with a solid story and a great world to explore.

The ‚Äúretro‚Äù look suits the game really well, with its pixelated and somewhat grubby surfaces. I managed to go through the entire game with no walkthrough and I really enjoyed the extra puzzles that were built in, which weren‚Äôt necessary for completing the story, but did add some flavor and lore. A lot of lore to be honest, Wadjet Eye is really fond of giving you access to in-game ‚Äúwikis‚Äù that are surprisingly extensive and I for one love it.

In general there were a lot of nuanced characters with different personalities and I like that there‚Äôs different ways to solve some puzzles as well as multiple endings depending on what actions you take. It‚Äôs a relatively short game, but it packs in a lot of world building considering that, and I found it very enjoyable. Definitely recommended if you like robots, cities cobbled together from junk or just worlds that feel like work were put into them.
developer_response: Thanks so much for the lovely and generous review! We're very fortunate to have players who think so highly of the game, and take the time to share their support!

author: {'steamid': '76561198082574541', 'num_games_owned': 620, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2670, 'last_played': 1570326219}
review: This Game was great. The Sc-Fi story in a human void world is great. This seems to be well written and a lot of thought was put into this story. I really hope they release something similar or set in the same world.
developer_response:
So glad you liked Primordia! We did do a little more stuff in the same world, though no additional games. The most substantial is this spin-off story: http://primordia-game.com/fallen.html

Thanks for the review!

author: {'steamid': '76561198026631655', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 533, 'last_played': 1658743825}
review:
I think this might simply the best contemporary retro point-and-click adventure game out there. I have a few others I have yet to try out properly, but that is my initial impression after a decent number of hours of playing it. Normally sci-fi point-and-click games don't appeal to me as much as those in the fantasy genre (Simon the Sorcerer, Monkey Island), but this one is special.

The art style is spot on, the dialogue is well written, and the puzzles are challenging as well as interesting. It is well worth the full modest asking price.

I have yet to complete the game, but I intend to revisit it soon to get through it from beginning to end.
developer_response: Thanks so much! I‚Äôm a big fan of Simon the Sorcerer, too. :) Beautiful game.

review:
Highly recommended for all point & click adventure fans.

This was quite the treat. I loved the hell out of this game, which was a surprise since I had fairly low expectations to start with. The story is really awesome, pacing had me engaged throughout, characters were very memorable and the setting was fantastic. Sure the graphics leave something to be desired and actually led me to believe the game may be subpar, but they have quite the charm and grew on me soon after I started playing. It will likely be rough for anyone not already a fan of this genre, but if you give it a fair chance, it just might leave a lasting impression on you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198174764743', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 699, 'last_played': 1578596486}
review:
Primordia ist ein echtes Schmuckst√ºck. Ich war wegen der Graphik zuerst etwas skeptisch, aber daran gew√∂hnt man sich schnell. Der wahre Schatz ist die Story. In einer Welt ohne Menschen, die von Robotern bev√∂lkert wird, gibt es mehr tiefgr√ºndige und bewegende Momente, als in manch einem anderen Adventure. Wenn man sich darauf einl√§sst, kann man viele kleine Geschichten entdecken, gew√ºrzt mit etwas Humor und bissigen Kommentaren und Dialogen. 

Der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist angemessen, ich musste kein einziges Mal auf einen Guide zur√ºckgreifen, um das Spiel durchzuspielen. Es gibt ein paar R√§tseln√ºsse zu knacken, aber mit ein wenig Logik und Suchen ist das zu schaffen. Es hat mir gro√üen Spa√ü gemacht und am Ende nicht mehr losgelassen. Ich kann jedem nur empfehlen, diese Welt zu entdecken.
developer_response: Sogar das Lesen Ihrer Rezension durch das ungl√ºckliche Medium Google Translate hat mir gro√üe Freude bereitet. Vielen Dank f√ºr Ihre freundlichen Worte, die meine Woche mit einer wunderbaren Note begonnen haben.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035293275', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1297, 'last_played': 1578117221}
review:
I love this game.  It has some pretty interesting and difficult-but-solvable puzzles as well as neat concepts and great characters,

Initially, I had down-voted this game that I truly LOVE because it  ran so slowly on my Win10 PC that I had to go do other things while cut-scenes and the like completed.  There are just too many places where what should have been moments of anticipation turned into long lags of annoyance.  BUT the developer quickly showed up to help! Wow! You can't beat that kind of care and concern! 

Per the below, I edited this review as my issue is mostly resolved.  So if anyone finds their walking speed, graphics, etc. are noticeably slower than shown in the store-page video, you might try the same work-around or bring it up as a store hub discussion..
developer_response:
So sorry to hear about the technical problems you had with the game! We try to provide basically round-the-clock tech support to anyone who posts in the game's discussion page, and I'd be happy to try to sort out what was causing issues for you.  I've tested the latest build quite a bit on my own Win10 machine (granted, not an over-spec'ed one) and didn't have any slowdown issues -- but the engine we're working with (Adventure Game Studios) is finicky enough that combinations of drivers, anti-virus software, Steam overlay, etc. can sometimes gum up the works.  It sounds like what otherwise would have been a very positive experience was soured by these technical defects, and I'm really disappointed that we weren't able to offer you a better time.

If you could shoot me a message on Steam or an email at mark@wormwoodstudios.com, I'd like to learn more about the tech problems (so we can squash them if they come up for anyone else), and I'd also like to see if there's some other game we can offer you a key to as an apology for Primordia falling short.

Happy New Year, and sorry again for the game's deficiency!

author: {'steamid': '76561198026713244', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1503605242}

author: {'steamid': '76561198202000718', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 808, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 808, 'last_played': 1571045512}
review:
Primordia is everything a vintage point and click should be: it's beautiful, it's funny, has solid characters and a good story (one of the few games for which I didn't end up passing the dialogs as fast as possible!) as well as a very decent soundtrack. As an added bonus, multiple endings exist which is always fun.

The difficulty is average with some more frustrating puzzles thrown into the mix, if you're used to point and clicks this should be entertaining without letting you get stuck for 4 hours on a puzzle, especially since slight hints are given when needed.

All in all, I've no complaints at all about Primordia (even finished it twice because I wanted to play the story again) and would heartily recommend it. The only little thing is that interactable objects are sometimes hard to see, like any pixelated P&C, which often leaves you scanning the screen to check if there are in fact objects or interactions you missed (which is, arguably, a part of most old P&C's anyway)
developer_response:
Thanks so much for the generous review!

One thing I'll correct -- we don't have a highlight objects feature!  I don't want players coming in expecting that and then being disappointed.  While I see the reasons for such a feature, I've long felt that it is a net negative (for reasons too longwinded to get into in a comment on a review!), so we did not include it.  However, when the cursor is over an interactable object ("hotspot"), a tooltip appears with that object's name, and the only small hotspots are for items that are, for narrative and gameplay reasons, hard to find (like a lost crystal).  Most of the time, we've tried to have small hotspots indicated by other means -- for example, the crystal gleams from time to time.

Anyway, thanks again for the kind words!

review:
It's not a long game, but it has a couple of hours to it to enjoy. Excellent storytelling, way better from what you would expect from indie developers. The graphical style is very '94, it feels like the Gobliiins did back then. Perhaps there are more aesthetic styles, but this pixelated one suits the atmosphere of the game, and when you have such a good story, you don't pay too much attention to graphic detail.

As it is with similar games you will get stuck a lot of times until you figure something out. For me it was three tims I had to consult with some help, so the puzzles are hard, but not unsolvable ones.
developer_response: Thanks! So glad you enjoyed it -- means a lot, especially coming from a Golbiiins fan. :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198044912691', 'num_games_owned': 541, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1681696817}
review: My second favorite Wadjet Eye story (the first being Shardlight). For apocalypse wanderers, robot philosophers, theology nerds, and Gigerian art fans, try this game on for size. Immerse yourself in Horatio's story and think about what it means to be alive. Think about faith and curiosity. So many apocalypse stories are a tragedy march, suffering and oblivion and the feeling everything was pointless in the end. Primordia's world is coming to a close but it never feels oppressively bleak. That's how I like my nostalgia: kind, forgiving.
developer_response: Beautiful review. Thanks so much!

author: {'steamid': '76561198058735507', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1042, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1042, 'last_played': 1504755853}
review: If you love the old point and click adventures then you definitely want to pick up this gem. I have never left a review for a game before but this game is so well written that I have to let you know that I highly recommend this game for it's story. I love how you can achieve different endings just by noticing or missing some simple things. This game has a wonderful atmosphere and a very mysterious and intriguing plot. 11/10 would post apocalypse again.
developer_response:
> I have never left a review for a game before but this game is so well written that I have to let you know that I highly recommend this game for it's story. 

This line made me incredibly happy!

> I love how you can achieve different endings just by noticing or missing some simple things

This line might've made me even happier, since I'm fairly sure in the history of Primordia reviews, no one has ever said this, they've generally said the opposite (that it's annoying that small oversights or choices can foreclose certain endings). I'm glad one person in the universe liked that design decision. :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198013291770', 'num_games_owned': 882, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 547, 'last_played': 1559013451}
review:
Primordia is one of those games that sticks with you long after your time with it ends; alongside other Wadjet Eye published games I have been recommending friends play it for some time. 

For all its grime and bleakness, the way it tells its story is surprisingly gentle. I felt like a historian (in an extremely engaging way) as I sussed out clues and explored what was left of this dying world. Especially given there are realizations you can make, as a human player, that Horatio can't - I found that those were what hit hardest and stuck with me long after the credits rolled.

A deft combination of gorgeous art and introspective writing, with fairly solid puzzles, really makes Primordia shine.
developer_response: Thank you so much for this review -- the second paragraph in particular does a wonderful job of capturing what we strove for with the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198125490571', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 473, 'last_played': 1577728306}
review:
A short and highly rewarding game.

This is a pixel-graphics point-and-click adventure, not usually my thing, though i've played some others. To me such a game is like a movie, with a potential for greater immersion because of the viewer's ability to control a character. And then there are some puzzles. I prefer my movies while I'm lying on the couch eating crisps, and that doesn't pair well with puzzles and control.

So the movie within the game-wrapper better be good. And with Primordia that really is the case. I highly recommend it.

Also, I would like to thank the author(s) for a great experience. Thank you.
developer_response: Thanks so much for your kind words and support!

author: {'steamid': '76561197975795020', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1467054198}
review:
Primordia is not quite like any adventure game I have ever played. For one, there are multiple outcomes to many situations, as well as the  game's ending. Even once you get to the final moments of the game, I found about 5 different endings available on the final save point I made.

Most of the annoying logic puzzles can be skipped, using an NPC or finding an alternate approach. You can also find multiple ways to get the same thing done, although each of these may alter your story and ending to various degrees. Some of these puzzles will actually lock you you with enough failures and permanently alter your path, though lockouts can be avoided if you save ahead of time. This gives the game more replay value than most games of it's kind, allowing you to find ways to have happier outcomes for the machines you encounter.

The story is also far more complex than I expected, it feels like your playing a single character's story into a much larger universe, rather than a universe created for the sole purpose of your play through. There is also a free online graphic novel somewhere (Which I could never actually find but If it were on store shelves I'd buy on sight given the game's writing) that further expands your view into their world. There are also hundreds of little details you find throughout the story that help make the story more interesting.

When I bought the game, it was on sale for 3 bucks, down from 10. I thought it was just going to be some quick run through a slapped together adventure game someone pieced together as an experiment, occasionally getting stuck to click everything onto everything for an hour or two. What I got felt like a finished product that could easily have sold for 20 bucks and have it's price justified, and sets an example for how the genre can be improved.
developer_response:
Here's the spin-off story you couldn't find: http://primordia-game.com/fallen.html :)

Your review was great to read -- I'm so glad you enjoyed Primordia so much, and that you liked so many of the features, like multiple paths, that we put in. Hard to know whether it's worthwhile at the time, so hearing that they worked for players is always rewarding.

Also, my daughter who is sitting here wants to say that she likes Primordia too! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198182069497', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1669296887}
review:
Lovely game, short and sweet, yet fascinating. Used it to get a friend of mine into the genre. A few times, it was a little difficult to progress - but those are not common.

developer_response: Thanks! Glad you enjoyed the puzzles and multiple endings!

review: This was the first of Wadjet Eyes games I played, and it's left quite an impression on me. Morose, fantastically themed artwork, melancholy music, terrific characters and voice acting, tons of lore and reasonably challenging puzzles - there's not a lot more you could ask for in a retro adventure game. While it's not their best, it's left the biggest impression on me out of all of their games.
developer_response: So glad it left such an impression!

author: {'steamid': '76561198990784417', 'num_games_owned': 564, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 671, 'last_played': 1577572457}
review:
[h1] Tr√§umen Androiden von elektrischen Schafen? [/h1]

‚ÄúPrimordia‚Äù ist ein starkes Point-and-Click Adventure im Stile der 90er-Jahre Klassiker.  

[b] Story: [/b]  
Hier handelt es sich um eine postapokalyptische sehr interessante Sifi-Story in einer d√ºsteren Zukunft, in der scheinbar nur noch Maschinen den Planeten bev√∂lkern. Interessant wie menschlich sich diese Maschinen verhalten.  

[b] Das Wichtigste zusammengefasst: [/b] 
[list]
[*] Sch√∂ne Grafik in Retro-Optik (Pixel-Art). 
[*] Stimmige Soundkulisse und musikalische Untermalung. 
[*] Professionelle Sprachausgabe, aber leider nur in Englisch. Untertitel sind in Deutsch vorhanden. Schade, warum gibt es hier keine deutsche Lokalisierung mit Sprachausgabe so wie bei dem Spiel "Gemini Rue"? Da gab es eine deutsche Lokalisierung vom deutschen Publisher "Daedalic".  
[*] Das Duo Horatio und Crispin erinnern an das Duo Robert Foster und Joey aus ‚ÄúBeneath a Steel Sky‚Äù. 
[*] Eine erh√∂hte Wiederspielbarkeit ist aufgrund unterschiedlicher Enden und L√∂sungsm√∂glichkeiten gegeben (vermutlich √§hnlich wie bei dem Adventure "Blade Runner"). 
[*] W√§re das Release von ‚ÄúPrimordia‚Äù in den 90er-Jahren gewesen, man w√ºrde dieses Spiel in einem Atemzug mit den Kultklassikern des Adventure-Genres nennen. 
[/list]
[b] Fazit: [/b]
Alle die Spiele wie "The Dig", "Blade Runner", ‚ÄúBeneath a Steel Sky‚Äù oder "Gimini Rue" mochten und gut fanden, werden auch an diesem Spiel ihre Freude haben. Spieler die zwar nicht unbedingt was f√ºr Sience-Fiction √ºbrighaben, aber 2D-Adventures wie "Gabriel Knight", "Indiana Jones and the Fate of Atlantis", "Kathy Rain" oder andere Adventure-Klassiker mochten, sollten sich den Titel ansehen. Ich war so gefesselt, dass ich das Spiel in 2 Tagen (laut Steam in 11 Stunden) durchgespielt habe.  Ich f√ºhlte mich jedenfalls sehr gut unterhalten und habe Horatio und seinen Sidekick Crispin gerne durch ihr Abenteuer begleitet. 

[b] Bewertung: [/b]
Meine Gesamtbewertung: 87 % 
Gesamtbewertung Adventure Corner: 87 % 
Gesamtbewertung Adventure-Treff: 74% 
Gesamtbewertung 4Players: 78 % 

[b] Fan-Fiktion:[/b]
Die "Wormwood Studios" arbeiten derzeit an dem Adventure "Strangeland". Vielleicht wird es da ja was mit einer deutschen Sprachausgabe, auch wenn es derzeit leider nicht danach aussieht. Das Spiel ist jedenfalls auch schon mal auf meiner Steam-Wunschliste. 

üëë Powered by HoI 4 Deu Curators group in German / English üëë

[*] [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/30388691/] 
Follow Main group [/url]
[*] [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/40282064/]  Follow Second group [/url]
[/list]
developer_response:
Vielen Dank! Ich bin froh, dass du das Spiel genossen hast!

Unser Verlag hat kein Interesse daran, Primordia zu √ºbersetzen - anscheinend hat die deutsche Ver√∂ffentlichung von Gemini Rue kein Geld verdient (ich bin mir nicht sicher, wie das sein k√∂nnte). Unsere √úbersetzungen wurden von Fans gemacht, die mit uns zusammengearbeitet haben. Eine vollst√§ndige Sprachausgabe w√ºrde jedoch die Beteiligung unseres Verlags erfordern, sodass wir das nicht wirklich umsetzen k√∂nnen. Es tut uns leid!

author: {'steamid': '76561197999676120', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 389, 'last_played': 1577572865}
review:
I write this review to give anyone thinking of buying this game a fair warning:

Even though I loved the game for an adventure game it was I cannot recommend it as it is, for it kept crashing or getting glitches where all sound was lost until resetting. Even after long time searching for fixes and reading through bugs and glitches other people had encountered, I could not find any workarounds; or rather, many workarounds each being all different and the developer helping these people (atleast the person posting in steam community discussions) was almost as clueless as the players suffering from these were. 

If this game had no game-breaking crashes or glitches that removed all sounds, it would be extremely enjoyable point-and-click adventure game that only suffers from typical point-and-click troubles them being "use object X to thing Y" to progress or "now after irrelevant event X go to location Y to pick up object Z to use on a thing in new location" to progress. 

In the end, since there is a great chance anyone who is thinking of trying this game now on a modern PC is going to encounter same problems as I have I cannot recommend this game with good conscience, as I don't want anyone suffering the same as I did: getting a crashes trying to load a save, constantly restarting the game trying to change settings to stop the sounds from getting glitched (which btw I never did manage to fix and suffered them all the way to one of the endings which it ruined for me), getting crashes from playing certain sound-files or getting crashes during cutscenes where game was trying to load a line.

Aside from all this, Primordia is an excellent point-and-click adventure game and I really hate the fact I could only enjoy it to about a halfway until all technical problems emerged. Only buy this game if you acknowledge the danger of crashes and glitches because it can happen to you too and you may have to stop playing midway or spend lots of time troubleshooting, killing your experience.

(PS: In case it matters to you, I did not buy this game, I got it for a Christmas present from a friend.)
developer_response: I‚Äôm so sorry to hear about the technical issues that prevented you from enjoying Primordia. We have almost always been able to get players‚Äô problems fixed, but it does sometimes take some guesswork given different OSes and hardware. That said, we‚Äôve had very few technical complaints since the new version released. Always happy to help you get it working, but I certainly understand if you feel like you‚Äôve put enough time into it. Shoot me an email at mark@wormwoodstudios.com or a Steam message if we can help!

author: {'steamid': '76561198163121993', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1616956367}
review:
This game is just AWESOME!
I realy love stories about robots and point and click games. The plot twist is great, I respect such types of scenarios where for the small game they think up the whole UNIVERSE. During the game, it is felt that something else is behind everything, but this is not described in the plot. This helps to plunge into the game, replay it in hope to find some new clues else in the story. Quests are not primitive and sometimes really hard, well, at least to me. The various versions of solution  of some riddles, for example, about prime password shows that developers really cares about player experience and they works really hard to leave a good impression for the player about this game make it nonlinear.
This game just 10/10. Diamond in the rough. I would sell my soul for this game.
developer_response: Thank you so much for your kind words -- but please hold onto your soul!  Better to pirate a game than pay that price! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198239456968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 576, 'last_played': 1637201961}
review: Fun game with a really interesting world build that I wished was more fleshed out for it is the strongest part of this game. Crisp and Horitio are cool characters but are the only semi-interesting ones as all the other robots are a bit bland. Only was stuck a couple of times which is good for a point and click game. The weakest part of the game is the story which feels  like it was stripped down from something more, which is the a big shame as it has so much potential. Overall, I do recommend picking up Primordia for its a fun but flawed game from a great indie dev.
developer_response:
Sorry you found the story thin! I wouldn't say it was stripped down (though it may have felt that way) -- by design, the idea was to leave room for players to interpret the plot and flesh out the setting with their imagination, particularly since I find that too much story can get in the way of an adventure game. Still, I can see how it might not work for some players.

We did do a spin-off story, which you might enjoy: http://primordia-game.com/fallen.html

Thanks for leaving the review and sharing your thoughts!

author: {'steamid': '76561197963194552', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3996, 'last_played': 1390970668}
review:
The click-to-interact walkabout genre Primordia falls into is an old, now niche genre for a computer game. One recalls titles like Adventures of Monkey Island, King's Quest, Sam and Max, Day of the Tentacle, among others. The genre has given way to 3D worlds, though something was lost in the bargain. 

Games like Primordia take me back. They can be really hit or miss. Thankfully Primordia was a hit. I played the game many times, enjoying the various puzzles, and excellent writing. 

Writing is important. Without quality writing, well crafted pacing, and a decent plot, you could have the most beautiful world, but it would be empty. Primordia has all that and more. 

It plays out on screen as I would imagine it in my mind, were it a book. I was engaged and entertained the whole time. I would highly recommend.
developer_response: So glad you enjoyed it -- and many thanks for the generous comparison to those classics, which were a huge part of my childhood and a big inspiration for the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088465314', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 878, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1703544663}

author: {'steamid': '76561198048813738', 'num_games_owned': 2786, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 583, 'last_played': 1538874123}
review:
Primordia is definitely a solid entry in the point and click adventure genre's must-play list. It's short enough that you can play it in a single day. It's long enough that you feel like you're actually making a difference in the world. It's forgiving enough that you almost forget that Sierra ever existed, while being puzzling enough that you can't help but suddenly think about Daventry.

It's beautiful to look at and listen to and somehow manages to not be overly repetitive in voice chatter. It has charmingly beautiful 1990s style pixel art that would have felt right at home on your 486 with that whopping 4 MB video card.

The achievements are reasonable, yet fairly difficult. You'll manage to get most of them on a standard play through. But you probably won't get them all your first time. But that's fine. You'll want a reason to play again!
developer_response: This is a delightfully written, and very kind, review. Thanks so much for sharing it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198278382853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1483849270}
review:
Primordia has a lot of great things going for it: 
- beautiful artwork that really adds to its post-apocalyptic style
- a compelling narrative that makes you want to continue playing to see what happens next
- puzzles that can be challenging but are logical and feel fair once you solve them\

I love P&C games and Primordia really delivers in this genre. I'd definitely recommend picking it up and trying it yourself!
developer_response: Thanks! Glad to hear such a nice review from a fan of the genre!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972535439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1419177720}
review:
Primordia is a fantastic sci-fi post-apocalyptic point and click mystery adventure.
It has a compelling story, and genuinely relatable and lovable characters; which is especially compelling because they are robots. 

Like much good science-fiction, it uses a setting and characters that is not really directly about humans and ultimately raises some big questions about what it means to be human, and some other ones about where we are ultimately headed in the future.
What do our beliefs mean? How do we measure our goals and values? What will we leave behind when we are gone? Does it matter?
developer_response: Thank you so much -- it's nice to read a review talking about the game's themes and not just its technical aspects. So glad you enjoyed it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198056485903', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1575817985}
review:
Primordia is one of those old school point and click everything until you find what you need for the next step games.  It also has great art and a compelling story.  The puzzles can be extremely difficult to solve but once you find the key element they all fall neatly into place.  The post-humanity world as a backdrop to the banter between the protagonist and his "pet" bot provides a viewpoint I at least am unused to seeing.  I also love the often sarcastic/snarky banter between the two.

While I am not a big fan of this style game, I do recommend Primordia to anyone looking for a solid game with a different viewpoint.
developer_response: Glad you enjoyed that perspective and the banter!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001249995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1451812497}
review: Primordia is indeed a rare gem for anyone who enjoys adventures with a mix of scifi and steampunk. The story and worldbuilding are intriguing and full of depth and atmosphere. Primordia also has it's only unique visual style which sets the mood just right and ties everything together. When you enter the game you feel that you are entering something something that already has a long an ancient history and you are just continuing the story that was started a long time ago. Also the pacing and the puzzles are really good and logical with enough challenge for mature players. The game is not long (around 5-6 hours to complete) but it's an experience worth the price. Highly recommended!
developer_response: What a great review! I love the idea that the player is entering an ongoing history!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045473633', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1520534977}
review:
SPOILER FREE



Story

Primordia is set in a post-apocalyptic setting with only robots and no humans. We follow the story of Horatio Nullbuilt and his sidekick - Crispin Horatiobuilt - on their hunt for their ship‚Äôs energy source.

The entire world in which you move around is sculpted with an incredible love for detail. We are passing through a world which is populated by robots only. Some of them believe in man as their creator, as a kind of religion, others deny their existence. While I usually do not digest religious aspects in games very well it added a lovely mystic touch to the game, without it becoming too preachy or dull.

While the main mission is to retrieve the energy source of Horatio‚Äôs ship, it is also a quest of discovering who Horatio is, where he came from and what happened to the world he travels through.

The story ark was lovely and I was intrigued and captivated the entire time till the very end.



Characters & Dialogues

Horatio Nullbuilt is a very pleasant character, including his design, his voice and his attitude, so it comes natural to feel with him on his quest and during his struggles.

When it comes to sidekicks they can quickly end up being annoying because they are trying too hard, but frankly, I really enjoyed the humor they used for Crispin. He is witty, sometimes sarcastic, but also very loyal. He is indeed more than just a sidekick used for comic relief.

All NPCs you encounter are fleshed out characters, with their own special quirks, that are sometimes very robot-y and sometimes very human. In general the vocabulary and the expressions were chosen very well to transfer human concepts on to machines. Fragmentation and viruses are as much synonyms for death and corruption as there are hints at something as a soul hidden deep within codes and processors‚Ä¶

Something that made it a bit tricky for me is that characters sometimes will utter a hint for you at some point, but they will not repeat it again. Occasionally Horatio will make notes of it, but in general you have to play the game paying close attention to what is being said all the time.



Controls & Usability

Like most point-and-click adventures the controls are pretty straight forward. The menu was designed well so that you can access your map, your inventory and your notes easily. There was little collision for me during the game except at one time, where it also crashed entirely. This only happened once to me though and I might have accidentally triggered it by tabbing out of the game.

What was a bit difficult was to find all the items and characters you can actually interact with, because they are not highlighted in any way. It is easy to overlook them. This made solving some of the riddles harder for me, but then I am not that skilled in the riddle-solving-area anyway.



Graphics

The game has retro-like 2D graphics that I found very appealing. The overall design of the game was very lovely: gloomy, a bit forlorn, but still very pretty and atmospheric. Each and every robot you encounter has a unique design going along with the character, making them stand out as individuals.

My favorites got to be ‚ÄúEverfaithful‚Äù and ‚ÄúPrimer‚Äù.



Sound

I LOVE the soundtrack. I adore it. But then I am a big fan of electronic retro-ish music anyway. It does carry the emotions of the game very well though, having a slightly melancholic and lonely touch to it,

The voices for the characters have also been chosen incredibly well, introducing a broad variety of how you can portray robots - not only visually - but also accousticaly.

Not much else to say there, besides the sound rounding up and also valuing up the game in its entirety.



Overall Review

A point-and-click adventure that was resonating so well with me that I cannot help but just love it: The design, the sound, the story, it all fit so well and it was all just right up my alley.
Some of the riddles were tough and I sure didn‚Äôt solve them all without help, but they were not as ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù as many of the ‚ÄúDaedalic‚Äù games for example.

If there is one thing I did not like about this game is that it was over comparably soon, but since there are several endings available it actually encourages me to replay it once more. So yeah, I am rather biased about this game. *g* :)
developer_response: Thanks for the generous and thorough review! So glad you enjoyed the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198056698823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 797, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 797, 'last_played': 1527358502}
review:
[h1]Introduction[/h1]

Primordia is one of my favorite games. A story set in a wold after the fall of humanity.
You play as Horatio, a robot just trying to accomplish his dream of flying in the skies with the help of his little sidekick. He tries to keep to himself, but sometimes trouble finds us.

[h1]Sound[/h1]

The soundtrack and environmental sounds perfectly set the mood to complement the story. The voice acting in all the characters is really good and fitting to the characters. Every character that you can talk with has really good voice acting or fitting robotic sounds.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

Primordia plays as a point and click puzzle game and plays a bit with that fact on occasion, sometimes even referring to genre tropes in a light hearted manner. However, the game is more than that. The puzzles in this game can be solved in various ways and one neat little thing that this game does and I wish others did as well, is the fact of having a little gadget where the main character keeps notes of things that may or may not help him solve the puzzles to progress the story. Veterans of the genre might be used to using pen and paper to keep track of all the possible hints, however in this game, it does it for you. So that is a nice feature in my book.

[h1]Story[/h1]

The story really shines in Primordia. From the soundtrack to the visuals and even the gameplay, all blends together to make a really incredible experience. The game has around 10 ending paths, and I say paths because in those endings, even if you have the same ending twice, it might not be the same depending on the things you did in the current playthrough.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]

In Conclusion, Primordia is a great game where every aspect of it complements each other to give a great experience. It nails many aspects in the point and click adventure genre while being creative in some aspects to give the player a better overall experience.
developer_response: Thank you so much for this elegant and thorough review!

author: {'steamid': '76561198031706704', 'num_games_owned': 819, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 780, 'last_played': 1521586183}
review: Primordia is one of my favorite adventure games, ever. I love the forlorn atmosphere, colorful characters and the kind of dark story it has going on. I don't know if this will sell anyone on this game, but it's a semi-modern classic as far as I'm concerned.
developer_response: Thanks so much -- "forlorn" is a great word to describe it. Not sure why it never came to me before...

author: {'steamid': '76561198049018897', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1590158676}
review:
An incredible indie game bringing back the Point-and-Click genre the right way.
The "old" style graphics are awesome (I always liked this style instead of new ones, seriously), the puzzles are awesome even though I'm really bad at puzzles in games like this, the setting is great since I love post-apocaliptic settings and stories, such as Chrono Trigger for instance, it really makes me think about humanity, the future, the fear that it gives, and so on.
I still haven't finished the game yet, but this one purchase that me and everyone that likes puzzles or point-and-click games and/or post apocaliptic settings will not be disappointed with this game, it is simply marvelous!
developer_response: Thanks so much! Glad it had that old school feel!

author: {'steamid': '76561198107808261', 'num_games_owned': 344, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 435, 'last_played': 1643938086}
review:
Legitimately one of my favorite games of all time, I simply love the characters, art style, and story as all of them fit perfectly into this beautiful world of ruin brought upon man by themselves. The variety in play is fantastic and the puzzles are intuitive, each ending is incredible in its own right, and I really need to get to %100ing this game.

*Update:* Just picked it back up to get that 100%, absolutely loved rediscovering how beautiful, funny, and clever the game is, truly still holds up as one of my all-time favorites.
developer_response: What a wonderful review -- so glad to hear that Primordia's one of your favorites!

author: {'steamid': '76561197988861105', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 484, 'last_played': 1577114005}
review:
Just as good as the good adventure games of old, without the frustration. The puzzles make more sense, many have multiple solutions, and your companion can give advice if asked. There was only one puzzle I can remember being frustrating, just because I didn't saw there was and object I could interact.

The world building is nice and it has some touches of humor. It leaves you yearning to return to this world.

The only downside I can think of is that the art is too pretty but is lost in such low a resolution.

As an added bonus, it runs great on linux with proton out of the box.
developer_response: Thanks for the lovely review! I'm so glad to learn that it runs well on Linux. We've always wanted to have a native Linux build, but we can't get our publisher to upload it, so this is the next best thing. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197976161321', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1419316086}
review:
If you're a fan of point and click games, then Primordia is a must own.  I own most of the Wadjet Eye games, and have been very happy with all of them.  I enjoyed the writing from start to finish.  The puzzles were mostly fine, but there were a couple that were frustrating until I figured them out, but that's been my experience with most point and clicks.

If you like Primordia, I encourage you to also check out the other Wadjet games, especially the Blackwell series.
developer_response: Thanks so much -- and for encouraging players to try other P&C adventures!

author: {'steamid': '76561198205562309', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1557713037}
review: This game has that classic post apocalyptic Fallout vibe but its much more mysterious and haunting with the total absence of humans. Horatio is a great protagonist with both intelligence and wit and Crispin is such a great complement with their personalities. Great game. Would pay for a film adaptation.
developer_response: Thanks so much for the kind review -- I'm glad you enjoyed the interplay of Horatio and Crispin!

author: {'steamid': '76561198157038404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1577475161}
review:
Terrific setting and interesting puzzles. Slightly disappointing that I don't think there's a way to run it windowed, and it gets pixelated on a large screen. But there's mouseover labels on everything, so if you can't see the details, you can still find out what things are. 

The premise is great - post-apocalypse, the only sentient beings we find are robots. Some of them worship mankind as the lost Builders. But the story's not about finding the lost truth or reconnecting with history; it's about a broken ship with a missing power supply.  

If you like the art style in the preview pics, and you like point-and-click adventure stories, this is a terrific game.
developer_response: Thanks for the kind words -- sorry about the clunky graphics. They were already old when the game was released, but monitor technology in 2019 is not kind to VGA resolution. :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198351395486', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1558215286}

I am not really a point & click game lover, but this one is quite interesting.
The art style along to me is a worth to buy, and there's so much more to it.
enjoy.
developer_response: Thanks so much for the kind words! Hope you can find some other point-and-clicks that you like!

author: {'steamid': '76561198174905401', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 960, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 960, 'last_played': 1545155510}
review:
Okay, with my play-style when it comes to the Point & Click (my favourite) genre, I can say that it definitely felt like a world I would actually want to live in, and did so during my tenure.

Given the somber atmosphere, the world did have a beautiful sense of realism when it comes to interacting, and moving around. And, to be honest ... I wasn't expecting to enjoy such a classical feeling adventure, just like they were made in the 90's.

The most satisfying feeling for me was being able to tap into the airship's systems and getting the electronics to work. And although I'm not really an "Achievements" kind of gamer, I can most definitely say that I do feel a kind of itch to go back and search for that hidden tape deck.


Thank you Wormwood Studios & Wadjet Eye Games!

PS. It didn't feel "Indie" at all immho.
developer_response: Thank you so much for this lovely and generous review!

author: {'steamid': '76561198277460311', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1558584667}
review: Excellent game.  Fun puzzles and great artwork.
developer_response: Thanks! So glad you liked it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198062599735', 'num_games_owned': 4822, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 638, 'last_played': 1486020970}
review:
A throwback to the pixel and story heavy heyday of adventure gaming, Primordia is a treat for genre-fans, and the well-crafted story and setting will appeal to those looking for something with a narrative that serves as more than a loose excuse for gameplay.

It's not particularly long, my 10.5 hours of playtime reflects a single playthrough without resorting to outside assistance, (although I have played a large number of adventure games which lends an advantage in understanding how the puzzles typically work) but the content is all quality, filled with characters and locations which are memorable but never outstay their welcome. Crucially the protagonist Crispin is a pleasure to embody, it's always a good sign when you get to end of an experience like this and immediately start wishing you could spend more time with the principal characters.
developer_response: What a kind review! I'm so glad you enjoyed the game, and grateful you took the time to share your thoughts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077352611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 656, 'last_played': 1572914680}
review: Primordia was my first true point and click adventure game.  I mean I had tried some old adventure games where you had to type specific instructions, but nothing point and click.  I was immediately sucked in and enthralled with the voice acting, characters, music, and art.   If you like point and click adventures or are on the fence about them, give Primordia a try. It opened up a whole new world of games to me.  It can for you too!
developer_response: Thanks so much for this review -- I'm glad it got you interested in the P&C genre, which has many wonderful games in it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972861785', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1577231637}
review:
Very interesting settings with an immersive world where humans have long disappeared. The characters are very well written with great voice acting, the arts are fantastic, the puzzles can sometime be quite challenging, but that's how old school adventure games used to be, I just wish I had as much time as I did when I was a kid playing all those LucasArts and Sierra's classics.
Definitively recommend this game to any adventure game players looking for a fantastic journey!
developer_response: Ha -- I too wish I had that kind of time. I remember when "over 100 hours of gameplay" used to be a thrill, now it sounds like a curse. :)

review: I normally don't play point and click adventures but this one stood out to me because of its artstyle and atmosphere. It is both dark and beautiful in its own way.
developer_response: Glad you liked it -- hope you can find more point-and-clicks you like... I'm obviously biased but I think it's a pretty special genre!

author: {'steamid': '76561198069096516', 'num_games_owned': 579, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 618, 'last_played': 1435583652}
review: Lovely little point and click gem about robots living in a post-human world. I really loved the characters (especially Crispin) and would love to see another game in the same universe.
developer_response: Glad you liked Crispin (and the game!) -- many thanks for the review!

author: {'steamid': '76561198048948806', 'num_games_owned': 4904, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1469371132}
review: I loved point & click games ever since I can remember but Primordia took my love for them to another level. The surreal atmosphere alone sold me. But then you take a great premise and combine it with such a well crafted world and you get a masterpiece. The artwork is so cool that every scene can be framed and put on a wall. I know I'm gushing too much but I can't help it, I loved it completely. It's a must for anyone who's into point & click.
developer_response: What a wonderful review to read! Love of point-and-clicks is what brought us together to make Primordia, so I'm glad that we're connecting with players the same way the classics connected with us.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009546808', 'num_games_owned': 651, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1577538275}
review: Grreat game for those who are interested in old school point and click adventures or sci fi stories in general. The puzzles are challenging enough to make you think but not difficult enough to stop your progress, Great indie title.
developer_response: Thanks! Glad we hit the right challenge level for you! We didn't want to make a game that was too easy (as many are these days), but calibrating it just right is always tricky.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105984916', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 731, 'last_played': 1668836040}
review:
This by far, is one of my Favorite Point and click games that I've had the pleasure of owning. 
It has a very interesting story that you learn and discover as you play through the game with superb voice acting, effects and OST that gives it Life, and with the addition of multiple endings it has a certain replayability that'll leave me coming back again just to hear some of the bombastic quotes.
If you like robots. Post apoc settings, puzzles, and story with cute sprites? This is a GAME for you. 
Moving on from that: 

Pros: 
-Runs on just about EVERY Computer model out there, even my Potato
- Excellent OST to keep you ingaged
- The puzzles don't baby step you through them. You have to search to figure them out
- A handy hint system by clicking your companion. 

Cons: 
- Sometimes using a item you might have use for later and having to improvise without it. 
- Good luck finding the OST to listen too by itself!
- Even with hints sometimes the puzzles can leave you stumped for hours. Best come back and try again later. 
- I've had my game freeze once or twice when tabbing out. Be aware of that!
developer_response: Thanks so much for the thorough and balanced review! Glad you found the puzzles difficult, but not *too* difficult, and that the hint system was helpful!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006259509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1586079869}
review:
This game is a creative and dark point and click adventure game; it sucks you into its' atmosphere and lets you as the player puzzle out the mysteries of this universe while trying to complete the quest for your character.

One of my favorite things about this game is that it doesn't ever monologue to you about what happened to make this world the way it is, rather you come to understand the world as you interact with it. This rewards curiosity and means that the more times you play through it the more you'll understand about the world.

I've only played through it once, but have often thought about giving it a second go. There are multiple endings, so there's definitely a reason to play it again.

The visuals are gorgeous in my opinion, a proper mix between windows 2000 game and dystopian post-apocalyptic earth.

Audio is good, music is only okay but the ambiance and dialogue are top notch.

Art: 10/10
Audio: 8/10
Story: 10/10
Gameplay: 6/10 (It's a point and click, doesn't really require pixel hunting, but the gameplay is just standard)
Extras: 10/10 (This is the extra effort that the game just oozes, everything is dialed in to perfection and plays as one symphony)

Overall: 9/10
developer_response: Thank you so much for the kind review. I'm glad the way we doled out the information worked for you -- that was the effect we were trying to achieve, but you never know if it's going to work. :)

review: This is easily my favourite point and click game. The art is amazing, as is the world and characters. It is the sort of game that makes me want to replay it every time I think about it. I've recommended it to others even when they had never played a point and click game before, knowing that Primordia would capture them immediately. Give it a try, you won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054585861', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1371963877}
review: I found Primordia back in 2013, and started to play it then. Sadly due to my personal interest in other games of the time. I shelved this and decided to pick it up at another time. Fast forward to 2018/2019, I found it again while looking through my library and decided to give it another shot. The artwork in the game and the story are fantastic from what I have played and gives a very somber feeling. The game world gives an awesome futuristic, but also steampunk vibe that I very much enjoy. The only warning I give about it is that you will have to put a decent amount of time into figuring out the puzzles, although this may have just been due to my own playstyle. I have thoroughly enjoyed Primordia myself, and hope that I can finish it at some point.
developer_response: Thanks! I admire your perseverance!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035379610', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 505, 'last_played': 1658855938}
review: Loved this game. As puzzle games go, the puzzles in this game are fun and sometimes challenging, your decisions along the way and especially towards the end feel like they actually have consequences but what really makes this game stand out is the setting. The background of the world, the description of the history and the fall of humanity that lead to the world being in the state it is in just leaves you wanting more opportunities to explore.
developer_response: Thanks so much for the kind review! I'm particularly glad you enjoyed the puzzles -- it's always touch-and-go on those. :)

review: I have played this game on my friend's account first, and after that, I bought it because it's one of the best games I have ever played. author: {'steamid': '76561198033169969', 'num_games_owned': 2293, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 688, 'last_played': 1473754287}
review:
This review does NOT contain spoilers.
You've been searching the dumpster Steam has become, looking for a game worth your time, money and effort? Look no further, you found one of the very few gems around here. Owning around 2000 games, I feel like playing only around 10% of them and Primordia is one of them.

The game has great, thought through story setting and interesting characters. It has a deep message if you want to search for it. But what if you just want to have some fun without studying game philosophy? You can have that too. You can roam the created world listening to great music, enjoying the jokes that developer put into his creation. 

Like in other games Wadjet Eye Games published or developed the puzzles are logical without some nonsense like trying to use a tree on a painting to open a door. I also haven't encountered any bugs.

All in all, it's a great game with nice music, graphics, voices that everyone can enjoy. Recommended.
developer_response: Thanks so much for the kind review, and for finding the time and energy to give Primordia go among all the many other games you have!

author: {'steamid': '76561198003470493', 'num_games_owned': 365, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 868, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 868, 'last_played': 1473192793}
review:
I'm surprised I didn't leave a review for this game, considering how much I enjoyed it - I got Primordia on a whim during a sale because the art style and description intrigued me. I went in blind - and enjoyed one of the best indie experiences of my life. The world is a fantastic blend of memorable characters (here I am years later fondly remembering many of the interactions in the game and considering replaying it) and intriguing worldbuilding. The puzzles are approachable if you've ever played point-and-click adventures before, and I personally felt compelled to see the story through to the end - and thankfully, the ending doesn't disappoint. Your actions matter, and the world will change accordingly.

You're going to love the main characters.
developer_response: Thank you so much for the lovely review -- the whole team really appreciates hearing from players (both praise and criticism), and it's a real morale boost in getting Strangeland over the finish line.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080836264', 'num_games_owned': 872, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 997, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 997, 'last_played': 1558823099}
review: Wow. I mean, what's not to like here? This game is fantastic! I usually don't replay point-and-click adventure games after I've beaten them, but I've come back to this little gem at least twice since I beat it years ago. I love it's aesthetic: post-apocalypse where only robots and androids exist. The game has beautiful visuals and great, humorous voice acting. I could definitely imagine this being turned into a movie! There are so many interesting characters and places to explore packed into the 6 or 7 hours it takes to beat this game. The puzzles are challenging, and while I did get stuck on one or two, the solutions weren't excessively complicated. I highly recommend it to anyone who has even a passing interest in point-and-click games. It's on sale right now for $2.99, which is quite the bargain on a game as good as this. Play it! I'm sure you'll love it as much as I do! ^_^
developer_response: Thank you so much for the kind words!

review: As a veteran adventure gamer, I absolutely adored this. This is one of the best distopian worlds and stories created in the last ten years (together with Gemini Rue, Technobabylon and now recently also Whispers of a Machine) and certainly one of the better adventures I have played. The production values are also very high with excellent voiceovers, nice game mechanics and lovely sounds and musix. I so loved this game, yes due to plot and writing, but mainly because the chief characters in this game were done so well and have a lovely interaction. I highly recommend to pick this up, whether it's on sale (it is frequently) or not.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984565236', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1576388969}
review:
IT'S GOOD

EDIT: 
To be fair, I wasn't expecting a dev response, but since you took the time to view the comments made to the game, i'll take the time to give an honest review:

This game took me back.  And i mean that in the most genuine way that I can say it.  I was always a fan of the point and click adventure games, everything from Sam and Max, to wizards quest, and monkey island.  Those games were my delve into computers, and what got me interested and hooked onto computer gaming; which at the time was drastically different in selection than what the mainstream systems had been offering.    But to digress, Primordia brought me back to the whole experience that was computer gaming.  Everything from the art style, and graphical choices, to the menu options and hud overlay that acted as a time machine.  The art itself was beautiful. Bleak landscapes and sandy wastelands of a post-war world inhabited by robots.  The setting was captivating, and the plotline kept me engaged for the totality of the game, start to finish.  The voice acted lines were fantastic, and the wit and charm of the character banter just made the experience all the more fun.  Without rose tinted glasses, this game still holds up on it's own as an incredibly fun ride.  The best part about getting to play this was that my wife, (who had very little patience for the games that she sees me play) sat with me for the entire play through, start to finish; which was a quality experience that we shared thanks to your wonderful game.  I look forward to seeing what you do in the future, and will be absolutely supporting your work from here on out.  Thank you so much!
developer_response: Thanks!
