author: {'steamid': '76561197970490424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1926, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1921, 'last_played': 1576947453}
review: Really great world they created. Dialog and voice acting is done really well too. Puzzles were good as well, though a couple spots I had to look at a guide to figure out a non-obvious puzzle... imho this was less of an issue than most point and click adventure games I've tried. Game is also perfect length, though now I wish I could keep seeing more of the world they're in. A+, check out if you have any interest in point and click adventures.
developer_response:
Thank you so much for the kind review! I'm so glad to hear that you enjoyed the game.

We did do a little more in the world, most significantly the spin-off story "Fallen," but also a couple smaller things, all of which can be gotten at primordia-game.com.  (It's all free; none of it is substantial enough to ask someone to pay for.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197970412502', 'num_games_owned': 835, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 1561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1576437386}
review: Wormwood Studios proves they are a top developer with a first-rate point & click adventure. Great graphics and voice acting. Wadjet Eye not only makes superb games, they apparently have a great eye for talent too. I look forward to playing more from this studio.
developer_response: Thanks! Though technically, this is one of the ones only published (not made) by WEG, along with Gemini Rue, Technobabylon, Resonance, etc. Still, I certainly think WEG picks good games go publish!

author: {'steamid': '76561198019516861', 'num_games_owned': 1047, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1575938297}
developer_response: Glad you liked it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198116166059', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1654832251}
review:
I cannot even begin to describe with words how deep and engaging this game can be if you really take in and try to understand the real world "premise" behind the story. This game will really get you thinking about a lot, while also being a VERY fun and engaging point and click story game. The characters were very fun and unniic (see what i did there c:),the voice acting was great, the art was beautiful.  I have not one complaint. This, even after 9 years, is art, and a masterpiece of a creation by the devs that made Primordia. If you havent played this game, do it. You will enjoy every minute of it, and after every puzzle, it'll leave you wanting more.

Speaking of, Primordia 2 please?????? :C
developer_response:
What a wonderful review to start the week with!  Many thanks for the pick-me-up.

I don't think there'll ever by a Primordia 2 (just our spin-off story, "Fallen": http://primordia-game.com/fallen.html) but we are working on another adventure game, Strangeland, which should be done within a few months.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014637571', 'num_games_owned': 689, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1575834942}
review: Superb point-and-click adventure. Interesting post-apocalyptic world that draws you in, no moon-logic puzzles, subtle atmospheric soundtrack, solid junky/sci-fi looking design fitting for the post-apocalypse. Doesn‚Äôt overstay its welcome, gets the plot, characters, and themes across without dragging for a moment. Only negative is that there‚Äôs not more from this dev team (besides the spin-off short story).
developer_response:
Thanks for the very generous review!

We're working on remedying the lack of additional games, but we do work very slowly.  Here's a teaser trailer for Strangeland in the meanwhile, if you haven't seen it: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FOWpyVHeKRE

author: {'steamid': '76561197965158099', 'num_games_owned': 1676, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1607334637}

author: {'steamid': '76561198022415153', 'num_games_owned': 969, 'num_reviews': 271, 'playtime_forever': 376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 376, 'last_played': 1575677733}
review: Primordia is an interresting title with an unconventional setting that leaves more questions than answers. However it should be noted that this game has multiple endings and that it's relatively difficult to get the "good" ending especially if one doesn't make enough saves!
developer_response: Thanks -- glad you enjoyed the game, despite the challenges of finding all the endings!  I think the core "good" ending is actually fairly straightforward, but you're right that getting every last scintilla of hope out of the ending requires making various decisions a certain way as you go along. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198143824862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 564, 'last_played': 1575545042}
review:

developer_response: Ha! Maybe a very bad performance of The Merry Wives of Windsor. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198055970101', 'num_games_owned': 954, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1622145091}
review:
One of the few modern adventure games that I can call a classic and a must play for everyone who enjoys point and click games. The story is well written and smart, plus I really love the art style and characters (voiceacting is top notch). Puzzles are a mixed bag though; some are good (I especially like those with more than one solution) and some are a bit "gamey", but that's a fairly minor inconvenience (to me at least).

Why I'm writing this review now? Because I nominated Primordia for the Labor of Love Steam Award as a thank you for bug fixes and support spanning from the release to this year :) I can't wait for Strangeland, hope to hear some news about it soon.
developer_response: Thanks for the kind review, the nomination, and the enthusiasm about Strangeland! We‚Äôre truly lucky to have such fans supporting us.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961253923', 'num_games_owned': 392, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1574865013}
review:
Wow, this was an awesume experience. I could not stop playing. Loved the fun suprise relations and mentions of other games/movies. And this really brought me back to the time when I played "beneath a steel sky".. becuse that was exactly the same feeling and experience as I got.

This is fantastic, the story is high quality, the humor is great and teh game is (at least for me) exactly that difficult that I never got stuck for too long.
developer_response: Thanks so much! BASS was a huge inspiration to the artist/co-lead, Vic Pflug, in part just out of Australian pride but mostly because of its painterly style.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997323086', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1575152970}
review: A good game but understand what you're getting yourself into: A challenging game that requires a long attention span and good attention to detail.  The game is basically a big, semi-dynamic puzzle.  Be prepared to spend lots of time examining environments and troubleshooting problems.  If you get bored easily or quickly, then this probably isn't the game for you.  But if you really like games that emphasize story, dialog, character development, and problem solving, then this game is about as good as it gets.
developer_response: This is a great review‚ÄîI appreciate that your generous compliments are offset by fair warning. Thanks so much!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970430411', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1573592323}
review:
For me, Primodia was one of those games, that leaves you with a feeling of emptiness when you finish it. What should I do with my life now?

The puzzles are good, not too hard, and not too easy. The world is weird and beautiful, the voice acting is excellent, the characters are deep and well-built, but the story, is really what sets tha game apart. The story is nothing short of amazing. Slowly discovering the truth about the past, was very exciting.

Primordia is a b'sodding great game. I wish it was longer, or that I could forget about it, and play it again for the first time. 10/10
developer_response:
Mikal -- Thank you so much for the kind (if bittersweet) words about Primordia.  Fortunately, I think there are many wonderful games (not to mention books, movies, poems, plays, etc., etc.) to fill whatever small hole Primordia has left.  I'm glad it affected you so much, though.

I'm not sure if you're aware of the small spin-off story we did, "Fallen."  If not, you can find it here: http://primordia-game.com/fallen.html

Many thanks again for the generous review.

review:

 Astounding game. It has found it's place deep inside of my soul. Every aspect of it is great - story, voice acting, music, artstyle, atmoshpere, even how developers treat the players. I really want more games rooted in this universe, or at least just more of this particular game. It hurts me deeply that there is none.
developer_response:
Many thanks for the kind words -- though the last sentence gives me a bittersweet feeling. We did do a little bit more stuff in the same setting (the spin-off story "Fallen," for instance), but I don't think we're likely to make another game in the same world. I'm hopeful we'll eventually get our other games out, though, and maybe we'll be lucky and they will hit the same high notes for you. Thanks again!

author: {'steamid': '76561198028029393', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1572571053}
review: If you are a fan of old school P&C adventure games, definitely play this one. The game has a ton of personality, world building, and fantastic voice acting. This is one where you actually have to use your brain, and I recommend using some pen and paper for this one, even though all the bits and pieces of data are saved and easily accessible. I can't fault the developers for having a very brown aesthetic, since this conveys the atmosphere very well, but it makes things hard to find on the screen since there is no hotkey for finding interactive spots like most modern games have, and the game is very pixelized. It's a shame there has been no new game from this developer in 7 years, because this game is on par with the classics from LucasArts and Sierra.
developer_response:
Thanks -- it's especially gratifying to hear you broke out the old pen and paper.

Sorry we've failed to deliver over the past near-decade. We do have other games in the hopper, it's just as hobbyist developers, inveterate procrastinators, and near lunatics, the team works somewhat erratically and slowly. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198022458781', 'num_games_owned': 2799, 'num_reviews': 206, 'playtime_forever': 1582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1640649443}
review:
[Quote][h1][b]Per altre recensioni segui üëç il nostro [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/40165899]Curatore in lingua italiana[/url].[/b][/h1][/Quote]
Non √® tanto una recensione, quindi non parler√≤ di grafica, storia, enigmi, sonoro, personaggi, ecc, ma far√≤ un avviso al popolo italico. Se non conoscete bene l'inglese evitatela: battute veloci e non arrestabili, inglese spesso arzigogolato, ecc. 
Stia l√¨ con il suo inglese e si faccia comprare dagli anglofoni.

-------------------------------------------------------------------
AGGIORNAMENTO dopo la traduzione italiana
-------------------------------------------------------------------

Cominciamo con la grafica, che, si sa, nel caso delle avventure, √® l'aspetto pi√π trascurabile, a meno che non faccia parte di una visione progettuale complessiva dell'autore, ma comunque √® la prima cosa, assieme alla componente musicale, che salta agli occhi. Pur tuttavia quella di questa avventura sembra molto deludente; anche se datata, suvvia, non risale ai tempi del DOS di Monkey Island: le scritte non nitide, i pixel abbastanza poco definiti, l'interfaccia un po' grossolana sembrano non scaturire dall'arte della grafica a pixel. Si aggiunge qualche imprecisione, come il non segnalare oggetti, come le porte, al passaggio del mouse sopra di essi (ma perch√® quasi tutte le porte soffrono di tale imprecisione?); o il fatto fastidioso che non sono segnalate a dovere le due solite funzioni dei tasti del mouse, cio√® di inspezione e di azione, anche se questo non √® di grosso intralcio.
Gli enigmi sono fatti bene e non facili, e l'avventuriero di vecchia data subir√† un effetto di d√©j√† vu quando se ne trover√† davanti qualcuno veramente impietoso, di quelli 'vecchia scuola' che in passato lasciavano bloccati per settimane se non per sempre, anche se nel nostro caso il  nostro simpatico compagno Crispin ci pu√≤ dare qualche dritta.
La storia ricalca il ben risaputo schema del personaggio protagonista accompagnato da un altro fido compagno, Crispin, appunto, che fa da sponda sia per i dialoghi che per le azioni: lo schema prevede che con questo accompagnatore si consumino continui scambi di battute, quasi sempre di stampo sarcastico, e questa avventura non √® da meno, ma con l'aggiunta di una gradita sorpresa pi√π avanti nel gioco.
Come inciso vorrei dilungarmi su una riflessione. In quasi tutte le avventure o giochi che prevedono la presenza di esseri artificiali, come i robot, si d√† per scontato che questi ultimi superino tutti il test di Turing: infatti i loro comportamenti e reazioni sono praticamente indistinguibili da quelli dei normali esseri umani in carne ed ossa. Ed allora assistiamo, per esempio, a robot o comunque esseri artificiali, seduti sconsolati per terra, che discutono di realt√† alienanti o che sono vittime di diseredazione sociale; o che vendono facendo profitti; o che siedono pigramente al bar. Come se, raggiunto un certo livello di complessit√† intellettivo o sociale o di civilt√†, i comportamenti degli individui si uniformino, e non fa differenza se questi ultimi sono di origine biologica o cibernetica o di altro genere. Forse che gli esseri artificiali devono copiare necessariamente la matrice sociale, caratteriale e genetica dell'uomo perch√® giustappunto da lui costruiti? E quindi ecco la caratteristica comune della sopravvivenza, della sopraffazione, della ricerca del potere e del comando. Le Macchine non possono avere una loro evoluzione indipendente ed originale e non ricalcare quella del genere umano? E mentre Mass Effect rispondeva a suo modo a questa problematica, questa avventura si adegua alle convinzioni generali senza dar vita ad una sua soluzione personale.

Ma in definitiva qualsiasi gioco di spessore e creato con passione vuole mostrare qualcosa di suo, spera di trasferire al giocatore il suo carattere, e premiarti per averlo seguito. Ed allora cosa vuole mostrare questa avventura, che prescinda da aspetti tipo quello della grafica sui quali creda non faccia vertere la sua qualit√†?  Io credo voglia mostrare una sua storia. In un mondo le cui conformazioni e tale per cui gli eventi che lo hanno fatto arrivare al suo stato attuale vengono via via delineate e rivelate a poco a poco vivono degli esseri artificiali che formano una civilt√† ed una societ√† con le varie sfaccettature che il gioco cerca di forgiare. Prescindiamo dalla considerazione che questi esseri in realt√† potrebbero benissimo essere uomini in carne ed ossa aventi varie tradizioni, usi e comportamenti, nel loro caso rimpiazzati da considerazioni legate alla loro programmazione: in ogni caso questi 'robot' manifestano odio, strafottenza, violenza, pazzia, attaccamento al dovere, ecc. ed hanno tra di loro interelazioni abbastanza complesse. Vale la pena stare attenti ai loro dialoghi, che spesso sono articolati e che rappresentano uno dei noccioli dell'avventura: vedi ad esempio il ragionamento arzigogolato di Sempre-Fedele quando confuta le risposte del nostro protagonista.

In tutto questo ad un certo punto ho avuto l'impulso, confesso iroso, di lasciare la valutazione negativa. Il problema sono proprio l'ossatura delle avventure: gli enigmi. C'√® un caso di enigma 'difettoso',  caso questo che indispone oltremodo un avventuriero per le inutili perdite di tempo e gli altrettanto inutili tentativi infruttuosi che gli sottraggano l'unico premio possibile immaginabile per un avventuriero, il suo ambito premio Oscar: la risoluzione di un enigma. I dettagli dell'enigma sono in calce alla recensione ben coperti dal neretto dello spoiler. Ma quello che ha fatto traboccare il vaso √® che la traduzione italiana ha 'rotto' uno degli enigma clou dell'avventura: come √® possibile che ci sia questa disattenzione da principianti? Faccio un altra digressione. Tutto questo mi fa ancor di pi√π sembrare di essere in un ghetto, il ghetto di noi italiani che non possiamo ambire a videogiochi che ci rispettino. Non si tratta di volont√† e sacrificio del volontario di turno che si arma di pazienza per offrire il suo lavoro di traduzione: √® che il panorama videoludico, come il mondo, che forse comprende l'Italia stessa, negletta bellamente che esiste una nazione che si chiama Italia. Ed allora ecco che, per esempio, mancano le lettere accentate perch√® i lor signori anglofoni hanno deciso a tempo debito che l'alfabeto principale doveva essere il loro. Inoltre, purtroppo, quando si fa un'opera in cui si mette un contenuto intellettuale non basta solo tradurre, come si farebbe in uno sparatutto, dove 'shot' √® 'spara' e amen: l'opera nasce con la lingua con cui √® stata creata, spesso non pu√≤ prescindere da essa. Non si traduce 'A Silvia'.

Questa avventura √® da giocare per la storia e per le emozioni che trasmette, anche se manca quel quid che la avrebbe fatta diventare memorabile. I personaggi tentano di entrarci dentro, non credo ci riescano, ma un certa impronta ce la lasciano. Ah, dimenticavo: √® 'difficile', √® per gli avventurieri, desistano gli altri.


PS [spoiler]Ad un certo punto c'√® una cupola con porta chiusa ed ho in inventario un trasmettitore radio. Provando ad inviare un segnale alla porta con il trasmettitore vedo che il protagonista automaticamente si allontana ed invita il suo amico robottino ad allontanarsi: ma perch√®? In verit√† non capisco questo comportamento. Va b√®, andiamo avanti.  Cerco, con vari ragionamenti, di giungere a scoprire il codice di quattro cifre da inserire sul trasmettitore, ma niente. In definitiva: sulla porta si deve attaccare una bomba, che trover√≤ dopo, da azionare con il trasmettitore. Ecco spiegato perch√® si allontana! La gestione corretta dell'interazione porta-trasmettitore √® errata, sarebbe dovuta essere qualcosa del tipo: il protagonista dice 'non va bene', 'manca qualcosa', ecc.[/spoiler]
developer_response:
Mi dispiace molto per i tuoi problemi con Primordia. Abbiamo provato tre volte a lavorare con un traduttore italiano in modo che, come per il francese, lo spagnolo, il tedesco e il russo, avremmo potuto avere una lingua ufficiale o non ufficiale in lingua italiana. La verit√† √® che tradurre il gioco √® piuttosto complicato (sia linguisticamente che tecnicamente) e la maggior parte dei traduttori rinuncia. Spero ancora che un giorno avremo una traduzione in italiano, ma non mi aspetterei che qualcuno lo aspetti. La tua recensione sembra assolutamente giusta se un giocatore non riesce a capire l'inglese (o ha difficolt√† a tenere il passo con la velocit√† dell'inglese nel gioco), non ha senso giocare a Primordia.

Il nostro prossimo gioco, Strangeland, avr√† almeno un'impostazione in cui √® possibile mettere in pausa il dialogo dopo ogni riga (in modo che sia necessario fare clic per continuare). Ma anche allora, non sono sicuro che sarebbe molto divertente per qualcuno lottare attraverso battute, riferimenti e puzzle che richiedono molta familiarit√† con l'inglese. (Probabilmente Strangeland verr√† lanciato con le traduzioni, ma non sono sicuro di poterne consegnare uno italiano, per lo stesso motivo per cui non abbiamo trovato un buon traduttore italiano con cui lavorare, soprattutto perch√© non abbiamo molto da compensare un traduttore con).

Comunque, scusami ancora per la tua delusione. Vorrei che il gioco potesse essere accessibile a tutti. Se avessi le risorse, lo farei cos√¨. Nel frattempo, aspetta. Ho sentito che Gibbous, un gioco creato da alcuni sviluppatori che mi piacciono, ha traduzioni molto forti e credo che l'italiano sia incluso.

author: {'steamid': '76561198267697807', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1572111426}
review:
Amazing game!! The worldbuilding and writing are so polished. The art is beautiful too! The steampunk-esque aesthetic was gritty perfectly suited the tone of the story. 

Puzzles could have used some work (I had to consult a walkthrough quite a few times, only to find out that it was because I hadn't right-click 'inspected' a certain item first). 

Amazing experience overall, in the same vein as Oneshot, another one of my favorite games :D there's just something about post-apocalyptic worlds inhabited by robots that is so poignant haha.

Would highly recommend this!
developer_response: Glad you enjoyed it and put up with some puzzle frustrations! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198815532787', 'num_games_owned': 91, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1538012587}

author: {'steamid': '76561198028212686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1572293267}
review:
10 minutes in and I was totally in love with this game.

This is your classical point-and-click adventure game with smart and engaging puzzles, excellent writing and retro graphics. I had so much fun playing this. The humour is spot on. Crispin, your flying robot sidekick, had me laughing so many times.

The puzzles are challenging enough to have you scratch your head a couple of times. But they all felt very logical and were never impossibly hard. If you get stuck you can always talk to your flying robot sidekick, he will give you some subtle hints or clues. I recommend using pen and paper to write stuff down. At least for me this helped a lot in cracking some of the puzzles in the game. This includes the whole info kiosk puzzle + door code, those were by far the most pleasing puzzles to solve in the whole game.

I like that some puzzles can be solved in more than one way, resulting in different parts of the story opening up depending on your choice of action. There is also a multiple of different endings. So even if the game is not that long, it has a lot of replay value.

If you are even the slightest into point and click games, you absolutely have to try this. It's one of my absolute post 2000 favorites in the genre, up there with the likes of Machinarium.
developer_response: Thanks so much for the kind words and for taking the time to share them!

author: {'steamid': '76561198063411374', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1008, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 666, 'last_played': 1571890756}
review:
Like others have said its a masterpiece. The voice activing is amazing as well! It just pulls you in and is just on another level. I love the world that this game takes place in - it makes me what to see more! The puzzles are a ton of fun as well, and they all make sense but you have to put some thought into them to solve them, I think a good analogy is akin to a escape room if you have ever done that. There was only 1 puzzle that really tripped me up - small spoiler - at one point you will need a glue and you will need to use oil to glue some things together more or less. I did not see that puzzle comming and had to google that one but outside of that just damn. Love to see more from the creator! 

To be clear - this game is so good im buying my girlfiriend and friend a copy.
developer_response:
"Uhh, boss, did he really say he's buying his girlfriend a copy of Primordia?"
"Yes, Crispin, yes, he did."
"Sweeeeet."

In all seriousness, thanks for the very generous review (and triple patronage!).  We are very lucky to have such supportive players.

That puzzle you mention is one I regret. There actually is a basic in logic for it -- it's a reference to the DIY "sticky bomb" in Saving Private Ryan.  (See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anti-tank_grenade)  I'm fairly sure that the sock is an essential part of the real thing, but a sock would've made the puzzle seem even more nonsensical.  Really, though, the question is why should there be a Saving Private Ryan reference in Primordia, and I can't really say. I think the impetus for the whole thing was wanting to have some use for the dripping grease that Vic drew for the UNNIIC background....  Anyway, more information than you possibly could have wanted!

Thanks again, and I hope your girlfriend doesn't leave you over your taste in adventure games. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198059763189', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1571083935}
review: Beautiful art and a captivating story makes Primordia a great game. Interesting characters, each with their own personality, fun dialogues, smart and logical puzzles and great voice acting brings this post-apocalyptic point & click adventure to life. It goes up there with the good old adventures of the 90's.
developer_response: Thanks so much for the kind words -- and very generous comparison to the games of the 90s.  Those were certainly great inspirations for us, so it's nice to hear our little game compared to their likes. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197993148381', 'num_games_owned': 4356, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 389, 'last_played': 1566792471}
review: Very different in setting from [i]The Shivah[/i] (which I played immediately before this), [i]Primordia[/i] takes place in a post-apocalyptic sci-fi world, now inhabited only by sentient machines after the apparent extinction of humans. I'm generally a fan of sci-fi, so the mystery and open questions presented by the game world made for a compelling experience, and ultimately the story comes to a satisfying finish, especially with the variety of choices available at the very end. In terms of the gameplay, [i]Primordia[/i]'s puzzles mainly follow the more traditional item-based approach and for the most part avoid becoming too obscure, though on occasion there are situations where it's easy to overlook a vital item (I had a guide to hand to help with this sort of thing). What stands out about the game, though, looking back on it, is definitely the philosophical/moral themes, focused around the rights and wrongs of collectivism and similar. An impressive achievement.
developer_response: Thanks for the kind review! The Shivah makes an interesting juxtaposition. It's my favorite of the games WEG developed (as opposed to merely published), as it feels like the most personal of the stories. From talking with Dave about it, in a sense I think it is thematically quite close to Primordia, arising from Dave's own questions about identity, a person's place in society, and faith (feelings that came to him while teaching English in Korea). In some ways the games couldn't be more different, of course! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198020049439', 'num_games_owned': 2603, 'num_reviews': 277, 'playtime_forever': 989, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 985, 'last_played': 1571770094}
review:
Otra aventura editada por Wadjet Eye Games y otra buena aventura gr√°fica.

Primordia es una aventura de la vieja escuela, con una buena trama y unos personajes maravillosos... pero ante todo Primordia es una estupenda obra de autor que ning√∫n amante de las buenas aventuras gr√°ficas deberia perderse. 

El juego nos sit√∫a en un futuro dist√≥pico donde toda la humanidad a perecido por la guerra y solo han sobrevivido los robots y los androides, que han desarrollado su propia civilizaci√≥n en un mundo post apocal√≠ptico devastado por la guerra y con una gran escasez de recursos. 

Si bien el fuerte del juego no son los puzles, hay alguno que otro especialmente malo o incluso absurdo, el juego destaca por la buena ambientaci√≥n post apocal√≠ptica, los elementos de cyberpunk, los carism√°ticos personajes y la buena trama. Una trama aparentemente ligera y entretenida que esconde en realidad alguna que otra idea mas profunda y que nos va planteando dilemas morales sobre los que, si el jugador quiere, poder reflexionar. 

El juego no es muy largo y no resulta demasiado dif√≠cil... lo cual no quita para que sea una aventura diferente y muy disfrutable. 

Me encontr√© con un bug que me hizo reinicar mas de una vez el juego y aunque este es completamente jugable no cabe duda de que el bug termina siendo una desagradable molestia. En todo caso por lo que he podido comprobar no es un bug frecuente. 

Una obra de autor muy peque√±a pero muy coqueta que consigue atrapar al jugador y logra diferenciarse de la mayor√≠a de aventuras gr√°ficas que se hacen hoy en d√≠a. 

En definitiva, y pese a sus mediocres puzles un juego altamente recomendable para todos los amantes de las aventuras gr√°ficas. Sobre todo para los amantes de la vieja escuela y aquellos que busquen buenas historias con nuevos y originales enfoques al hora de desarrollar trama. 

Primordia es sin duda un juego con defectos pero tambi√©n es un juego muy interesante de jugar. 

Estar√© muy atento a su pr√≥ximo juego. Eso seguro.



8/10
developer_response:
Muchas gracias por sus amables palabras. Y muchas disculpas por las frustraciones que ten√≠as con el juego.

No deber√≠a haber ninguna forma de bloquearse en un callej√≥n sin salida. ¬øPodr√≠as decirme los lugares donde te quedaste atascado? Es posible que de alguna manera hayamos pasado por alto algo en nuestro dise√±o, pero durante muchos a√±os del lanzamiento del juego, ¬°nadie identific√≥ un callej√≥n sin salida, y mucho menos dos!

Tambi√©n ser√≠a bueno saber qu√© caus√≥ su bloqueo para que podamos solucionarlo en cualquier parche futuro. Mi esperanza (siempre la esperanza de un tonto) es que podamos lanzar un juego que funcione bien para todos. No hay nada peor que pedirle a un jugador que ponga su tiempo y dinero en tu juego, y darle algo roto a cambio.

Gracias de nuevo por la amable revisi√≥n!

author: {'steamid': '76561198049792048', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 1127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 655, 'last_played': 1707979138}
review:
I overall really enjoyed this game. Its story was very unique and refreshing, and I'm glad I decided to play this.

There is a downside though that I think everyone should be aware of before you buy. Point & click adventure games are notorious for moon logic, brick walls with no obvious solution, and ending-changing decisions at easy-to-miss moments. This game is no different. I had to consult a guide many times throughout. Maybe the solutions to some of these are more obvious to longtime pros of this genre, but I think most people will find this game has too many frustrating moments.

At one point you're supposed to use the frequency transmitter to say something to little Rex? How is anyone supposed to figure that out? The frequency transmitter is never used for something like that prior, and you've never interacted with Rex directly before either. Just one small moment among many. I know that one isn't necessary to complete the game, but still annoying.

What I love most about Primordia is the intrigue you built up about the lore. Not too heavy handed, you gave us enough to mull over and keep us hungry for more. You gave us a few different ways to interpret the history, which I love. The idea of man being a mythical, god-like figure to the machines is really fascinating.

Also, I enjoyed and appreciated this piece exploring libertarian and anti-collectivist ideas. More media these days should explore these concepts. I noticed as well that you stand up for property rights and demonstrate it poetically in some situations, without being too preachy either. Really done right.
developer_response:
Glad you liked the game overall, and sorry for your disappointment!

That particular puzzle has three solutions‚Äîyou can also give the rusty gears to the rust-eating ‚Äúcleaner fish‚Äù robots in the underworks or ask the robot bartender to clean it. But the truth is that a frustrated player is frustrated; it doesn‚Äôt matter if there are other alternative solutions. Glad you survived!

author: {'steamid': '76561198013009514', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 404, 'last_played': 1569329723}
review: Was very surprised to find such a well designed point and click game from such a small studio. Great writing with interesting setting and world building. The idea of having a sidekick and getting hints through him is very immersive for a point & click game, very well thought in my opinion.
developer_response: Thanks so much! Glad you enjoyed it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198016808486', 'num_games_owned': 481, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 773, 'last_played': 1570754282}

author: {'steamid': '76561198337436135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 725, 'last_played': 1543915825}

author: {'steamid': '76561198063633680', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1547856072}
review:
I thought I'd written a review when I bought and finished the game months ago, and I'm shocked that I hadn't..
I've not played a lot of Point & Click games, and those that I have, weren't anything like this.

Since it's been so long, I'll just give a short and sweet version: [b]This game is f#@king awesome.[/b]

And I'll be honest, I absolutely suck at the kinds of puzzles and half the problem solving that was in this. I needed a guide. But just as honest, I don't care that I did. I'm glad I did. The story, theme, setting, just the entire tone of this had me dying for more. Several months later, writing this, remembering the best scenes, I STILL want more. I want a series of novels. I want a mini-series. I'll even take a movie. Hell, this game felt almost like all of that somehow as it was. I still get chills thinking about it.
The voice acting, characters, settings, all fantastic. Favorite side-character was definitely Ever Faithful Leobuilt. Spooky and fascinating, full of a lot of information. Best creepy robotic voice I have ever heard, and I love it. I wish I had a text-to-speech reader that sounded like him.

I'll say that this game is incredibly depressing, bittersweet, and and a bit nihilistic in a couple ways if you're someone looking for hope for the future. Even The Good Ending of this game still had me contemplating how long anything might keep existing. But... there was so many unanswered aspects of the world lore, I can't do much but keep wondering.

My only negatives are probably that some of the puzzles were impossible without a guide, and that, as other reviews have written, it seems to raise more questions about the world than it answers. And I guess I'm... sort of okay with that. Although, I'd rather read a series of novels set through the history of the world to learn more.

Goddamn, I love this game. I'm going to have to replay it again soon. lol
developer_response:
Thanks so much for taking the time to write such a kind review, especially after such a lapse of time.

I'm also a huge fan of the delivery of EFL -- Steven Poulton voiced the character, and other than mispronouncing "adept" (for which I tease him endlessly -- he gave it the adjective's pronunciation rather than the noun's), it's absolutely perfect.

In terms of your request for more, we did do a free spin-off story that you might enjoy: http://primordia-game.com/fallen.html

Thanks again for the kind words!

author: {'steamid': '76561198155763641', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1568571235}
review: Finished it in 6 hours (three play sessions) without any guides, but well worth it. A well-written and well voice-acted adventure with an interesting story. The music was good, with one track being outstanding which I shall seek out on mp3. I finished the game and got 48% of the achievements, but plan on replaying it to get the rest of the achievements and see what story branches I missed the first time around - and also listen to the in-game commentary. Nice little package with plenty of worthwhile extras to keep you coming back after the initial play-through.
developer_response: Thanks for the kind words! And good for you, beating it without a guide!

author: {'steamid': '76561198099124067', 'num_games_owned': 595, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1479539384}
review:
A story about two robots searching for energy source in a post-apocalypse world, where human is believed to be the God of all robots.
Personally I think it's a very good story adventure game with funny dialogues, great voice acting, and interesting world design.
Recommend if you like some slow-paced (but not boring) story-telling.

Horatio does have some characteristics, and I love Crispin :)
developer_response: Thanks! Glad you enjoyed it. We love Crispin too. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198096608094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1570248688}
review: This is a game that sneaks up on you. At first it seems to be a fun, if slightly amateurish, modern point-and-click. Slowly you realize you're playing something that surpasses the greatest adventure classics. I only wish it were longer.
developer_response:
That is very high praise indeed!  I'm not sure I agree that it surpasses the classics (because in my opinion, my puzzle design was much less complex than the puzzle design of the classics, and that is a key feature of adventure games), but it is wonderful to hear that reaction all the same.

It won't make the game any longer, but we did do a spin off story (not a game) that you can find here: http://primordia-game.com/fallen.html

Thanks for the very kind words.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075879874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 539, 'last_played': 1567285998}
review:
Ein wundersch√∂nes Point&Klick Adventure Game, bei dem es eigentlich nicht viel zu Bewerten gibt. 

Story:
Der Protagonist der Story sind Horatio und sein selbstgebauter Gef√§hrte Crispin, deren Energiekern von ihrem Schiff gestohlen wurde. Somit machen sich beide auf den Weg, diesen wieder zur√ºck zu bekommen, sonst geht den beiden Robotern fr√ºher oder sp√§ter der Saft auf. Und w√§hrend sie auf ihrer Suche nicht nur eine Postapokalyptische Welt aus Stahl und Sand durchqueren, treffen sie dabei auf viele andere Roboter und ergr√ºnden nebenbei das Schicksal der Menschen. ...

Mehr sei zu der Story nicht gesagt und verraten. Die Geschichte wei√ü den Spieler zu fesseln und zu unterhalten, auch ohne gro√üartiges Drama, gezwungenen Chiffhangern, Explosionen und/oder unsinnigen Comedyeinlagen. Das ganze ist sogar eher D√ºster gehalten und erinnert den Spieler jederzeit daran, dass man auf einer sterbenden Welt unterwegs ist. Es muss jetzt zwar keiner bef√ºrchten, von der Geschichte Depressionen zu kriegen oder wegen herzzerrei√üenden Dramas in Tr√§nen auszubrechen, aber das Spiel schafft es, eine eher ged√§mpfte Stimmung r√ºber zu bringen. Finde ich zumindest. 
Man bekommt keine zu schwere Kost vorgesetzt, die Themen die aber w√§hrend der Geschichte durchleuchtet und/oder angeschnitten werden, geben einen trotzdem zu denken. Sofern man sich darauf einl√§sst. 

Gameplay:
Gespielt wird mit Maus und Tastatur, wobei sogar die Maus alleine vollkommen ausreichen w√ºrde. Man kann jetzt zwar nicht interessante Objekte mit einer bestimmte Taste anzeigen lassen, wie in moderneren Point&Klick Spielen, aber sofern man sich kurz die Zeit nimmt und in jedem Kartenabschnit mal die Maus sorgf√§ltig √ºberall dr√ºbergleiten l√§sst, findet man eigentlich alle wichtigen Punkte, mit denen man interagieren kann. 
Die R√§tsel sind eigentlich nicht zu schwer und wer Adventure Spiele mag und ein K√∂pfchen daf√ºr hat, der kommt sicher problemlos durch das Spiel. Ich selbst habe eine L√∂sung als Hilfe genommen und ja ich sch√§me mich zumindest dezent daf√ºr. *hust* 
Das Spiel ist vom Umfang her jetzt kein gro√üer Zeitfresser, egal ob mit oder ohne Komplettl√∂sung. Wer eher gem√ºtlich sich ein paar Stunden am Tag g√∂nnt, hat zumindest ein paar Tage etwas von dem Spiel. Ansonsten ist man eigentlich nach ein paar Stunden Zocken recht schnell durch. Manch einer lockt vielleicht die Archievments f√ºr einen zweiten Spieldurchgang, aber das war es dann auch. 
Eine St√§rke von dem Spiel ist auch, dass es keine Sackgassen gibt. Man kann sehr wohl hier und da L√∂sungen f√ºr R√§tsel finden, die nicht wirklich Ideal sind. Aber haupts√§chlich ist das nur f√ºr die diversen Achievments von Steam wichtig. Es gibt am Ende des Spiels verschiedene Enden zu finden. Je nachdem, was f√ºr Schl√ºsselgegenst√§nde man am Ende bei sich hat. Und die Auswahl ist nicht klein. Soviel ich nachgelesen hatte, gibt es f√ºnf bis sechs (?) m√∂glichkeiten, um das Spiel zu beenden. 
Nicht schlecht wie ich finde. 

Grafik/Soundtrack/√úbersetzung:
Erwartet ein gutes altes Pixelspiel. Wer so etwas nicht verkraftet, sollte das Spiel nicht kaufen. Wobei man gestehen muss, dass trotz Pixeloptik alles sch√∂n Detailliert ist und selbst kleinste Gegenst√§nde einem nach kurzen Bildschirmabsuchen ohne Probleme ins Auge fallen. Musik und Hintergrundger√§usche fallen nie nervig aus und passen stimmig in die trostlose Welt aus Rost, Sand und Eisen. 
(Kleiner Spoiler: Die Musik die an der Bushaltestellte kam, war passend zu der ganzen Szene richtig traurig. ... Fand ich klasse!)

Die Englische Sprachausgabe war passend zum Spiel sehr gut und auch √ºber die Deutsche Textausgabe kann ich eigentlich nichts sagen. Das was gesprochen wurde, stand zwar nicht immer Sinngem√§ss da (z.B. Crispins Englischer Kommentar "H√∂rt! H√∂rt!", was als Deutscher Text als "Oho!" √ºbersetzt wurde. ... Fand ich nicht ganz passend aber ist allemal verschmerzbar.) aber ansonsten war sie sehr gut √ºbersetzt. 

Fazit: 10/10 Das Spiel ist sein Geld wert. Kauft es ruhig ohne bedenken und unterst√ºtzt damit die Entwickler. Solch kleine Sch√§tze geh√∂ren sich gef√∂rdert und in die eigene Bibliothek verewigt.
developer_response: Vielen Dank f√ºr die sehr nette und umfassende Bewertung unseres kleinen Spiels. Wir haben das Gl√ºck, einen hervorragenden freiwilligen √úbersetzer f√ºr Deutsch zu haben! Leider lese ich nicht genug Deutsch, um ihm helfen zu k√∂nnen, aber ich denke, er hat viel Sorgfalt und Liebe in den Job gebracht!

author: {'steamid': '76561198982978800', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1566809239}
review:
Se lo han cargado poni√©ndole ese rollo pixel art, he visto las ilustraciones y son una maravilla, muy similar al arte de Keith Thompson, y es una pena que se vea todo pixelado, le quita parte de la belleza que posee, que en este tipo de aventuras es imprescindible puesto que son narrativas, y m√°s teniendo este dise√±o biomec√°nico tan particular y bello.

Otro tema que no entiendo es el encaje de la pantalla, no s√© si es tema de que yo no lo he configurado pero deja una l√≠neas de sangrado a modo de panavision en los laterales muy desagradable, principalmente porque no son homog√©neas. Deber√≠an ampliar las opciones gr√°ficas en el men√∫ para poder elegir el acabado, pixel o original, y extender la configuraci√≥n de la resoluci√≥n de pantalla para poder encajarlo. 

De modo que visto lo visto y los defectos evidentes en el apartado gr√°fico no puedo recomendarlo, tiene demasiados defectos en ese aspecto como para poder sumergirse en la historia e ignorarlos, una pena, porque era prometedor. Este juego en 3D ser√≠a una obra de arte pero en este formato es tosco y absolutamente desagradable de jugar, de hecho me atrever√≠a a decir que este formato es de sobra caduco para un juego de la actualidad.
developer_response:
Lamento mucho leer acerca de tu decepci√≥n con las im√°genes del juego. El arte del juego fue dise√±ado (2009 a 2012) antes de que los monitores de pantalla ancha fueran tan comunes. En realidad, es bastante dif√≠cil rehacer el arte con una resoluci√≥n m√°s alta o una relaci√≥n de aspecto diferente, aunque me doy cuenta de que eso hace que el juego sea menos atractivo para algunos jugadores. Nos hemos centrado en mantener el juego t√©cnicamente compatible, lo que en s√≠ mismo es bastante desafiante, en lugar de tratar de actualizar sus im√°genes para mantener el ritmo de las expectativas cambiantes.

Nada de eso cambia el hecho de que no disfrutaste el juego. Es nuestro trabajo entretener a los jugadores que se arriesgan con Primordia, y si fallamos, debemos asumir la responsabilidad. Por esa raz√≥n, mi pr√°ctica es ofrecer a los jugadores decepcionados una clave para alg√∫n otro juego que puedan disfrutar m√°s. Respaldo muchas obras de caridad y proyectos de Kickstarter usando las ganancias de Primordia, y nunca tengo la oportunidad de jugar los juegos que me dan las llaves. Si est√° interesado en uno, h√°gamelo saber. Mientras tanto, ¬°espero que hayas encontrado otros juegos que disfrutes m√°s que Primordia!

author: {'steamid': '76561198080161294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1566488182}
review:
I'm currently playing this game and it is amazing, especially the dialogue and the ambiance and the graphics, if you like the genre. It reminds me of a blend of Machinarium and Planescape Torment. 

Truly a wonder.

Plus, the devs seems really invested in the community.

-------------

Edit : Finished it (there are multiple endings). Still highly recommend, amazing game !
developer_response:
Thanks for the kind review -- Torment and Machinarium (PS:T especially) were big inspirations for us!

In terms of being committed to the community, I figured it's the least we can do given the great support the community has given us!

author: {'steamid': '76561198093476565', 'num_games_owned': 362, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 625, 'last_played': 1563210534}
review:
Primordia √® un'avventura punta e clicca in cui impersoneremo Horatio Nullbuilt alla ricerca del nucleo di energia che gli hanno rubato. Ambientata in un mondo post apocalittico popolato solo da robot, la trama di Primordia ha degli spunti interessanti, ma che non vengono approfonditi, rendendo alla fine il gioco noioso.

Anche graficamente il risultato √® mediocre. Gli oggetti quasi non si distinguono e quindi la risoluzione degli enigmi risulta spesso complicata soltanto perch√© l'oggetto mancante √® difficilmente individuabile.

Il comparto audio del gioco √® senza lode e infamia, le musiche di sottofondo sono monotone.

La longevit√† √® abbastanza bassa, il gioco si finisce tranquillamente in meno di 10 ore.

Voto 4/10
developer_response:
Mi dispiace che tu abbia avuto un'esperienza cos√¨ mediocre con il gioco, soprattutto perch√© √® chiaro che hai dedicato molto tempo e speranze, come si evince dalla tua attenta recensione.

Sento sempre che c'√® una promessa tra sviluppatori e giocatori, in cui uno sviluppatore invita un giocatore a investire nel gioco emotivamente e mentalmente, e in cambio lo sviluppatore promette un incontro gratificante. Quando ci√≤ non accade, √® come una promessa non mantenuta, qualcosa che richiede, in primo luogo, delle scuse.

Mi piace sempre anche chiedere ai giocatori che sono delusi dal gioco se posso condividere una chiave per qualche altro titolo. Ho un gran numero di Kickstarters e bundle di beneficenza che ho supportato utilizzando i proventi di Primordia, e sembra giusto (soprattutto perch√© non ho tempo di divertirmi da solo) per dargli ai giocatori che non hanno avuto un buon affare con Primordia stessa. Per favore fammi sapere se sei interessato. Puoi inviarmi un'e-mail a mark@wormwoodstudios.com o inviarmi un messaggio su Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040332670', 'num_games_owned': 397, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1564973750}
review:
This is a solid OLD SChOOL point and click game. if thats your cup of tea great this is enjoyable with characters who are interesting enough and a story that is fine but where this game tries to do well is in the puzzles which i personally found many of them convoluted and obtuse. i used a guide on them but that kinda ruined the immersion. i will say the developer is very active on fourms and helps anyone. i do wish there was a button to see all interactable objects as that would solve many of the puzzles problems. Also better explaining right click functions would fix one of the most frustraing puzzles.


This game is a new gem that plays TOO MUCH like the old school games with all the obtuseness and none of the handholding/helpful elements modern games of the same genre have today if your okay with that then i recomend this but personlly i didnt love it as much as i thought i would . i think i would personally want a meh rank but since i dont i cant recomend this.(unless you like the old school style)
developer_response:
Hey Shawn -- Sorry about the frustrating experience, but thanks for leaving a review, which seems fair and balanced to me. We certainly did want to create more of an old school experience, but it's not for everyone.

I have a huge set of Steam keys for other games that I either backed on Kickstarter or got in charity bundles backed using Primordia proceeds, and my policy is to offer players who have time/interest to pick from them when Primordia comes up short. You have any interest? If so, shoot me an email at mark@wormwoodstudios.com.

Sorry again that you didn't enjoy the game more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001642978', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 760, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 760, 'last_played': 1564435026}
review: Loved this game. Great story, great art, great music. A love letter to 90's era adventure games with a Adeptus Mechanicus Warhammer 40K vibe. Started it 3 years ago with the intention of finishing it one day and I'm very glad I did. It did not overstay its welcome. Took me roughly 5-6 hours to beat. I got stuck *ONCE* and had to consult a walkthrough. It was probably due to my own stupidity rather than a poorly designed puzzle, but other than that the puzzles were fair and challenged me to think a little outside the box. It's also the first game I actually got all the achievements for.
developer_response: Glad you liked the game! I‚Äôm impressed that you stuck with it over three years!

author: {'steamid': '76561198128667278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 517, 'last_played': 1555732624}
review:
PROS

- Excellent story and setting, with very interesting themes and well developed characters.
- Beautiful artwork for a pixel graphic game
- Great music and atmospheric sounds, as well as very good voice acting
- Story with good choice and consequence, different ways of solving problems and endings

CONS

- Tough puzzles which may not be easy for players who do not play Point and Click adventures in the past (Like me)
- Some resolutions of said puzzles are not completely logical

OVERALL: Excellent game, with an awesome story, great characters (I loved Crispin!) which makes you want to continue playing in order to see how everything unfolds. Some puzzles can be very difficult for not seasoned players like myself, but that is totally subjective. I have to admit that these puzzles did not diminish the game experience for me, but can be for some players.

SCORE: 10/10
developer_response: Thanks so much for the kind review and for persevering with the tough puzzles!

author: {'steamid': '76561198053215445', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1499052864}
review:
I've played this game some time ago, and it stuck with me till this day. It's certainly one of the best point 'n click games that I have ever played, and probably the best story, setting and atmosphere.
 
It presents a mesmerizing world, that seemed to me like a mix between things like Nausicaa, Wall-E, Dune and Moebius comics, among other references. With inspired writing and charismatic characters, it can go from light-hearted dialogues to grim and philosophical remarks, with a very competent voice acting.
 
I normally play these kind of games for the mood, story and setting, so I can't say that I remember specifics about the puzzles after all this time, but I do remember that they were what I expected at the time.
 
I usually prefer to play on consoles, but games like these are the reason why I come back to PC gaming from time to time. To remind me of the truly magnificent games some indie developers can create when they put their passion on something, and how you could never know about them if you don't come back to see what you're missing.
 
And I am really glad I didn't miss Primordia.
developer_response: What a beautiful and generous review! Thank you so much for taking the time share your kind words with us -- we're very lucky to have such players.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041983024', 'num_games_owned': 487, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1563888898}

author: {'steamid': '76561198125186393', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1563814461}

author: {'steamid': '76561198049111597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1563484597}
review: For the most part, I liked this game. However, there is a mission-critical puzzle that, even with the answer in-hand, I still could not reverse-engineer a path to the solution.
developer_response:
Sorry to hear you hit a roadblock, and even more sorry to hear that it didn't make sense even in hindsight -- I know how frustrating that can be. Can I ask what puzzle this was? It's helpful for us in designing future puzzles to know where people got stuck.

Also, given my general dismay when players come away unhappy from Primordia:  I have a bunch of keys to other games that I either backed in Kickstarter or obtained in charity bundles that I funded using Primordia's proceeds, and since I have no time to play, I like to share them with people who were unsatisfied with our game. Do you have any interest?

author: {'steamid': '76561198069561373', 'num_games_owned': 362, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 518, 'last_played': 1563626031}
review:
When I first run this game, it felt strangely familiar. Uniicc, the giant robot...suddenly I knew! The art style was almost the same as old Terry Pratchett book covers made by Josh Kirby. The Dark Side of the Sun, Strata, Discworld when it was weird and completely different, ah it made me feel like 15 or more years younger :) It also has that great kind of humour too.
Otherwise the game is decent point and click adventure, if you're not stupid like me, you don't even have to use the good old try-everything-on-everything method.
developer_response: Kirby has indeed been a huge inspiration for Primordia‚Äôs artist!

author: {'steamid': '76561197990204173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 635, 'last_played': 1563203137}

author: {'steamid': '76561198049049987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1562976356}
review:
Overall a really well-written game. 
Great world-building and atmosphere. The characters are likable and easy to get invested into, puzzles made sense and were fair.
The story has a nice arc with satisfying conclusion(s).
Music,  art and voice-acting fit great.
Would definitely look forward to more stuff set in this universe.
developer_response:
Glad to hear you enjoyed it so much! Thanks for leaving such a nice review!

We have a bit more stuff in the setting, including a spin-off story, on Primordia-Game.com.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050016554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 517, 'playtime_forever': 685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 685, 'last_played': 1562926199}
review:
Primordia r√©ussit l'exploit de nous immerger dans un univers anti-immersif au possible. Franchement, nous faire jouer des robots plus ou moins intelligents dans un monde o√π l'Apocalypse a fonctionn√© (on n'y croyait plus √† force de survivals), o√π l'homme a √©t√© retir√© de l'√©quation, mais qu'est-ce que je fais l√†, moi √™tre de chair, de sang et d'√©motion, totalement impropre √† la logique rationnelle ?! 

Et pourtant √ßa marche au-del√† de toute esp√©rance et je me suis √©tonnamment attach√© √† mes deux h√©ros. Primordia, en lib√©rant cette soci√©t√© de toute obligation vis √† vis de l'homme, ni ob√©issance fa√ßon Asimov, ni opposition fa√ßon Terminator, offre aux robots leur libert√© d'agir, penser et √©voluer par eux-m√™mes et leur donne, par l√† m√™me, une personnalit√©, relativisant la fronti√®re entre les couples (conscience,√©motion) et (conscience,logique).  Il y a du Neuromancien dans Primordia (avis tr√®s personnel non √©tay√©^^). Ce fut un r√©el plaisir de mener cette aventure au bout au milieu de tous ces "individus" pittoresques et d√©couvrir leur "soci√©t√©". Et comme le jeu offre des alternatives pour la r√©solution de certaines √©nigmes et pour la fin, j'ai m√™me fait un deuxi√®me parcours (7h+4h). Je crois que c'est ma premi√®re fois pour un point&click, il faut dire que j'avais rat√© un √©l√©ment n√©cessaire √† la "bonne" fin qui est celle qui me motive toujours le plus. Quoique bonne fin, hum, si √ßa a d√©raill√© une fois... 

Que dire de plus. C'est du bon point&click classique objets/inventaire/discussions/indices sans errements qui rendraient un guide indispensable √† tous les coins de rue, mais assez dense pour ne pas s'ennuyer. Le petit acolyte offre des possibilit√©s de manipulation suppl√©mentaires. Si l'histoire et les sujets √©voqu√©s sont plut√¥t tristes, les personnages hauts en couleur et les r√©parties fr√©quemment cinglantes, d√©cal√©es ou rigolotes en font un jeu o√π l'on sourit souvent. C'est une aventure l√©g√®re en surface avec en filigrane mati√®re √† r√©flexion sur de nombreux sujets plus lourds, au joueur de creuser ou pas.

A moins d'une allergie totale au visuel pixelis√©, c'est bien fait mais ce n'est pas tout neuf, je ne peux que conseiller fortement Primordia √† tout amateur de SF d'anticipation, d'IA et de point&click.
developer_response: Quel examen gentil et attentionn√©. Merci beaucoup de l'avoir √©crit!

author: {'steamid': '76561198168494745', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 531, 'last_played': 1562367613}
review: I thought this game was great. The music and atmosphere were excellent, and the whole man-robot-god concept was really clever and thought provoking. The dialogue and interaction between Horatio and Crispin was both funny and engaging, and a good way to give subtle hints to help you through this type of game, where you often get stuck and bored stupid (although there was still one point that was very awkward to figure out what to do). The only downsides are that it's a bit short (but I guess it is a budget game) and the ending I got was very abrupt, although that might be because I wasn't smart enough to get a better one. All in all, very much recommended, especially if you like old school point and clicks.
developer_response: Thanks for the kind words -- glad you found Crispin helpful, but sorry the ending felt a bit abrupt. We did do a little spin-off story (http://primordia-game.com/fallen.html) but I'm not sure it really addresses that concern. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198041951711', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 600, 'last_played': 1562256043}
review:
+ Great story-line and concept, great old-school pixel art, good characters and voice-acting, and all-together a worthy addition to the old point & click genre. 

+ Unlike the old games, with enough patience, lateral thinking, and mouse clicking, its possible to finish it without any external or online help. 

- Not a very long game, though wasn't expecting it to be.
developer_response: Thanks! Glad you enjoyed it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198411544332', 'num_games_owned': 145, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1562188862}
review: Brilliant, well written and well paced story line, you really start caring for the characters. Puzzles are sometimes difficult but not impossible.. Most of the time you just need to think logically. I personally loved the art style, music and the terrific atmosphere of the game. The voice acting and writing was a times sincere, silly and somewhat moving. A great achievement.
developer_response: Thank you very much for the kind words and high praise. So glad to hear that you enjoyed the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970609941', 'num_games_owned': 1773, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1561886995}
review: Pretty nice background story and setting. Had some problems progressing, but thanks to your annoying sidekick there never was a real blocker. I like that things can change with another playthrough, but honestly I am not sure I would play it again, nice as it was.
developer_response: Thanks! Glad Crispin was helpful (if annoying)!

author: {'steamid': '76561198091813179', 'num_games_owned': 76, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1594980287}
review: Originally experienced Primordia on a demo disk and liked everything about it from the start. From the story concept, beautiful pixel art visuals, voice acting and of course music score. It was the first game that I bought on Steam, which also got me into the Wadjet Eye Games series. There is something here I found quite intriguing with playing as a robot in a world long past the robot-human war, who still wonders what its human creators were really like. Especially with you yourself being a human playing this game. It made me feel both disheartened and hopeful all at the same time. Ultimately, I recommend diving into the depths of the world of Primordia and seeing what it has to offer, and what challenging questions and thoughts it leaves you with.
developer_response:
A demo disk! That brings me back!

I‚Äôm glad you enjoyed the game, and the mix of emotions you describe is exactly what we were shooting for, so it made me pleased to read that.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990384087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 714, 'last_played': 1476556184}
review:
Morbidly beautiful, grim, but somewhat hopeful and life-asserting post-human adventure.

Great setting, great dialogues, great story and great art sprinkled with apposite humor. If you love great stories, adventure games, science-fiction and can withstand pixelated graphics in low resolution (with great pixel art though), you should definetely try it.
developer_response: Thanks for the lovey review!

author: {'steamid': '76561198036974519', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1561693916}
review: Was never a fan of point-and-click adventrues,but this game became a favorite. The story is interesting, characters can be both serious and silly. Noticed a few cool references.The setting, art and atmosphere are amazing.
developer_response: Glad you liked it! Hope it entices you to try more point-and-click adventures -- I think there's a lot of amazing stuff out there.  You might like Beneath a Steel Sky?

author: {'steamid': '76561198083614522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 599, 'last_played': 1499143528}

author: {'steamid': '76561198024882754', 'num_games_owned': 527, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 791, 'last_played': 1561816681}
review: Gorgeous art style, good voice acting with a well written story. I felt like I was back in the 90s playing the genre classics

author: {'steamid': '76561198007710099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 535, 'last_played': 1558992226}
review:
This is a beautiful game whose story and atmosphere will pull you into it's rusting and decaying world. 

Most of the puzzles are pretty straigtforward with a one or two occasions where it was hard to spot an item on the screen, but other than that it's a more than solid point&click adventure.

Even if you're not a sci-fi fan this is a great narative experience with philosophical aspects on faith and religion as well as legislation in a society.
developer_response: What a beautiful review! I'm glad you enjoyed the game and found its themes engaging.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093050932', 'num_games_owned': 1598, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1561547461}
review:
Visibilmente ispirato, come meccaniche e grafica, ai gloriosi punta e clicca degli anni '90, questo gioco non deluder√† gli appassionati del genere.
Gli enigmi non sono semplicistici, ma seguono comunque una logica e sono razionali (a differenza di molti giochi degli anni '90, quando usare un pollo di gomma era cosa comune), quindi bene o male ci si arriva anche senza avere costantemente sottomano una guida o tentare sistematicamente ogni combinazione di oggetti ed azioni per ore.
Ambientato in un futuro post-apocalittico abitato da robot, dove degli umani non rimane altro che una manciata di leggende e miti, il racconto parte con il classico setting dell'antieroe dal passato sconosciuto (perfino a s√© stesso) che cerca di farsi gli affari suoi lontano da quello che rimane della societ√† ed arriva al capitolo finale dove si scopre il passato del nostro antieroe che si ritrover√† in una posizione di dover scegliere il destino non solo suo, ma anche di tutta la vita robotica che ancora sopravvive sul pianeta. Per quanto l'impostazione non risulti qualcosa di nuovo, il plot √® godibile e si sviluppa ben articolato, svelando non solo la storia del personaggio, ma anche dell'umanit√† e dei robot.
Un particolare della meccanica di gioco √® l'implementazione di una sorta di "scelta e conseguenza" grazie alla quale possiamo risolvere in pi√π modi le situazioni che si presentano durante il gioco e che andranno ad influenzare in modi diversi, ma marginali, la storia. In realt√† non c'√® possibilit√† di un game over, qualsiasi scelta si faccia si avr√† sempre la possibilit√† di avanzare, ma i personaggi ed i dettagli delle ultime scene vengono influenzati dalle scelte fatte durante la storia.
Un altro particolare da non sottovalutare √® quello che in ogni caso si pu√≤ avere ognuno dei finali multipli dalle azioni fatte durante la scena finale, quindi non c'√® bisogno di rigiocare tutto l'intero gioco perch√© nella prima schermata si fatta una scelta invece che un'altra.
developer_response: Mille grazie per la recensione gentile e approfondita! Vorrei ancora che avessimo una traduzione italiana per raggiungere pi√π giocatori - forse un giorno! Abbiamo un paio di persone che ci provano.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990421528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 878, 'last_played': 1669576102}
review:
I really like this sci fi adventure, it keeps you guessing and even frustrates you along the way, but you want to continue the story line regardless, I absolutely can see a sequel to this great game. Now if only the ship can be re-powered and there can be Crispin 2.0. :)

Review Update:

There is so much more the devs in regards to the story line could do. There is a lot of what if and what was from the beginning part of the game, that could lead to a new end, there should be an add-on to the continuation where the original story line left off, what about the war, what about the ship, what about the new future and there could even be a pre-quel to start of it all, the factions during the war, so much greatness on the horizon! :)
developer_response: Thanks for the kind words! We did do a quasi-sequel spin-off story, "Fallen" (http://primordia-game.com/fallen.html), though it doesn't follow Crispin, alas! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198002134811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 187, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1453077994}
review: Primordia is a very imaginative point-and-click game set in the distant future, when humanity is the stuff of legend and rumor. It's got a great old-school vibe to it, and the story is engaging enough to keep you pressing forward. The puzzles can be a bit tricky sometimes, but with persistence it's doable. The dialog has a lot of humor, which keeps the setting from becoming too bleak. Overall it's not perfect, but it's a very solid and nostalgic game. Recommended!
developer_response: Thanks! A very generous review!

author: {'steamid': '76561197969460175', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1066, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1066, 'last_played': 1434844782}
review:
A fantastic adventure - I found the dystopian storyline to be really interesting, and the soundtrack set the tone of the game perfectly. Anybody still interested in the game after beating it should also hunt down the audiobook on the developer's Youtube channel which has a little side-story that fleshes out the universe even further.

My only problem was that a couple of the late-game puzzles required me to bend my brain a bit more than I was used to and took awhile to figure out, but YMMV - honestly they weren't that bad. This game is overall just great!

author: {'steamid': '76561198120947498', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1561030893}
review:
One of the most interesting games I have played in an incredibly long time.  As a person who loves super bleak post-apocalyptic worlds (Kenshi and The Road to name a couple) this game makes itself so distinct in its setting. It tackles the very interesting themes of creationism, existentialism, the impact of war and artificial intelligence and what it is capable of. I would have never thought of a world where all humans have gone extinct but before that occurred they invented robots that were capable of free-thinking and would end up worshiping their creators as a god. But then have a tyrant super AI make the religion illegal like this is some shit out of the Spanish Inquisition. They make the robots feel a lot more like humans but I genuinely like that about the game. Then there is the art style. I love the warped and sometime incomprehensible designs of some buildings and landscapes. It gives this alien feel that tells the player that this is no longer humanity's home. The low resolution feels like it was intentional but I'm not the biggest fan of it. I'm not too sure if they did it for the retro feel since point and click adventure games were a big thing in the 90s. This brings up another thing. These devs managed to make someone my age who has never played a point and click adventure game not only interested in the game but to play it all the way though. Some of the puzzles will definitely need some high IQ logic and memory skills, something I do not hold. If you are big dum dum like me just look up a walkthrough for the puzzle you are stuck on but try to solve each one on your own at first. The story and the writing are pretty solid. At first the story starts off a little basic but it eventually branches out into something bigger. And even though I saw it coming since it's all explained in the trailer I was still thoroughly invested in the game's story. The writing certainly helps. All the characters are very interesting and I wish there was more I could learn on a lot of their backstories. This game overall was an incredibly solid experience that had very little hiccups along the way. I'd give this game a 9/10 you should definitely play this game. 

(Also when it goes on sale it goes down to under 2 bucks so pick it up)
developer_response: Thanks for taking the time to share this kind and thorough review. We‚Äôre really lucky to have such players!

author: {'steamid': '76561198245166628', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 582, 'last_played': 1561181786}

We did do a little spin-off story, though it‚Äôs not a game: http://www.primordia-game.com/fallen.html

No other sequel/prequel plans, but you never know!

author: {'steamid': '76561198148026607', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 862, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 542, 'last_played': 1561499267}
