author: {'steamid': '76561198004120981', 'num_games_owned': 9072, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1589728753}
review:
[h1]Summary[/h1]
A point & click adventure game with a very interesting storyline and great world building with branching endings based on your actions and dialog.

[b]Pros[/b]
+ Great story
+ Great music
+ Great artstyle
+ Great voice acting

[h1]Review[/h1]
[b]Overview[/b]
Primordia is a very good point & click adventure game that I would highly recommend anyone who enjoys story focused games to play. Although Primordia plays like any other game in the same genre it truly stands out from the crafted world and story. Many of the actions you choose to take has some effect on the world, some may be small while others completely change the course of your story.
The world of Primordia is so carefully crafted from the inhabitants, the environment, and the music to make the world feel so alive and real making it so easy to immerse oneself.

[b]Story[/b]
At first the story may come off simple and cliche but as you play more and explore the world, things start appearing more than it seems. There is an obvious and straight forward path available where you simply play the formula and reach the end easy but exploration and curiosity may reward you with more twists and revelations to the story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050286520', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1503002508}
review:
Un punta-e-clicca dalla trama affascinante che se seguita a dovere assorbir√† con facilit√† tutta la vostra attenzione. La grafica non √® stupefacente ma le caratterizzazioni dei personaggi, le splendide ambientazioni e le atmosfere che il gioco comunica vi faranno dimenticare in fretta questo dettaglio. Ottima narrazione e una gran variet√† di dialoghi faranno da contorno alla vostra avventura che avr√† un esito totalmente differente in base alle scelte che quasi inconsciamente compirete durante il gameplay. L'esito finale della storia √® tutt'altro che scontato, tenetelo a mente.

Oltre alla grafica il gioco pecca nell'area "Opzioni" la quale √® povera di "settaggi" per la risoluzione schermo e quant'altro.
Un ultimo dato negativo lo si pu√≤ riscontrare durante il gameplay nel quale ci troveremo pi√π volte a combinare oggetti totalmente a caso dato che non ci verranno forniti molti indizi sul "cosa dovremmo fare" per avanzare nella trama.

Ottimo titolo che sprona il giocatore a completare nuovamente il gioco per ottenere un finale migliore. Lo consiglio vivamente soprattutto durante i saldi, grazie per l'attenzione.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978777651', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1508639038}
review:
I loved it. 

Key points for me were: nice art, great atmosphere, interesting setting, likeable characters, and engaging story. 

Primordia is a solid point and click adventure overall but also stands above the crowd in a few ways. I really liked the portrayal of the main character; you get a good feel for his ideals and personality through play and he is much more defined than your standard "blank slate" style main character. The dynamic between the main character and his sidekick is very enjoyable as well. The story has strong mystery elements and piecing together the lore of the setting and the history of your character as it progresses is highly satisfying. The game also explores some philosophical issues in a way that didn't feel forced or hamfisted, instead characters' philosophy drive their actions and affect the world in a naturalistic manner. 

Overall I would highly recommend Primordia to anyone with even a passing interest in adventure games, especially any fans of science fiction and strong world-building.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974210341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 1110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1110, 'last_played': 1492878971}
review:
An all-around great p&c adventure. Lots of beatiful art, good writing and voice acting, and a broad range of well-crafted puzzles make for a fun experience. Also has a variety of different endings if you're the type who likes to search around for getting them all. My only regret is that there are a few metahints that the developers had to cut things shorter than they intended, but you're still likely to get 10+ hours of playtime out of it.

In short: if you're a fan of p&c adventures, this should definitely be one for your wishlist!

author: {'steamid': '76561198002552675', 'num_games_owned': 393, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1508614633}
review:
As someone who isn't a fan of point-and-click adventure game, mostly due to the limitations of having to scour the screen for things to interact with, I still have to recommend this to anyone looking for an interesting story-based game, with great voice acting and an engaging plot.

A tip from the wise, though, take a look at a walkthrough if you get stuck and take your time! There is a different ending depending on how well you complete the different plot lines throughout the game.

Highly recommended for fans and newbies (like me) alike!

author: {'steamid': '76561198005705060', 'num_games_owned': 675, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1662656970}
review:
I recommend Primordia with almost no reservations.  If you enjoy adventure games at all, it is absolutely worth the price.  The graphics are gorgeous, and it tells an interesting story.  The worst that can be said is that the puzzles are average, and include some things which are dissaproved of today, like not being able to use an item in your inventory until you have spoken to a certain person.

But you'll enjoy yourself while figuring those out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008016832', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1508554418}
review: 8 hours for a playthrough. This game is story with a bit of puzzle. The characters and world are amazing and imaginative.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090710989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1508107844}
review:
No game is perfect, but this one comes pretty close.

My favourite thing about this game is how optimistic it was. Even though it takes place in a dying, apparently hostile world, it never feels hopeless. I really like that most of the problems in the game can be solved by talking, and that none of the characters are entirely good or evil [spoiler](except Crispin, who is pure good)[/spoiler]. 

Even though the story is short, I've found myself thinking about it several days after completing the game. I wish there were more games like this.

Highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198198301065', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1561859399}

author: {'steamid': '76561198044926497', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1403420726}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999921146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 423, 'playtime_forever': 787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 787, 'last_played': 1507817113}
review:
Un bon petit jeu d'aventure avec une histoire "post-apocalypse" relativement bien ficel√©e.

Tout d'abord il faut dire que j'ai √©t√© surpris pas les graphismes au d√©but (je m'attendais √† quelquechose de plus "fin") mais je m'y suis fait (peut-√™tre ai-je mal configur√© ?) et ce petit air r√©tro mais rappell√© mes premiers jeux sur ordinateurs. Au final les dessins sont quand m√™me de qualit√© et on s'y retrouve plut√¥t bien.

Le vrai "plus" est l'histoire et l'enchainement plut√¥t logique des actions que vous allez devoir mener pour arriver √† la (les) fin (s). On s'attache aux personnages et j'ai cherch√© √† en savoir plus sur ce qui se tramait r√©ellement d'ailleurs je mis suis pris au jeu et l'ai boucl√© une premi√®re fois en moins de  deux jours (7-8 heures). Le GamePlay est tr√®s classique et les √©nigmes ou puzzles sont plut√¥t bien int√©gr√©s. Au cours du jeu, plusieurs √©v√®nements pr√©sentent des r√©solutions diff√©rentes, cel√† ne change pas fondamentalement votre cheminement dans l'histoire mais c'est quand m√™me √† souligner, cela se voit surtout lors des derni√®res √©v√®nements avec les diff√©rentes fins possibles.

Question difficult√© il est assez facile car une aide est int√©gr√©e de base, je m'en suis aper√ßu tardivement (on peut la d√©sactiver dans le menu du jeu). Cette aide se pr√©sente [spoiler] sous la forme votre compagnon, je trouvais aussi qu'il donnait souvent de bons conseils! [/spoiler]

Bug : le jeu ne se lan√ßait pas au d√©but (√©cran noir) en lan√ßant le fichier Winsetup.exe (r√©pertoire Steam de votre jeu sur votre PC) le probl√®me a √©t√© r√©solu en modifiant certains param√®tres. Je l'avais √©galement mis en mode comptabilit√© Windows 7.

Le jeu est en Anglais mais... il existe un Patch Textes en Fran√ßais sur le site de l'√©diteur (pas chez l'√©diteur en fait mais ici : http://primordia-game.com/french.html, merci pour ce travail de traduction).

Vraiment int√©ressant, souvent en promotion, ne passez pas √† c√¥t√©.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995935948', 'num_games_owned': 698, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1617815904}
review: Fantastic adventure game. If you liked anything else by Wadjet Eye Games then give this a try. That developer knows exactly what point and click adventure games should be like and they just keep serving up great game after great game. This one has great characters, a great story and great puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071592472', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1507680034}
review: Highly recommended. Don't be mislead by the graphics; despite the low resolution, everything else about this game is of the highest quality - fully voiced, a deep and interesting story, multiple solutions and endings, excellent writing, and well balanced game play. Some of the puzzles are tricky but the game proves ample in-character hints and finally solving a puzzle that had left you stumped is both rewarding and hilariously simple in retrospect. If you enjoy story telling and interesting world building this is a must play game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114070353', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1553810520}

author: {'steamid': '76561198019283303', 'num_games_owned': 309, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1471071762}
review: I've played several Wadjet Eye games, and really love their aesthetic, but so far Primordia has their best story so far, I feel. The writing, voice acting, visuals, puzzles, and overall design are all top notch. It's a very short game, and probably not a lot of replay value, but the story and ideas in it are so good, that it makes up for any other shortcomings. Definitely makes you think afterward!

author: {'steamid': '76561198214392393', 'num_games_owned': 318, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 624, 'last_played': 1506704735}
review:
A dark and interesting, if somewhat straightforward, post-apocalypse story about robots struggling to survive the aftermath of a great war.  The aesthetic is dark too - almost too dark; it's a little rough on the eyes in some places.  But, the gameplay is very user-friendly, and the characters are, for the most part, decently acted.  Well worth the buy!

https://youtu.be/jStuDipOxCI

author: {'steamid': '76561198016962210', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1506614920}
review:
Excellent music, voices, gameplay, and art. Good value, go get!
There're always negative things to remark on. The drab colour palette initially threw me off, and while the game quickly reeled me in, it was a recurring annoyance. Clues and items would be lost in the low contrasts, and hitboxes are sometimes small and inaccurate to make that worse. Not a major complaint at all, and more than offset by the helpful and very witty sidekick. 

References and jokes often made me laugh, and the puzzles were generally very good, though never insanely difficult or counter intuitive (like the Monkey Island tofu head, jesus christ). Style was gorgeous. Worldbuilding in general was top notch. Hope to see this universe again someday.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068508853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1506602233}
review: A visually dark apocalyptic game where humanities mechanical offspring are struggling to survive. Interface was generally straight forward, maybe a tiny bit clunky but better than games with a similar structure. Music fit perfectly with the scenery of the game and it was all around a very pleasant 4-6 hours gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972941429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 210, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1506407402}
review:
As someone who plays a lot of adventure games, I can't recommend Primordia highly enough.  The story and worldbuilding are outstanding, the actors deliver universally solid performances, and the atmosphere is wonderfully crafted.  The characters are interesting, layered and well written, and really work to draw you into the world.

What really stands out though, are the puzzles.  In many newer adventure games, these act largely as roadblocks to progress, and fall back on tried and true formulas we've all solved many times before.  Primordia has some great new puzzle ideas that I don't recall seeing in other adventure games, as well as puzzles with multiple solutions.  They're well integrated with the story, and are challenging without being illogical or ridiculous.

Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984999040', 'num_games_owned': 309, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 507, 'last_played': 1590289566}
review: So good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198261895606', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 574, 'last_played': 1506293814}
review: Primordia has an awesome atmosphere that drags you into its apocalyptic world and holds you there. The puzzles are fair, story is deep and gameplay is long enough. Characters make you both smile and or leave with a bitter feeling. There are many endings to the story all of which surely leave you with a feeling that will last for some time. I guess that's what I liked the most about the game. I love the games that still make you think about itself after you're done with it. Primordia has become my favorite point-click adventure game. It is a hidden gem among its counterparts out there. Buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024358566', 'num_games_owned': 422, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1501577653}
review:
An atmospheric point-and-click adventure with good plot, excellent voice acting and humor. It has multiple endings and replay value, even though you can see most endings just by loading saves. I love the art style and robot designs. 
IMO one of the best point&click games out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004923777', 'num_games_owned': 222, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 911, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 911, 'last_played': 1506207363}
review:
Primordia's best part is the great unique and deep scifi story. The characters and dialogues are well written. The themes are serious and are often a nod to our today's society. On the other hand the game is also really funny because of your sidekick's comments. I can't think of any hour in which I didn't laugh several times.

The graphics may look too old, but that's also the charm and isn't distracting you from the nice artstyle.

Because it is an Point&Click Adventure and you are not familiar with them it could took you few attempts for certain puzzles even resulting in looking at guides, but it is worth it. In general it is easy to complete.

If you are a SciFi fan, Primordia is a MUST-play!
The story alone is worth buying it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994612766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1506144406}
review: A short but quite fun puzzle game. The world it builds is engrossing and real, and the challenges quite fun. There are a few bumps (the game does little to no hand holding, and there are occassional pieces where you need to do something unintuitive to progress), but over all this is an excellent game, and one of the most intriguing post apocalyptic worlds I've ever seen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026357864', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 629, 'last_played': 1481491064}
review: it's great

author: {'steamid': '76561198056750415', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 530, 'last_played': 1505817195}
review:
Lovely drawn and animated post-apocalyptic adventure in the style of the early 90s point & click games. Immersive story, snarky, well-written dialogues - and puzzles that are usually quite plausible (nothing outlandlishly absurd).

Sadly the graphics-resolution isn't great and the game is rather short, but these are the only points of criticism really. All in all the game is quite outstanding and an example of good storytelling and game-design. Definitely worth getting it if you like adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011081065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1505753277}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025819815', 'num_games_owned': 701, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1430822016}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009301811', 'num_games_owned': 654, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 928, 'last_played': 1505564139}
review:
Primordia is a Chandler-esque point and click adventure set in a dystopian wasteland. It does fantastically with art, voice acting and plotting but falls a little short with design and original story. Still it is a fantastic game worth your time.

Wadjet has the production quality down.  While the visuals are still pixel-art, the quality and detail rich world are superb. Visual design is reminiscent of Mad Max, the world is a dystopian nomadic future. However, the color palette does leave you wanting as the game is entirely brown and gray.  This is understandable due to the setting being a post-apocalyptic world, but it makes places feel smaller and objects in the scene indistinguishable from one another.  That said the world is actually full of characters. NPCs move freely about with their own purpose, unrelated to the story but framing the world. 

Game design is closer to standard point and click than Wadjet‚Äôs previous Blackwell series.  You find objects, rub two of them together and get a new object. But there are a few problems.  Pixel hunting in this game is abundant.  I had to refer to a guide multiple times only to find out there was some inconspicuous spot on screen that was clickable. This is not just a failing of the art but a failing of design. If something is vital for game progression it should be noticeable inside the massively detailed visuals. With the abundances of clickable spots and NPCs that do nothing it is easy for little things to get lost in the details. There are also some awkward quizzes that kind of pop up out of nowhere, but they are mainly for achievements. But despite that there are some interesting choices.  You have multiple solutions to problems. Some are just for variety, but others actually affect the possible endings in the game. With that in mind, choice matter, so save often.

The first part of the story plays out like a dystopian techno-fantasy, but once the setting changes to the city the style changes somewhat sharply.  The second part of the story resembles Raymond Chandler novel.  A gruff character minding his own business gets pulled into a conspiracy that only he can sort out. Also there is a dame and a bunch noir-esque characters. Overall, the themes are nothing new, you can see similar from Planet of the Apes, Mad Max, or Wall-E. Despite the un-originality of the plot, it is well written. The main character Horatio Nullbuilt has a few interesting parallels to the Shakespearian Horatio, but this time playing the lead and foil to man.  The multiple endings are quite varied.  The Characters ultimate choice for his sense of justice is entirely up to the player.  

Primordia suffers a bit from pixel hunting but overall is a fantastic game. It has great visuals, great voice acting and an interesting story where choices matter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091346146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 771, 'last_played': 1635933426}
review: I payed for this game after seeing the preview on steam. This game is great. Great music, great atmosphere, great puzzles and great writing. I definitely enjoyed every minute of playing this game. It's not overly complicated, it's scenic, everything's a rusty old robot looking for purpose in a world covered by sand dunes. An ancient war destroyed everything and yet things still need to be put right. Multiple endings, all of which I enjoyed figuring out, just save before that last great decision and you can see them all. GGWP Developers, if you ever make a sequel I would buy it in a heartbeat. Just don't pull a Paradox Games move and charge out the bum for it. Thank you. Probably one of my few decent UP VOTE reviews amid a torrential shit-storm of DOWN VOTE reviews I've been forced to deal out to some less compassionate companies. 5/5 mutha lickin' stars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102808034', 'num_games_owned': 484, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 659, 'last_played': 1504515507}
review:
Fun little point and click.  The time played is because of going back a couple times to do the achievements, but before that, there are a finite number of items (and unlike lots of other PaC's not much else to distract you or try to trick you)
so i blew through the game pretty quick.

That being said, i really liked the artwork (despite being pixelated) and the storyline was very cool.  Put that together with a G.E.C.K. reference and i give this one a thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079462590', 'num_games_owned': 260, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 795, 'last_played': 1479776659}
review: "In the beginning, all was still and silent. Then Man, the All-Builder spoke the Word, and the Word begat the Code, and so the world began to spin. Thus dawned the Primordium, the first age, the age of building."

author: {'steamid': '76561198006287400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 736, 'last_played': 1504447347}
review:
THE best point and click adventure game I have played yet. I loved the music, voice acting and story. Don't let the brown screenshots put you off, this game is way more interesting and fun then it appears!

- Great main characters (particularly love the sidekick crispin's voice acting)
- Really fun puzzles that were logical 
- Didn't get stuck on a puzzle for longer than 10 minutes 
- Yet, didn't feel too easy either!

The story is really thought provoking and the dialogues are really engaing and fun to read, I immediately felt imersed and just really enjoyed every second of the game.

Wish there was a sequel!

NOTES:
- Make sure to check out the .exe in the installation folder to get the game somewhat easier to see and play on a typical 1080 screen (look in the steam forum discussions for further help)
- The steam overlay can bug out the dialogie, simply save and reload the game to fix

author: {'steamid': '76561198064360564', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1246, 'last_played': 1498881015}
review: So many deep and timeless ideas within this story. God, religion, individualism vs collectivism, justice, emotion vs rationality, sacrifice for the greater good, propety rights, etc. Very well done, highly recommended!

review: Fantastic game. The story was very well done. The characters were fantastic and the voicing really brought everything to life. I especially enjoyed hearing Logan Cunningham (of Bastion, Transistor, and Pyre fame) as the voice of the main character. The art was great too and it really showed off what the pixelated style could do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142201100', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 864, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 667, 'last_played': 1631343727}
review:
This game is something that should be experienced by yourself. It creates a world that is captivating in it's complexity, beautiful in it's presentation and enjoyable the whole way through.

The story and voice acting are wonderful and their best marks. The gameplay (though I'm not usually a fan of point-and-click-adventure games) is rewarding and well-worth the investment of time.

Only problem I have with it is that kinda' early on it can seem pretty hard to know where to go, or what to do. But once you get down to it that melts away.

Primordia is probably my 11th personal favorite of all time, if only on style alone. Buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023019965', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 1155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1136, 'last_played': 1534643883}
review:
Watching a good Science fiction movie was always a rare experience to have, even more so an original one....
Playing a good and original Science fiction game....that's even less probable, it feels like finding a very special treasure.
Good words have been around for Primordia since it came out in 2012 (I'm now playing it for the first time in 2017) and i can say it's all pretty much justified. 
The game has a good story, with interesting characters, both main and secondary ones. It has an interesting beginning, a well handled middle and an ending ( and a pretty good one at that, although that depends on which ending you get). 

Besides been good or bad, it's always satisfying to see that the creator of the game has put as much dedication to the ending(s) of the game as the beginning. The game has a good flow all around and it (almost) never comes down. It's 97% good, which is a rare thing in itself.
The game has a late 1990s graphic adventure style, although it is from 2012. You can either take it or leave it. I know that's not the reason why i was interested in playing this game, and i'm really not nostalgic at all for playing a game like that.

That being said, there is a certain time for "getting used to" the low res graphics and full screen style, but once you are past that and well into the game, it is a very interesting story, you will forget about everything else. 
And that's only because the story is good, the voice acting is also good, the script is well written and feels right and compelling. And the design of the game is as much original and though out as the script, you really feel like looking, if not at least reading a visual novel of the future.

Humans have disappeared from the earth. All that survives are machines built by machines from the past, the Primordium. And you are a loner, a robot living in the dunes outside the city in a broken ship that you are fixing, hoping one day,  it will fly away... but all those dreams are put on hold when suddenly one day your ship is sabotaged and the power core stolen from it. You face a slow death until your energy drains out, so you are forced to go out of your comfort zone and into the big city Metropol, in search of your missing link.

It really feels like it could work for any good movie or even a AAA game. The music also fits very nice within the game.

The puzzles are very original, as the story and for the most part are very fun when you find the solution. There are one or two exceptions, especially one certain  game of words....which at least in my case, needed and external reference to be completed, and of course that's not good at all when you have to, go looking for a clue outside the game, that's a total killer, but besides that all the rest of the puzzles are very good.

The pace of the game is very fluid, and the inclusion of a hint system built into your sidekick works very organically without ruining the game experience and the satisfaction of figuring out most of the things by yourself.
The story has even time to be not only serious, and funny, but also a little philosophical , posing real science fiction questions about time , technology and the future of human society.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998608535', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 532, 'last_played': 1500483780}
review:
Wonderful story. Great blend of serious, heavy themes and humor to relieve tension. Art is fantastic. The puzzles are very creative, challenging, and satisfying. Love the different endings.

If you're a fan of sci-fi, puzzles, and good story, this is perfect.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967965913', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 513, 'last_played': 1503579272}

author: {'steamid': '76561197963707743', 'num_games_owned': 797, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1630820108}
review:
I had this sitting in my steam library for a [i]very[/i] long time, and I finally decided to try it out. I was really impressed by it.

I'm not one for puzzle, point & click, adventure games but this stood out for me. I really enjoyed the story and the characters. I really wish I could play a sequel to Primordia. The puzzles were challenging, the soundtrack was awesome, great art style, and really interesting dialog. 

There were some moments where It took me a while to figure out what I was supposed to do but I eventually got to the end.

I highly recommend this game to anyone who seems even slightly interested in it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995743969', 'num_games_owned': 981, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 743, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 743, 'last_played': 1503374336}
review:
This was an excellent little point and click adventure.  Very much in the style of Discworld or the old LucasArts games (Day of the Tentacle, Monkey Island, Grim Fandango, etc).

+ Everything is voice-acted!  And relatively WELL too!
+ Excellent world-building and story.  It's dark and dystopian, which is a nice contrast to the cheery colorful worlds of the games I mentioned above.  Differences are the spice of life.
+ The puzzles are logical.  Some easier than others (stupid drawbridge code) but they make sense if you think about them.

- The story, while great, never fully fleshes out the characters backstories to a satisfying depth.  You meet all of these unique personalities, and get a glimpse of what makes them tick, but (aside from maybe Horatio or MetroMind to a degree), you never really learn much more about them.  And don't even get me started about the other 3 cities...
- The game felt short.  Maybe it's the "rule of three" making me say this, but it felt like there should have been one more "act".  Dunes, Metropol, and ????  Not sure what... maybe a flashback in the middle of the events leading up Clarity's exile?  A glimpse at Metropol before the primordial council falls apart?

author: {'steamid': '76561198216244751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 920, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 920, 'last_played': 1505925962}
review: What an amazing game. When I first got into this game, the 8 bit graphics were kind of a let down, but don't let that bother you. You'll get used to it without a doubt. If you're into point and click andventures and puzzle games as well as psychologiccal drama and diystopian settings in the slightest you should defintely play this game, because this game is by far one of the best, maybe even the best point and click adventure I've ever played.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198034134159', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1540818582}
review:
Pros:

-Good puzzles
-Great artstyle
-Cool story
-Awesome soundtrack
-Amazing voice acting (oh, Logan...)
-Replayability (several different endings)

Cons:

-No fullscreen (really, wtf?!)
-Rather short

Verdict: A real solid for point&click fans that love a good story and challenging puzzles that are logical and not completely arbitrary as in other games of the genre. A great cast, lovely artstyle and good handling makes the game an instant favourite that you can replay once in a while without it becoming boring. Definitely worth its price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127015233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 692, 'last_played': 1490830590}

author: {'steamid': '76561198093792969', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 442, 'last_played': 1613348951}
review: I hate the point & click genre, but I decided to give Primordia a shot because the story seemed interesting. After playing through Primordia I can say that I still hate the point & click genre, but... Primordia was wonderful. For about half of the game I played on my own due to it being simple enough [spoiler] up to the part where you need to unlock the door at Metropol [/spoiler], but after that I desperately needed a walkthrough. You're probably questioning why I would look for a walkthrough after getting so far, or actually using a walkthrough in general, and my answer is because Primordia gave me a feeling of determination, of wanting to complete the game and find out more about what's going on. The story keeps you on the edge of your seat making you desire more info, how to solve things and figure out what the outcome will be. While I did not fully enjoy the OST, I can say that it was fitting for the atmosphere of the game, and finally, the characters were well done and not boring/stale personality wise. If you're thinking of buying Primordia, treat it as a visual novel and it'll be worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994434747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1502329407}
review:
What a great atmosphere! Im an 80's kid and these types of games were what I was getting into in the late 80's early 90's, well done. Art, music, atmosphere, nailed it. Difficulty? Like the games in the past you can rack your brain and lose hours trying to find the right combo, then its time to hit a walkthrough. I found myself hitting the walkthrough more towards the end, some of the things didnt seem like something I would have figured out, items could have been labelled better, some better tells etc... 

Overall its an enjoyable story, artwork/music just great and if you use the walkthrough sparingly you might be surprised the events you can trigger. Good voice acting as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040047642', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 598, 'last_played': 1501687357}
review: Wow... Excellent. Vraiment. Graphiquement, le pixelart est au top. Une ambiance steampunk post-apocalyptique irr√©prochable. Tout est hyper soign√©. Honn√™tement il n'y a pas de d√©faut dans le graphisme. Peut-√™tre un ou deux positionnement de sprites dans une ou deux animations, et encore, √ßa ne doit pas √™tre syst√©matique. La musique est parfaite. L'histoire est excellente et tr√®s profonde, comme les dialogues super-cisel√©s, et les backgrounds qui vont juste assez loin dans les d√©tails sont m√™mes super √† lire ! Heureusement car certains font parties des √©nigmes. Enigmes et puzzles qui sont extr√®mement bien dos√©s et justes. Attention toutefois √† s'armer de patience. Tout est logique et tombe bien en place, il n'y a pas de "d√©lires" introuvables, et les solutions sont plus simples qu'elles para√Æssent. Une ou deux √©nigmes quand m√™me qui m'ont d√©plues car il fallait vraiment passer du temps sur le d√©cor, mais c'est une ou deux pas plus. Tr√®s int√©ressant le fait que certaines √©nigmes aient plusieurs issues et donc plusieurs fa√ßons d'avancer dans l'histoire, mais surtout, il y a plusieurs fins ! Ne jamais rien pr√©cipiter avec ce jeu, et on est pas d√©√ßu !

author: {'steamid': '76561198024998837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 620, 'last_played': 1501533528}
review:
Classic point and click adventure style game. Very nicely done. Production values are high. Art is good, music matches mood, and voice acting is well done. 

Definitely has the wtf-beat-your-head-against-the-desk logic moments when you're trying to figure out what to do next at a couple moments, not always in a good way.

Worth pushing through for the story though. Unraveling the characters and events of the story definitely kept me involved and has some interesting moments.

The story isn't fully linear either as there are optional "side quests" you can do to accomplish your goals. There's also various moral or emotional choices which allow you to have different endings to the story. 

If you like classic point and click style games in the vein of the old lucasfilm titles, this is definitely a fun time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969535200', 'num_games_owned': 1065, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 566, 'last_played': 1501455945}
review: The post-apocalyptic world presented in this game has a bit of a fresh vibe which is strongly appealing to me. Story is interesting enough and puzzles are very logical with few exceptions - those tougher ones require player to pay close attention to context of conversations which got me stuck few times. I love the sound design and music, the (not so many but still) fun references to post-apocalyptic games and you can love or hate the Wadjet Eye simplistic graphics - I find it nostalic. Definetly the best game from Wadjet Eye I've played so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030457107', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 738, 'last_played': 1620899650}
review:
Great game = 8.5

Despite of having a resolution problem (for 1980x1080), Primordia is a wonderful post-apocalyptic graphic adventure. The puzzles aren't extremely difficult, but they're not easy neither; and what it's more important: the puzzles are logical and based in mathematical problems, which gives to the game a deeper sense of immersion.

Moreover, it counts with a wide variety of endings (7 in total) and achievements (in which you'll need a guide for some of them), all of this makes the game be replayable. Finally, the dialogs, the jokes and the OST are immersive and well designed, allowing the player understand what's happening in depth, but in a good fragmented order (which makes you feel curious during the whole adventure).

For these reasons, I highly recommend this game in its full price.

*NOTES:
How to solve resolution problem -> https://steamcommunity.com/app/227000/discussions/0/359543951722733672/
If you can't run it in "widescreen", then select "window" mode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063137438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1501092863}
review:
Well, I just beat the game for the first time, and am sure I got one of the bad endings. Seeing as how I have only gone through about half of the achievements, and want a better ending, I'll probably be playing this again.

The puzzles were fun, challenging, but did pass under strong thought. I am eager to play through again to see if I can make some better decisions on another try, since I was learning about the game on the first try. Cool story, and a lot of text to drive it, but this is an adventure game. This is to be expected.

I like it.

It's not an overly exciting game from an action perspective. The main draws will be the narrative, puzzles, and trying to sort through the implied different endings. I didn't follow a guide at all, and I will likely not do so for at least one or two more plays.

After one play-through, I still feel like there are quite a lot of loose ends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007812404', 'num_games_owned': 1243, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1500650751}
review:
Ordinarily I am not a fan of Point and Click adventures as I find them often slow and one dimensional. This game offered an entertaining landscape in which to operate in, and posed some fun and interesting puzzles. Characters were alright but I would not say I got attached to many of them.

The game itself feels and runs like an old game. I had to alter the winsetup file in the game files to make it star -changed the D3D to DDraw- and the resolution launched way off native. The Pixelation made it hard to Identify a number of things, and some of the puzzles were rather illogical.

That being said, I would recommend this game to someone who had not played it, but I would also give them a URL to a good guide because it offers few hints to aid in progression.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982283319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1684988194}

author: {'steamid': '76561198079945880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 807, 'last_played': 1511635460}
review:
[h1] Primordia - The most enjoyable game I've played in a while [/h1]

Well where to begin? I purchased Primordia initially just because I was captivated by the games art style and aesthetic that I saw on the steam store page. The murky, decayed and organic (almost HR Giger-esque in places) qualities of the scenes and designs caught my eye immediately.

In short summary Primordia is a world run by robots - man has vanished. Everything is slowly decaying and power - the lifeblood of the machines and robots who inhabit this world - is running low.

What first struck me when I first played the game beyond the look of it was the quality of the voice acting - especially of the lead character Horatio Nullbuilt (played by Logan Cunningham who also voice acted the narrator in Bastion). Other stand outs for me included your limb challenged sidekick good ol' Crispin, and my personal favourite the medieval old English speaking Ever-Faithful Leobuilt.

There are some deep theological questions and revelations in this game centring around the relationship between man and machine that I won't spoil here. That there are subtle parallels to our own world I also found to be clever and well executed. 

Although the game is melancholy in tone, it is counterbalanced by a ton of humour - usually provided by your best friend and ever complaining sidekick Crispin. Listening to some his dialogue genuinely made me laugh (which is an achievement in itself since I'm generally a miserable b'sod).

As it is a point and click adventure game I best mention the puzzles. On the whole they are fine and make sense with a bit of lateral thinking although I did have to resort to a guide once to get past a particularly tricky one. However, in this genre of game I would accuse the developer of not making it hard enough if I wasn't having at least one instance of  being completely at a loss! I reckon it builds character...

The game has multiple ways of solving particular puzzles and also multiple ending which is nice. If you're anything like me you'll want to play through a couple of times at least to see them all.

In conclusion, I would rate Primordia as one of the best point and click adventure games I've ever played and up there right beside one of my other favourites [b] The Dig [/b]. More than that though I would rate it as one of the most enjoyable and involving games I've played for the last couple of years. I just wish there was a sequel in the works! The world, setting and characters of Primordia are too good not to revisit.

In the words of the sad robot:

[i] I AM WAITING [/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198156501083', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1499995961}
review:
This little game is an absolute masterpiece! I would gladly play an entire series set in this universe.

The art is gorgeous, the voice acting top-notch, and the puzzles are challenging without being ridiculous. The characters and story really lift this above your average point-and-click adventure game - Horatio and Crispin's constant banter is hilarious, and I got a kick out of the other robots they meet along their journey. The soundtrack is moody, melancholy industrial awesomeness.

There are several ways to solve the puzzles, and multiple endings after the big showdown. Honestly, the only complaint I have is that it's such a short game, but that's mostly because I didn't want to stop playing. I really hope the creators return to this universe for another game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198000891394', 'num_games_owned': 632, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 604, 'last_played': 1499915924}
review: One of the best point and click games out there. It's very oldschool and extremely charming, with a quality story that unfolds itself really well as the game moves along. It's got great writing aswell, some of the most interesting conversations coming from your adorable sidekick robot saying silly things as usual. The puzzles are quite varied and put together so very cleverly, offering a real challenge for anyone looking to put their heads to work. Loved every minute of this game, much credit to the amazing devs <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198154296425', 'num_games_owned': 146, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1732, 'last_played': 1641695363}
review:
Si est√°s pensando en comprar Primordia lo √∫nico que puedo decirte es: hazlo.
Este juego es todo lo que promete y mucho m√°s. Como ya habr√°s visto el arte del juego es excepcional. El estilo y la calidad se mantienen a lo largo de todo el juego. La m√∫sica no es tan llamativa, pero combina perfectamente con el arte para crear una atm√≥sfera l√∫gubre, desoladora y confortable a la vez.


Ahora deber√°s estar pensando "todo muy lindo, pero ¬øqu√© hay de la jugabilidad?". En mi opini√≥n es excelente. Los puzzles son razonables pero no obvios, de manera que puede llevarte un rato darte cuenta de qu√© debes hacer, y nunca ser√° algo descabellado como en algunos juegos de anta√±o. No puedes morir ni quedarte trabado, aunque ciertas acciones bloquean o habilitan distintos finales. De cualquier forma, no te olvides de que como en cualquier Point & Click en alg√∫n momento pasar√°s algo por alto y estar√°s bastante tiempo hasta darte cuenta de que la soluci√≥n estaba a simple vista. Yo creo que esto √∫ltimo es un problema del g√©nero y no del juego, y solo me sucedi√≥ una vez durante toda la aventura.

Y hablando de aventura, prep√°rate para una de las mejores de tu vida. Primordia no tiene escenas de acci√≥n deslumbrantes ni efectos especiales, pero tiene una de las mejores historias en de ciencia ficci√≥n jam√°s contada. Cada lugar que visitas y cada personaje que conoces dejar√° una impresi√≥n en ti. Al principio no hay mucho, el juego te da a conocer el ambiente y a los personajes principales, pero dale tiempo y terminar√°s tan enganchado que no te sacar√°n de la silla ni con una gr√∫a.


¬øC√≥mo? ¬øA√∫n no est√°s convencido? Yo no puedo hacer mucho m√°s, pero Primordia s√≠. La p√°gina oficial del juego ofrece un demo gratis. Este abarca poco de la historia, pero creo que te dar√° la impresi√≥n necesaria para hacerte comprarlo. ¬øNo sabes ingl√©s o andas medio flojo? En esa misma p√°gina puedes bajarte un parche con el doblaje del texto en espa√±ol (te perder√°s algunos chistes y juegos de palabras, pero nada trascendente).


Los √∫nicos motivos por los que alguien no deber√≠a jugar al Primordia son:
-No te gustan los juegos de Point & Click (aunque si nunca has probado uno este es un buen comienzo) o no tienes mucha paciencia.
-Si no te agrada el arte del juego (la calidad es excelente sin discusi√≥n, pero sobre gustos no hay nada escrito).


En mi opini√≥n Primordia es una obra maestra, un juego como pocos. Pru√©balo, no te arrepentir√°s.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118626844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1499445982}
review:
Primordia √® un'ottima avventura grafica dal tema cyberpunk e postumano.
La storia √® piuttosto breve, ma molto interessante nella sua esplorazioni di temi e dilemmi etici umani traslati su macchine.
I personaggi, per quanto non memorabili, sono credibili e coinvolgenti, e mi sono trovato ad empatizzare per le loro sorti.
La grafica √® retr√≤ ma ben curata, l'atmosfera cupa e opprimente giova da una soundtrack azzeccata e i puzzle che incontrerete sono perfettamente fattibili, anche se vi servir√† non poco sforzo.

Un'esperienza che raccomando.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154913636', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1499446715}
review:
Great Game.
It has a very similar feel to the game Machinarium, but lot harder as there is no hint book.
Very memorable and lovable character, intresting story, and good music with atmosphere.
Sme bug can be noticed but, overall there is not much of a problem expect one of the achivements.
Multiple ending and has replay value for the endings and achivements.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961093575', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1499111001}
review:
Love the art the style.  Story was very engaging and full of some great ideas.  Definitely recommended for those who like point and click adventure games.

Be forewarned - a handful of this game's puzzles are pretty hard.  Even if I had a lot of time (I don't), I'm not sure I'd have been able to solve all of them on my own.  Ended up having to use a walkthrough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198314304725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1499176768}

author: {'steamid': '76561198036529398', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 596, 'last_played': 1486063642}
review: If you are an old school point and click fan you will love this. I remember playing Beneath a Steel Sky as a kid and this was every bit as fun as I remember that was. Great story, puzzles that make sense, philosophy, plenty to click on and explore. Yep, point and click dads rejoice, pick this up and re-live your younger years.

review: An amazing adventure with incredible artwork and memorable characters. Puzzles are not so convoluted that you want to give up and look at a walkthough, but not so trite and simple that you feel like your intelligence is being insulted. Definitely a good pick up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006849221', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 328, 'playtime_forever': 542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 542, 'last_played': 1377136980}

author: {'steamid': '76561198055434938', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 718, 'last_played': 1498330692}
review: This is a fantastic game, especially the story behind it.  I won't spoil anything, and the game isn't extremely long to complete, once you know all of it, it's fairly small.  Good puzzles, interaction with objects, and a great storyline.  This game does not have a "Choices Matter" tag, and it should.  There are a lot of small things that can influence how you complete the game, for better or worse.  It has much more important choices and a good list of endings that are much better than most games with a "Choices Matter" tag, but only have one or two endings anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141527623', 'num_games_owned': 3839, 'num_reviews': 426, 'playtime_forever': 2021, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1305, 'last_played': 1639746383}
review: Primordia was super neat! I loved the characters and the story, and the point-and-click adventure interface really brought back memories of some of the good ol' days. Highly recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561197973463427', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 443, 'last_played': 1496706869}
review:
Very satisfying point-and-click puzzle solver with an engrossing story with unique and interesting characters.  The premise is excellent if the puzzles are on the challenging side.  Well thought-out game design allowed for multiple solutions to some of the key puzzles.  The multiple endings were all interesting and relevant to the storyline.

Some bugs resulted in dropped items but with frequent saves (also to safeguard choices), there shouldn't be any issues.

A must-grab from any sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970314107', 'num_games_owned': 2302, 'num_reviews': 917, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1558725636}
review:
What will the world look like without us humans? More than a few games have speculated on the synthetic future but few are as grim a vision as Primordia. Not even the worst of the brown military shooters can match the muddy wastes and rusting towers of this title. As unappealing as that might sound it's all by design, to make the colorful characters of this adventure shine even brighter against a dim backdrop. And as long as you can get past the dark overtones, you'll find that it really is a brilliant journey.

In the barren wastes of a far-future world we find Horatio Nullbuilt, a humanoid robot who could be mistaken for a tusken raider animatronic. He and his faithful hovering companion, Crispin Horatiobuilt, reside in the ruins of an ancient aircraft that Horatio is intent on restoring to service. Those plans are interrupted in a dramatic way that leads the duo to Metropol, a decaying city of robots in service to an unseen despot. By the end of their adventure, Horatio and Crispin find themselves at the center of a social and political conflict that will determine the fate of the city.

Right away, it should be apparent how much thought went into conceiving of this mechanical world. The naming conventions, the manners of speech, and even the robot designs themselves indicate a deeply developed and stylized world without humans. These robotic denizens define themselves by the builders and functions, and their personalities match to a T. Their digs are just as interesting, with wrecks and ruins re-purposed into mechanized living spaces. It's a living, breathing world of machines that don't even breathe, and the differences are striking and apparent once you get past the pleasant familiarity of the characters.

I really can't say enough good things about the writing, but Lord knows I'm about to try. Plenty of adventure games stumble over stiff scripts and unnatural characters but you'll get none of that in Primordia. Horatio is an excellent mix of gruff and kindly, and his sidekick bubbles and prods in just the right ways to play off of him (and others) without becoming grating. Just the first few scenes should be enough to ingratiate them to you, an important hurdle for any character-driven game. And the supporting cast is delightfully varied and colorful as well, spanning the full range of devout mystics, shift traders, duty-bound servants, and adorable beeping things. There's creativity here that I haven't seen since Planescape: Torment which did a lot to keep me invested in the plot.

On the mechanical side, Primordia again does everything it needs to to keep the puzzles clever and moving. Your inventory allows you to examine and combine items, often with Horatio or Crispin voicing little hints about how an object can best be used. Crispin himself pulls double-duty as a source of hints and a usable object, something you would be wise to remember anytime you spot an item just out of reach. There's also a PDA-type device that tracks important puzzle info and provides a handy map, and while the display is absolutely tiny it gets the job done and is used in some clever ways on its own. At no point did I ever get stuck on any of the puzzles, despite a few that taxed my brain in unexpected ways. There's a really good logic puzzle and a tricky text parser sequence that stood out as high points in the genre, though the overall spread of puzzles is well above average.

There's not much I can level against Primordia, honestly. I mentioned that it's a grim and muddy future but the characters elevate it above that and keep all the gloom to the periphery. While the scope of the game is just as grand as it needs to be, it plays out over a pretty small number of scenes so it might feel smaller than it should. There are also some political overtones that you might not agree with when the multiple endings roll around, which is to be expected from a game whose plot is so steeped in robo-sociology but nevertheless might rub the wrong way. I'm absolutely not going to knock the art, intensely low-res though it is, because the far-future designs of the robots and their environs are absolutely fascinating to behold. The sound design is far more reserved but does what it needs to, and in particular provides some excellent voice acting throughout. Primordia is the total package, an adventure game that challenges and inspires in every aspect from its characters to its puzzles.



Did you enjoy this review? I certainly hope so, and I certainly hope you'll check out more of them at https://goldplatedgames.com/ or on my [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/audish#curation]curation page[/url]!

author: {'steamid': '76561198167433900', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 934, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1676940386}
review: I love the story of this game as well as the beautiful art style. One of the most important parts of any point and click adventure game is the story; its suppose to catch you and get you interested in the game. I can say that once I found this game it did just that to me. The artstyle really captures the atmosphere of the game and does a good job at immersing the player in this dystopian world. The only criticism I have is that a few of the puzzles were difficult for me to get and I had to look them up (unfortunately), but the majority of puzzles are challenging and fun to try and figure out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158689450', 'num_games_owned': 590, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 652, 'last_played': 1495984572}
review: Nice Game !!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197997506993', 'num_games_owned': 1127, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 1265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 661, 'last_played': 1495977432}
review:
Primordia tells a post-apocalyptic story of a mechanical hermit who needs to find a stolen power core. The art style, voice acting and soundtrack are pretty top notch and the story itself is cool too. The setting and the gameplay gave me some good old "Beneath a Steel Sky" vibes.

My only complaint is that there was a ridiculous amount of confusing number puzzles featuring various keypads and codes that you have to figure out by means of deduction and paying really close attention to dialogue. It got pretty tedious for me. Robots love numbers, but I don't.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996362449', 'num_games_owned': 519, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3383, 'last_played': 1495830093}
review: I liked the game a lot for its atmosphere, humour, puzzles and story. Liked it so much that I even bothered to play it though a few times to get all the achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128049255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1615488102}
review: dont you dare miss this game

author: {'steamid': '76561197990910323', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1374527137}
review:
10/10 amazing in everyway. A setting that oozes with dark dystopian mystery with a plot twist within a plot twist. Plotception!

The buzzfeed title parody out of the way simply put this is a game with a beautiful art direction to flesh out a world that has it's own intricate lore and rules upon which it's inhabitants function. You will love them for their wit, their complaining about the day to day drudge and their cold emotionless processors trying to live on in a world that is harsher than it should be.

A dystopian noir sort of story about an amnesiac robot just trying to get a power core to make it through the next cycle who uncovers not only his past, but the dark secret of the city of robots. Get it now. It's good!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972386869', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2147, 'last_played': 1495646429}
review:
This game satisfied an itch for the old Sierra point-and-clicks of the late 80s and early 90s. In fact, in many ways it one-ups its predecessors due to its amazing art, great story/voice acting, and dark atmosphere. It could have been longer but it was not too short; I just wasn't particularly ready for it to end. I sincerely hope Wadgeteye/Wormwood have a sequel is in the works. I feel a great franchise could be borne from this excellent title. 

If you enjoy point-and-click adventure games you really owe it to yourself to try Primordia. 

My only minor complaint is that the developer did not implement a point system, like the old Sierra games had, to aid in achieving 100% completion. The achievement system works as an adequate substitute here, I suppose.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026760302', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1008, 'last_played': 1699216674}
review: Primordia, for what it is, is one of the best games I have ever played and easily found it's way into one of my top ten games among others like Majora's Mask and Metal Gear Solid 3. It has a beautiful design and setting with an amazingly written story and characters. I care not to spoil it as every moment is worth discovering and appreciating on your own. As for gameplay, it's a classic point and click adventure with puzzles that generally make sense, which is much appreciated in this genre and will take you around 5 hours to complete. That might seem a bit short but I often find myself wanting to return to Primordia and, while I think there is more than enough here for you, find myself wanting more. It's easy to immersive yourself in the wonderful world and characters of Primordia and at only $10 it is definitely worth it to pick up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198341435259', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 589, 'last_played': 1497689838}
review:
[b]Current status:[/b] complete 100% (played three times)
[b]Current grade:[/b] 8.5/10

Primordia was a wonderful experience, but also very hard to play. The puzzles were quite a challenge and getting all achievements can be tricky, but possible with only one gameplay (as is getting all the endings) but only if you save often.

Players should check everything in the area, try to merge items in their inventories, and listen closely to Crispin's dialogues and hints. 

As for the story, Primordia is very amusing game, with a very great humor and sass, fantastic voice acting and the choice of multiply endings. Not to mention that all the endings have that unique "I did not see that coming" aura, and getting them all had been experience. The only thing that players should really pay attention to are dialogues. They contain hints to the future and past events, and only if you listen closely (sometimes they literally tell you what is going on, and you might not even notice it). 

All of the characters are unique. All the robots you find during the play have their own personalities, way of speaking and behaving. Some will consonantly remind your controlled character that you forgot about implementing some very vital parts in their mechanics, or will question your belief in humans and of the current world. You can also help your best mechanical friend and companion to flirt with a lamp, so he can practice before trying it on on a real robot.

I am not a fan of point and click games, but this was just fantastic experience full of fantastic characterization, rich world building and gameplay based on logic, not to mention amazing humor and great dialogues.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991655157', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1495000640}
review:
The puzzles in Primordia are very hard. 
The story, setting and characters make it worth continuing on. 
It shows a lot of inspiration from Planescape Torment.
There's a lot of endings a few major choices.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095769166', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1494828316}
review: A great dystopian-esque story and a unique take on Artificial Intelligence and Sentience. Really appreciated and loved this game. Multiple endings also provide great repeat value for your in-game decisions. Keep these coming! Would love to see a Sequel for this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198219017435', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1500443405}
review:
Primordia is the type of game that is missing in the games industry now "Point & Click Adventure Games," but I am glad thanks to indie studios like Wedjet Eye Games who know us older gamers from the 80's, 90's and newer gamers still love these kind of games.

Primordia is set in a post-apocalyptic environment with robotic machines,  you play as Horatio Nullbuilt, a stoic robot who values his solitude and independence. Although due to unforeseen events he has to go to the robot city Metropol, from this adventure he will find out about his own existence, what happened to the human race and the choices he needs to make.

A must own for anyone who love's Point & Click Adventure Games or for gamers who want something different from the mainstream marketplace.

A MUST OWN!

P.S: It turns up on steam sales quite allot so you can get an excellent game for quite a cheap price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046128011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1475756169}
review:
I have been gaming for many, many years, but one genre that has alluded me (or rather, that I have alluded) is the point and click. I have plenty of fun with games that require twitch-like reflexes, induce high octane action, and have me screaming and yelling at the screen. This game did none of those, but it did something no other games, in my experience, have. 

It's simply the most thought-provoking game I have ever played. 

The setting and context is beautiful and philosophic. It's not just creative, however, it's also executed to perfection. The voice acting is also incredible, adding on to an already perfect atmosphere that the art style fits seamlessly with. If the protagonist sounds familiar, that is because he (Logan Cunningham) later went on to other famous games such as Bastion and Transistor. He is not by any means the reason this game is good, but again, is an incredibly important element. All in all, everything works. 

Whether you're a fan of the genre, or just trying to pick it up, Primordia is a great choice. 

89/100

author: {'steamid': '76561198003200719', 'num_games_owned': 426, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1494720502}
review:
Another Wadget-Eye publications game based on pixel game engine. If you don't like pixel graphics, this might not be for you. However I felt Primordia has better pixel usage than other games. You don't need glasses to find the on-screen hotspots. It has bigger pixel region to select the item in game world. 

The story is little bit meh. It's a far future world where human doesn't exist anymore. After creating AI, they are gone. Now AI robots are living in this world, salvaging parts and creating new robots and process goes on. This game is a journey of an ancient robot, made by human and its sidekick, made by AI robot. 

The game doesn't tell why and how human were destroyed (or maybe left the world). There are few petty humor by sidekick which doesn't even matter.

Get this game if you're wadget eye game fan, pixel adventure / point n click fan. 

On a rating scale: [b]6 / 10[/b].

author: {'steamid': '76561198308658580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1493981849}
review:
Love the game and its concept to the very core. Post-organic, post-human post-apocalypse in the "Dying Earth" sci-fi genre is what I call damn fine choice of setting ;) Great visuals and music, very interesting story (with some nice and funny references)... and I love characters - all very deep and unique. Overall very good point&click adventure game. Top notch characrets design.
Play it now!

author: {'steamid': '76561198052694676', 'num_games_owned': 467, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 566, 'last_played': 1492306459}

author: {'steamid': '76561198072683855', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1492971351}
review:
Really good written story, deep characters and a beautiful atmosphere. Soundtrack is also pretty good and the protagonist, Horatio, is voiced by the same guy who narrates both Bastion & Transistor from Supergiant Games (who has an amazing voice). Some puzzles may be quite troubling but, you can always find the way or one out of many to complete them. May be a bit unsetting for those not used to aventure games (such as Syberia), but it is really worth to buy it in sale.

Also, Crispin is love.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131379643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1491249588}
review: Nice little post apo adventure game. Nice story, gameplay is 'classic'. Graphics and environment are nice but a little too low res to my taste. It is not pixel art to me, but rather low res. author: {'steamid': '76561198030843226', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1492498405}
review:
Fantastic game! The world was torn yet alluring. The characters were well written and diverse. The story was enticing as you started to uncover the mysteries of what seemed to be a meaningless theft. Some puzzles took very very very long for me, but were absolutely rewarding once completed. 

Overall, fantastic world and fun puzzles. Would play again!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197964345647', 'num_games_owned': 921, 'num_reviews': 250, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1491325035}
review:
Pixel Art: 4/5 (Love the art style) 
Immersion: 4/5 
Gameplay: 3/5 (Point & Click) 
Controls: 3/5 
Value: 4/5 
Difficulty: 3/5 
--------------
Overall 3.6 (Difficulty is always excluded)

[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/31208751/]Please follow my Pixel Art Curation for other great games...[/url]


This was one of the coolest Point-and-Click adventures I have experienced in a long while!

I am surprised that this game was so enjoyable, since Blackwell sucked and was a huge disappointment...When I saw Wadjet Eye Games associated I was concerned for the same, but I was compelled by the beautiful art and concept.

I cannot say there was anything in particular I disliked...Not too much back tracking...Great humor...Wonderful characters...Awesome art...great concept...fun puzzles!

This is a must for adventurers!


ACHIEVEMENTS:  Mostly story drive, but with hidden items and multiple endings.
