author: {'steamid': '76561197971473601', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1427603285}
review: Outstanding.  Story, art, gameplay, and even characterization, are all among the best I've seen.  The game reminds me of old-school adventure games like Torin's Passage, but perfects the same formula.  One of the best adverture games I've ever played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067085619', 'num_games_owned': 601, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1427528578}
review:
You take the role of  Horatio Nullbuild, a robot who lives in a vast wasteland. Together with his robot companion Crispin
Horatio tries to rebuild the  Uniic,  an ancient ship left behind by Man.
The Journey of Horatio and Crispin begins as a Droid named Scraper swipes the powercore of the Uniic.

Primordia is a Point&Click adventure with a retro graphical style and  an epic soundtrack.
It features clever and headcracking riddles along with a slow starting but awesome Story with tons of very loveable  and nice synched charackters to meet on your journey.

i would recommend Primordia for all Fans of Adventures like ''Monkey Island'', ''Broken Sword'' or ''TheBlackwellLegacy'' and for all fans of story driven robotic cyberpunk.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993896866', 'num_games_owned': 437, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1427111418}
review:
I have tried to get into point and click adventure games in the past but have tired of them quickly. As soon as I get stuck the temptation to check for the solution on the web gets greater and when I finally do the magic is gone, I may as well just use the walkthrough. With Primordia there were some hard points but with the help of my sidekick Crispin I managed to get through and complete the game.

I found the world incredibly absorbing. The artwork was excellent and the dialogue thoroughly amusing. The story pulls you in and at the end I was a little sad that it was over.

If you like adventure games then this will be a hit. If you haven't tried adventure games but were looking to then I think this might be one to start with as most of the puzzles are pretty intuitive. The things you need to interact with are generally easy to find on the screen and the dialogue and hints help a lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019598895', 'num_games_owned': 268, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1670464321}
review:
I'll start this review by saying that this is the best point-and-click game I've ever played in my entire life.
What makes this game so special is how the story develops and the awesome caracther design.

SPOILER ALERT:
The story begins with Horatio and Crispin on top of the UNNIC, a half broken airship that has seen better days.
Horatio is fixing the telescope on that resides on top of said ship, when suddenly he hears a strange noise comming from down bellow.
Appon entering the room, he is now faced with the fact that there is a giant robot that has claws and shoots lasers ( you will probably get the joke if you have played the game ) that invaded his ship by cutting a hole in it.
The giant robot demands that Horatio "forfeits" and that he hands over his power core, Horatio does not give in to the robots demands and the following shoots Horatio in the chest region with a lazer beam.
From then on, Horatio and his side kick crispin set off to find out who this robot was and where he went, so that they can get their power core back.

Now let me tell you something, at this point I was already hooked on the story and I was like "okay let's continue playing for a bit more". That "bit" more turned into hours and hours of continuously playing this game. This game just throws at you the mix of a great story line + good caracther development + Not too hard to figure out but still good puzzles and great comedy. It doesn't have the same funny tone all the time however

When Horatio and Crispin fail to find a power source in the wastelands they are forced to head to Metropol, the self proclamed city of glass and light. "Free power for one and all" is what they advertise and they do have power for everyone, but it does come with a price. When Horatio and Crispin step out of the red line train, Horatio finds a robot who collects 1 megacycle from him. At the time, Horatio has no idea of what a megacycle is, but he does find out eventually that the megacycles are brain power, we could also call it processing power. Anyways, the story goes along and Horatio finds out that his power core is stored on the big tower where Metromind is. He then goes on to try and get it back and that's when things take a darker turn. BUUUUUT I don't want to spoil the ending for anyone who might have read the spoil alert and then thinks to theirselfs "you know what, Imma read it anyways".

The story is great, the caracthers are great, the puzzles are excellent and there are multiple endings which means you can replay the game and let me tell you, you will want to replay the game because it is so damn good!

I would rate it an honest 9.5/10 , I would even dare to give it a 10/10 .

Amazing game and for 10 euros, it is a bargain of a lifetime

author: {'steamid': '76561198093989040', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 874, 'last_played': 1450720770}
review:
11/10!!!
Eins der besten Spiele, die ich jemals gespielt habe! Wundersch√∂n gestaltete Level, Charakteure, wunderbare Englishe Vertonung. Ein Spiel mit einem eigenen einzigartigem Charme. Es erz√§hlt eine unglaublich fesselnde spannende Story, die sich einem mehr und mehr erschlei√üt, bis das gro√üe Ganze vor einem "steht". Diese verpixxelte Grafik ist absolut passend, und das Spiel liefert Momente, in denen man einfach nur da sitzt und denkt: WOW (Fahrt nach Metropolis etc.), sowohl graphisch als auch von der Story her. Der Humor ist wunderbar und man k√∂nnte den ganzen Tag Crispin zuh√∂ren wie er um Arme bettelt, oder Horatios Zynismus. Die Puzzles sind unglaublich gut durchdacht, wiederholen sich nie, sind fordernd, schwer aber mit Notizen (JA man muss sich Dinge aufschreiben :D ), Sinn und Verstand sind alle l√∂sbar. Selbst ein paar Anspielungen auf Half-Life oder Fallout sind zu finden. Ein absolut geniales Spieleerlebnis. Mit seinen 7 unterschiedlichen Enden (zumindest glaube ich, dass es so viele sind) und verschiedenen kleinen Puzzle-Wendungen bietet es Abwechslung. Auch die musikalische Untermalung ist absolut gelungen.  ABSOLUTE KAUFEMPFEHLUNG!

author: {'steamid': '76561198010173453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 577, 'last_played': 1379837702}
review:
Primordia caught my eye due to its design, which I adore, in addition to the sci-fi, mechanical protagonist / world.
The story and interactive aspects were also fresh and fun. You will find yourself searching for pixels, but you will also find yourself searching for clues within the dialogue.
For the duration of the game, they kept the motif of "a mechanical world" to its fullest: with religion, culture, social echelons and political power born out of machine-esque beaurocracy.

Since I am a cheap bastard, I do not think Primordia is worth 10$, I played it twice-thrice, and I found it to be a pretty short experience -- especially the ending, which felt like it came too soon. The middle section of the game is also burdened with swapping items for other items endlessly, which felt like a chore.

Overall, I got it when it was on discount, and I encourage you to do the same.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002603888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 494, 'last_played': 1426460892}
review: Primordia is one of the best classic point-and-click adventures in recent memory. Its difficulty is only equaled by its conceptual beauty. Darkly macabre in design and heavily themed in religious and philospohical question, Primordia is worth the time. The voice acting is top-notch all around along a exceedingly mysterious universe. While the abrupt ending is somewhat disappointing, it game never seems to lose a step and the dialogue is exceedingly cyncial and hilarious. The soundtrack is appropriate for horror-thriller films and reminds of the minimalistic The Thing (1982) soundtrack that fits the scene perfectly. Can't recommend it enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983324630', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1355040000}
review:
I really liked this game and I think anyone that had played games like Kings Quest series would love this too.

Story has a fallout kind of vib with graphics from the late 80's to early 90's which I liked.

The art work and the rustic desolated world really had me enticed the entire time I played it.

My only grip with this game was trying to find one or two items, I mean I literally had to click on every pixel in order to find this little part in a junk pile. I kind of wished it would have had a glimmer to it or something to help you find it better, not like spoon feed you but, if you didn't unlock a part of the story then you might not find it at all but out of chance, then you get a certian object that might help you find object b easier or something.

Other than that, this game is awesome click adventure and I highly recommend it to anyone that likes doom and gloom retro art and click adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983323513', 'num_games_owned': 783, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1527461250}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999343905', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1425621109}

author: {'steamid': '76561198042133653', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 637, 'last_played': 1425075107}
review:
Aventura gr√°fica entretenida con partes m√°s asequibles y otras bastante complicadas. Esto es as√≠ por el nivel de ingl√©s del juego. 

Tuve que echar mano de una gu√≠a para darme cuenta de algunos detalles que habia pasado por alto en las conversaciones, ya que en mi caso, con un nivel medio de ingl√©s, te enteras de la historia pero pasas por alto parte de la informaci√≥n. Por ejemplo si se ponen a hablar con lenguaje t√©cnico o nombrando r√°pidamente personajes y situaciones puedes pasar por alto alg√∫n detalle que te guie en la soluci√≥n de los problemas. A parte hay caminos que cambian los finales, acciones que se pueden resolver de varias maneras y otras sirven para desbloquear logros. Estos son imposibles de conseguir en solo una partida o, si lo prefieres, puedes ir guardando bastantes veces para intentar conseguirlos desde diversos puntos.

No es la mejor aventura que he jugado ni la m√°s f√°cil por el idioma. Aun as√≠ he de decir que no est√° mal y el ambiente post apocal√≠ptico junto con la trama cyberpunk con toques √©ticos, morales y religiosos la hacen recomendable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043428145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1088, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 941, 'last_played': 1457544843}
review:
This game became a favorite of mine very quickly.

For some reason I absolutely love any story that mixes machines with religion.  Perhaps I have that bias as a Christian who loves science fiction and philosophy (mind/body problem anyone?).  For those who are adverse to religion, I wouldn't say it's a huge part of the game (some of the robots have their own faith, not practicing a real one), but it is certainly obvious.  If you've ever watched Ergo Proxy, it kind of has a similar feel in that regard.

The characters are great, the story is great, the voice acting is amazing... I have nothing but good to say about this game.  Expect a Horatio cosplay from me soon! ; )

author: {'steamid': '76561197972523077', 'num_games_owned': 322, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1383350214}
review:
A beautifully realized indie adventure game with alternative paths and multiple endings, Primordia is one of the best point-and-click gems you've never heard of. Set in a far-future dystopian setting, robots struggle to make sense of a world where humans, their creators, no longer exist. As Horatio, a robot seeking to repair what has broken or fallen into disuse, you will explore the landscape of the desolate world and explore one of the few remaining cities with his faithful and sarcastic sidekick Crispin. 

The voice-work is excellent, as are the music and visuals. Now with the 2.0 release, I'm looking forward to playing it again and taking a different path.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048132861', 'num_games_owned': 1738, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1424026991}
review:
Despite a few minor shortcomings, Primordia is a true gem, a deceptively simple cyber-punk thriller that gradually blossoms into a dystopian epic adventure with rich lore that dares to pose profound philosophical questions. In merely 8-9 hours, the player follows Horatio and Crispin in an unforgettable journey of thought and emotion, which combines the unfolding of a gripping tale with clever puzzles and addictive old-school adventure game gameplay.

Full Review: http://adventureadvocate.gr/gamereviews/item/primordia

author: {'steamid': '76561198087345727', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1401653759}
review: It's a must-play and beautiful game set in spectacular world with with interesting and memorable story that I won't forget easily. If you're that kind of player who can appreciete cleverness and art of a game, I would totally recommend this for you. I staggered at the beginning a bit and had to use the tutorial, but it was all worth it. I've also enjoyed the developer's commentary which is included. Games like this deserve more recognition. Definitely worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030305825', 'num_games_owned': 351, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1584528904}
review:
Great story, post-apocalyptic setting.

 Humanity mysteriously vanished. Only robots remain.

You as ''Horatio'' and your friend ''Crispin'' wander around the wastes and the new city to unravel what it hides.

It's a classical adventure game. One of the best ones I ever played and a pleasant surprise to see it have so much content and replay value, albeit some repetitivness in the level design by the end of the game, as you mainly have to run around in circles for some puzzles.
You do have your friend who can offer you hints, but some of them are vague which is a slight issue compared to the general narrative message.

 Play this if 90's "Point & Clicks" are your passion.
A big thank you to the developers for the ambient soundtrack and to "The Vintage Feeling" for generously gifting this game to me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037915539', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1420650185}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007427683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1268, 'last_played': 1429130042}
review:
Amazing game,

Haven't played point & click adventures in years, and it was such a refreshing experience - some subtle improvements like auto note-taking and instant travel instead of endless walking back and forth.. but the game really shines in it's writing and mood, set by lovely hand-drawn graphics.

Taking place in a not so distant future, you play a robot trying to recover a power core that was taken from you. I think my only real gripe with the game was that it was just a bit too short but you should definateley give it a try, experience the world created, and talk with some unique characters.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969418584', 'num_games_owned': 473, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 694, 'last_played': 1420807510}
review: Primordia is a return to the greatest traditions of point & click adventures - great music, interesting setting and characters and no ridiculous impossible puzzle solutions a la Roberta Whatever/Sierra garbage. This game has a great sense of humor as well, but doesn't get repetitive with the jokes. It doesn't make it too easy for you but the solutions to most things can be figured out after a bit of trial and error. I guess it came out in 2012 but I call it my game of the year for 2014, in a year of sequels and blah, this really stood out for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052489358', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 450, 'last_played': 1421247969}
review:
The graphic style of this game really snagged my interest, and was something I felt I hadn't seen in awhile. It felt nostalgic yet new. Like a lonely road, picking at what treasures I could and hazily watching the horizion. Just feels like there is so much in it. A shame it's so short! The story really intrigued me, and the "aha!" moments were wonderful.

Definately loved this game, just sad that it wasn't all that long! 

Would actually love to know more about the world it's set in, or get to go on more adventures in it's setting!

author: {'steamid': '76561198102318431', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 638, 'last_played': 1420876218}
review:
I purchased Primordia during the 2014 winter sale on Steam. So, I spent an approximate total of three dollars on this game. Knowing what I know now I would buy this game at full price. Now, I know it looks like an older game, I envision this being playable on an older system, such as the original Playstation, but the graphics are a part of the feel, part of that grainy worn out look and environment. The story back drop is extremely enticing and will make you want to do some playable digging to find out more about the story and the characters. The puzzles are not as easy as they look and decision making trees offer differing outcomes to the story. As an added plus you get to know and love these characters and in some small way emotionally invest in them within a relatively short time. You‚Äôll laugh at their jokes, good and bad, and you‚Äôll care whether or not they succeed in their endeavors. Overall Primordia offers a very, very good post apocalyptic science fiction experience in a point/click format. Totally worth checking out!!

b(^_^)d

Michelle

author: {'steamid': '76561198118048426', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1421112803}
review:
By far, one of the better (if not best) Point and Click games I've ever played. With several hidden easter eggs, a unique, well written, and deeply entrancing Storyline, and several well written jokes to lighten the mood at times. You grow to care about the charactors, and there are many paths and options, including multiple endings and even ending outcomes. Your actions define the end of the game, from early choices all the way down to the final and last choice you make, all add to overall feeling of completion when you see the ending cutscene.

The soundtrack is no slouch and helps build atmosphere and keeps a very "Wizards" end of the world vibe throughout. There is even a Graphic novel about the game (search Youtube~)  Brass tacks; If you like simple to play but rewarding games, well written storys, funny banter, well placed and iconic Easter Eggs, multiple solutions to problems, and even small yet interesting side stories, you will love this game. For a simple point and click, its got a lot to offer. 

Well worth the buy.  I completely Support and recommend this game~

author: {'steamid': '76561198006560453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1420897204}
review:
[h1]TL:DR? See Conclusion[/h1]

[h1]INTRODUCTION:[/h1]
Primordia is a point-and-click adventure game developed by Wormwood Studios and made available on Steam through the Greenlight system.  It features a fully voice-acted cast with a retro graphical art style that pays homage to the classical age of gaming.

[h1]PLOT (No Spoilers):[/h1]
The story of Primordia takes place in a post-apocalyptic future where machines have taken over the world after the human race fought itself into extinction.  You follow the adventures of a self-aware android named Horatio Nullbuilt and his companion Crispin Horatiobuilt both residing inside a crashed ship called 'The UNNIIC'.  When a mysterious and powerful robot steals their power source, both Horatio and Crispin embark on a quest to seek out a new power source which eventually leads them to the mechanical city of Metropol.

[h1]PROS:[/h1]
+ Good Retro Art Style
+ Great character writing and developments
+ Good story with an interesting back-story
+ Atmospheric environment and world design
+ Consequence-based choices that can affect the final outcome of the story
+ Fully voice-acted characters
+ Healthy game time of at least 6-8 hours depending on how quickly the player solves the puzzles
+ Steam cloud support

[h1]CONS:[/h1]
- No 'HD' or Widescreen Support, in which the game opts instead for a pitiful 320x200 resolution which, frankly speaking, makes my eyes hurt.
- The game has a fetish for the color brown
- Puzzles are sometimes irritatingly difficult
- Does not expand much on the back-story which, in my opinion, is far more interesting than the main story
- The game's humor is a hit and miss

[h1]CONCLUSION:[/h1]
[b]GREAT POINT-AND-CLICK EXPERIENCE.[/b]  I Green-lit this game when it showed up in my Queue because I was very interested in its concept, setting, and back-story, and once it was released I purchased it and found a fun and absorbing point-and-click game with homage to the classical style of the genre. 

[h1]WORTH IT?[/h1]
Overall, Primordia is a great point-and-click adventure game that provides at least 6-8 hours‚Äô worth of game time. In addition, for only $10 (or your regional equivalent), it is definitely worth a look especially if you're a fan of the genre.

--------------------------------------------------------- 
[h1]Like my Reviews? Follow my Curator's Page:[/h1]

[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/6861651-Miyumi%27s-Review-Corner/]Miyumi's Review Corner (MIRECO)[/url]
developer_response: Many thanks for this lovely review.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967801082', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 547, 'last_played': 1420596450}
review:
Let me just start this review by giving you the following context: I very rarely play point-and-clicks. The most notable ones (namely, those by LucasArts) were before my time, so my only games in this genre I‚Äôve played are the new Sam and Max games and this one.

This genre greatly focuses on its writing and story, and I feel Primorida does well in that regard. What starts as a simple story of tracking a robot who stole your stuff turns into a one with many hints about the world and why it‚Äôs in the state it is, and Horatio‚Äôs role in it. Each character, from the straight-laced and practical main character Horatio, to his perpetually floating, snarky sidekick Crispin, and everyone else you interact with is written with enough skill to give them unique personalities without falling into two-dimensional archetypes. While many NPCs fall into some stereotypes of their characters (ex: a soldier robot speaks how you‚Äôd expect him to, likewise with a robot with a monocle), they get moments where they flesh out their character and have some very clever lines.

The overall plot kept me guessing all the way to the end, but stayed mostly clear about what was going on the whole way through. The story is straightforward in that regard, although the littering of hints of the details behind the game world really helped the story shine when it revealed big plot elements.

However, I NEED to talk about the gameplay. It‚Äôs your typical adventure game fare of solving puzzles by figuring out how items interact with each other, listening to context clues, etc. The game doesn‚Äôt go too crazy with the solutions.

That being said, I will be honest and say I had to use a walkthrough for this game. This is most likely due to my inexperience with the genre, but many times I felt clueless on what to do. Furthermore, when I looked up the solution, I felt like the game gave me little to no inclination that what I was supposed to do may be the answer.

PUZZLE SPOILERS

One of the most ‚Äúhow was I supposed to do that‚Äù moments was when I needed to figure out how to remove rust from gears so I could open a door. I hadn‚Äôt met anyone who was a cleaning robot or the like, and I had no items on me that implied they could clean. It turns out that in one segment, there are underwater ‚Äúsubmersible‚Äù robots who, when I dunked the gears underwater where they were, cleaned the gears. When I clicked on them normally, the main character said NOTHING about their potential cleaning ability.

Another annoying one was a moment of ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt know I could do that‚Äù. I had to inspect a door in order to solve a puzzle, but left-clicking it gave me a quote that didn‚Äôt help me. However, right-clicking it gave me a different one relevant to the puzzle. I know that could right-click on items to hear a description of them in my inventory, but I didn‚Äôt know why I couldn‚Äôt just left-click this door to hear the contextually-important quote for this puzzle.

END PUZZLE SPOILERS

So overall, I‚Äôd say that you should not feel ashamed if you need a walkthrough for certain puzzles in this game. The second half of this game has quite a few rather obtuse ones, which is a shame since they can halt the progression of what is otherwise a really cool story.

My other problem is a technical one: this game has no resolution options! It can only either run in fullscreen (which I think is 1024x768!!!) or windowed which has a default size that is most suitable for ants. Thankfully you can turn the ‚Äúscaling‚Äù up, which means increasing the size of the internal resolution (window size in windowed mode increases with this), but the lack of proper resolution options just strikes me as lazy to me.

Lastly, and this is sort of a nitpick, but this isn‚Äôt Logan Cunningham‚Äôs best work. He does a decent job not sounding bored in his lines and emoting properly when necessary, but either due to sound engineering, low quality audio files, or otherwise not as much strength in his voice work, he isn‚Äôt as memorable as he was in Bastion. I felt the sidekick Crispin out-did him in passionately delivering his lines. It doesn‚Äôt detract from the game at all really, I‚Äôm more just feeling like he could have done better.

SUMMARY:

I strongly suggest you guys pick up Primorida. It‚Äôs got an interesting plot inside a unique atmosphere of a post-human world, and the writing does those both justice. The puzzles can be result in premature baldness due to hair-pulling difficulty, but they didn‚Äôt stop me from enjoying the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034791614', 'num_games_owned': 424, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1677390019}
review:
.     The last point and click game I finished was DOTT. (That's Day of the Tentacle for all you young'ins out there.) So when I picked up this game I wasn't particularly expecting it to engage my interest beyond a mild Sci-Fi fascination.
.     From the first 10 minutes of playing I discovered an involving Sci-Fi story. This, compounded with the nostalgic, low resolution graphics, fired my imagination. Now I am eager to learn what lies in store for the main protagonist and his delightfully snarky side-kick.

.     I recommend this game for those of you with large imaginations and a penchant for dystopian Sci-Fi worlds.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006176581', 'num_games_owned': 488, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1420175222}
review: Primordia is an awesome game that definitely gives any of the Blackwell games a run for its money. The design is retro but is very fitting to the sci-fi steampunk world. The actors are awesome, pairing Logan Cunningham (The Narrarator from Bastion) with Abe Goldfarb (Joey Mallone from The Blackwell series). Their relationship is fun to watch and their banter is hilarious. This game is very amusing but gives one a lot to think about. This game has definite replay value for the hidden achievements, commentary, and multiple endings. A WadjetEye favorite that will be tough to beat.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972469767', 'num_games_owned': 265, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 1739, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1690, 'last_played': 1590390631}
review:
Wow. What an incredible little game. This is the second point and click adventure I've ever completed and it was worth every penny. If I'm not mistaken this game was Greenlit on Steam, Wormwood Studios is an Indie developer with a lot of support in the GOG community. The style and apocalyptic hand painted backdrops of each space is nothing short of awe inspireing. I didn't even mind having to play in a lower res and sacrificing my second screen to play this game. Very cool story line and excellent sound score kept me gripped 'til the end. If this game looks interesting to you, do yourself a favor and try it out, especially if it's on sale, you just might love it, ya dingus!

p.s. The song on Horatio's phonograph "Dreams Of Green" by Kim Beokbinder and Nathaneil Chambers is one of the most haunting and beautiful compisitions reflecting a post apocalytpic landscape that I've heard, Only proof that behind any great game, there needs to be great music. 

Wormwood Studios, I hope this isn't the last Primordia title, thank you guys for this piece of art.

Still Hoping for that sequel..

author: {'steamid': '76561197991897291', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1419578304}
review:
What is the value of life, and do we value it differently if it is being carried out by automatons? What separates an automaton from a human being? How did the world get to the point where no human beings are present, and the myth of man is a religion whose reality may well be akin to our stories of Greek and Egyptian gods of old?

What is a creation myth really about?

This is a puzzle adventure game that asks a lot of questions. It doesn't really answer most of them, instead weaving a fairly straightforward story that gives up a lot of philosophy to chew on the side.

For the most part, the goals seem pretty straightforward, though at times the puzzles fall into the trap of trying to guess exactly what 'clever' gimmick the developers were trying to obfuscate this time to make you feel clever for figuring it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112380247', 'num_games_owned': 422, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1531289150}
review: I love this game just the fact that it feel's like a old point and click dos pc game. And the story is pretty soild but some of the puzzle's u would have a hard time here and there. So if u like a creepy dark tone game with some fun chacters I would highly recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963917985', 'num_games_owned': 427, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1419611088}
review:
This is a game that was on my wishlist for a while. My primary interest was the visual style, which reminded me somewhat of Machinarium, a lovely adventure puzzler I played a few years back. Primordia is more a traditional adventure game however and I wasn't prepared for how fully it sucked me in once I began playing.

It all begins with a robot named Horatio ... Horatio Nullbuilt v. 5 to be precise. Horatio has a problem, the power core to his fixer-upper airship the UNNIIC has just been stolen by a badass bruiser bot and without it, he and his floating companion Crispin will die a slow death out in the dunes, unable to recharge their batteries or get anywhere that they can do so in time. Thus begins this rather unassuming, but ultimately rather epic point-and-click adventure game.

My few problems with Primordia are the same I have with most retro-style adventure games, those being the combination of low res graphics and archaic systems making it difficult to know what is clickable and what is not. Playing "hunt the pixel" along with environments filled with "flavor" clickables, meant I missed a few crucial objects here and there, leading to a bit of frustration. Other than that however, the puzzles of Primordia are mostly logical, with only a few moments of "how was I supposed to know that?" or where a lack of full understanding of all that Horatio and Crispin together could do kept me confused.

The story and world building in Primordia more than make up for any shortcomings however. Set in a world populated only by robots, where "Man" is nothing more than a myth for all but a few devoted "Humanists", Primordia frames the typical post-apocalyptic dystopia in a fresh light. While at times predictable, the interactions between characters makes even a conclusion you've already jumped to a joy to behold. The dialog in Primordia oozes with personality, especially between the stoic Horatio and the sardonic Crispin. While oft-times broadly drawn, getting to know the denizens of the world of Primordia is half the fun, especially learning the quirks of their robotic society. There is plenty of lore to uncover as well throughout the game, fleshing out the periphery of the world and ultimately contributing to the main story in interesting ways.

By the time all is said and done, you'll have explored a rich world in Primordia, made choices that actually matter, and experienced one of several endings, some of which are locked by key decisions earlier in the game. On sale or not, I cannot recommend Primordia enough to adventure game fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086510077', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1212, 'last_played': 1443485789}
review: The game was great. The designs were fantastic and definitely delivered on the retro feel. Though there are some teeni tiny points where the art could have had a second pass over. All in all. . .  Its a wonderful game with a great story and a world with possibility for expansion. I would really love to see a continuation but if that never happens, the game itself (depending on the ending you get) didn't leave me feeling unsatisfied. Definitely give Primordia a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018542501', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1419360893}
review: Best of the classic style point&click adventure games!

author: {'steamid': '76561198094201987', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1419501876}
review: I'm really enjoying this game, it really reminds me of those classics Lucas Arts games. It's really well done although it crashes quite often on my pc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036199260', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 443, 'last_played': 1419152736}
review: The voice acting, humour and artwork make this game. The puzzles are pretty consistent in their level of difficulty but there are one or two that are quite obscure, especially when items that the main character has no interest in and has discounted are quietly brought back into play. There's replay value for the multiple endings, so save the game before you meet your nemesis!

author: {'steamid': '76561197960342473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 157, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1419128479}
review:
Its the postapocalypse (again) and everybodies robots!

Good point and click adventure. Avoids the "lets mash everything in the inventory together to maybe do something to progress" problem with sensible puzzles or blatant hints from your robo sidekick if youre stuck too long.

Rather short unfortunately.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012449414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1586673453}
review: Even though I found some of the puzzles a little obscure, it was a great experience in the end. I was very happy I picked up this game on sale ($2.99). If you are a fan of point and click it might be worth the ten dollar asking price. The wrold is beautiful and the story is interesting. There are little choices you make along the way and around seven different endings. Deffinately worth picking up if you like point and click or puzzle games in gereral.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154636136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1419103999}
review:
In case you are interested in a light hearted adventure, this game is not for you. The puzzles are not hard, but sometimes you end up, clicking objects combination without sense. Storyline is good and well thought out; dialogue and voice acting are fine.

Biggest flaw: Too little direction
Biggest plus: Multiple endings

author: {'steamid': '76561197970846183', 'num_games_owned': 335, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1613119247}

author: {'steamid': '76561197985854665', 'num_games_owned': 254, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1419012956}
review:
This game will take you by your hand, like a good novel, and will go with you on a rather unique and intriguing journey. 
My only regret is, that I waited this long to actually buy this game. 
Once I came to the end of this game, which was very satisfying, I really wanted more. I would hope for a sequel in one way or another.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998700126', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 742, 'last_played': 1363503600}

author: {'steamid': '76561197960695510', 'num_games_owned': 1726, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 683, 'last_played': 1417718367}
review: Music, voice acting, artistic style, and writing were all superb. The puzzles weren't overly easy like some adventure games nowadays, at at least a few were very rewarding to solve. I didn't feel like a single puzzle was "forced." A+

author: {'steamid': '76561198034766576', 'num_games_owned': 1714, 'num_reviews': 723, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1418953482}
review: Interesting point-and-click game with great OST, graphics and post-apocalyptic setting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010695371', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1357113600}
review: Great point and click. Unique setting, good voice acting. Hope to see more in the same vein.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032549543', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1001, 'last_played': 1418892746}
review:
As a ginormous fan of point-and-click games, having grown up playing the old Sierra Classics, I absolutely love Primordia. The art really hits the nostalgia button for those old VGA games and I feel like I'm back in the late 1990's sitting at a computer for hours playing Space Quest or something. The only real criticism I have of the game is the lack of dying. Some of the best memories of the old P&C adventures back in the day were the hilarious ways you could off yourself, but it's a minor gripe. Based on the humor in this game, death scenes could have potentially been awesome.

If you've played those old classics, this game is right up your alley. It seems to me that the developers here wanted to make a game faithful to those older titles, and I appreciate that.

Get it. It's awesome.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036453623', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1409612795}
review: One of the best point-and-click games I've ever played, in the league of the best LucasArts and Sierra titles. A must have for all old adventure and sci-fi lovers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001541057', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1383879853}
review: Nicely made

author: {'steamid': '76561198105632156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2653, 'last_played': 1558835482}
review:
A fantastic world. Melancholy, but with as much hope as you are willing to make. I did NOT expect some of the endings, nor that there would be so many.

But if you choose one of the good endings, I foresee [b] definite [/b] sequel potential, especially if you investigate thoroughly and read/watch the official short story prequel "Fallen". [spoiler] Think of a cross between the shows "Firefly" and "The 100". [/spoiler]

Unfortunately, the developers have slipped up [b] majorly [/b] in their commentary mode. Some words unfit to be spoken or heard (as in, the absolute worst the English language can offer), tarnishing Primordia's otherwise shining image. Simply don't pry in commentary mode and you'll be golden.

For the game proper, I recommend this mechanical crisis of faith.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018207767', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 619, 'last_played': 1418479675}
review:
Although Primordia is a game small in scope in several ways, it manages to insinuate a world so much bigger and personalitites so much deeper than it can actually describe. 
Our main character Horatio is pragmatic and taciturn, in contrast to his cheerful companion, the little floating robot Crispin; But these are only the main characters; throughout the game you meet numerous different robots with distinct personalities and little by little you learn more about the city of Metropol, and how it became what it is. 

The game mechanics are your old-school adventure game point-and-click, as well as the retro-style graphics. 
If you find the pixely look of the game distasteful, rest assured, it has all the pixels it needs to convey the worn-down world you explore. The puzzles vary in difficulty, but if you find yourself stuck, you can ask Crispin for hints. Throughout most of the game I found the difficulty quite suitable. 
Also, certain dialogue outcomes will affect the game- there are multiple endings to this story!

What makes Primordia worth playing, and what makes it stand out from other games that are also worth playing, is its extraordinary world-building and story-telling. Through simple means it manages to be engaging and touching and pokes at my curiosity for story- one that I choose the ending for. 
A playthrough is about 6 hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011486296', 'num_games_owned': 594, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1074, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1074, 'last_played': 1417409920}
review: A very enjoyable point & click adventure with an interesting environment and story. The art style and sound is very memorable and unique. The voice acting is also very good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035054806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 201, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1417480960}
review:
Love the story. Love the Heavy Metal mag feel. Hate the graphics quality. Game play is a tad too crude, but tolerable for a point and click.

Next time devs  spend more money on art!

author: {'steamid': '76561198033721218', 'num_games_owned': 771, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1527190442}

author: {'steamid': '76561198072796582', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1389278131}
review: unique awesome envierment and good story

author: {'steamid': '76561198052109022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1418276520}
review: Primordia is a good game. Hard to get through at times due to the fact that it is very challenging. If you‚Äôre looking for something that looks pretty and ‚Äúnext-gen‚Äù look elsewhere. Personally I adore the art style but others may not appreciate the graphics as much. The story is fast paced if not held back by trying to figure things out. I used a walkthrough and found it could be played through in 4 hours. A complete sci-fi romp, it will remind you of Darkseed, I Have No Mouth, and other point and click adventures of the good old days. The voice acting was sharp and the music was amazingly well done. Wonderfully polished game that was fun to play, this is for sure worth a buy. 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197962976535', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 616, 'last_played': 1417762061}
review:
An artistic gem of a game, Primordia really hits the spot for an old school point and click adventure. What really draws you in is the unique story and interesting dialogue along with the sci-fi, post apocalyptic setting.

Overall I really enjoyed this game, but there are definitely a few things that could have been improved. The game setup before you launch the game can only be accessed in the game folder and can't be launched in game or through steam. When the setup is run it's somewhat confusing and I always felt as if the graphics weren't set up right. Watching the trailer for the game confirms this when I see crisp, clean graphics on the store page and fuzzy, muddy graphics on mine and changing to higher settings just seemed to make it look worse. It seems though that that developers are continuing to make improvements, so maybe this can be fixed in the future.

Balance in the game seemed a bit lacking as solving puzzles became an effort in frustration at times. Having your sidekick Crispin give you clues helped quite a bit, but even with his help some areas required random trial and error because you had no clue what to do. Without a little help from a guide I probably wouldn't have finished the game. 

Minor gripes aside though, I had a great time playing this game. With a quality soundtrack, voice acting and funny dialogue it was well worth it. Multiple endings helped keep it interesting a bit as well with radically different results to the storyline. Definitely a must play for point and click adventure fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027970604', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1417729455}
review: Ottimo "punta e clicca" vecchio stile, trama molto ben costruita ed enigmi mai banali. Un must se vi piace il genere (e se non avete problemi con l'inglese, visto che l'italiano non √® presente)!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198125235157', 'num_games_owned': 449, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1417505982}
review:
Primorida is one of those games that's really emotionally devastating and depressing and you do feel bad for the characters and the world, but there's also that part of you that didn't really attach yourself to the characters and you're almost kinda glad to have it over and done with.

As a point-and-click adventure game (and as a story) its all really well put together. The graphics and music create an eerie setting. Upon entering the city of Metropol, I immediately felt a disease with everything around me. Every step taken is a direct threat to the big bad, for the mere fact you aren't obeying her every word from the get-go. The knowledge that the bad guy is watching your every move and is intelligent enough to start planning hundreds of steps ahead makes me shiver.

The puzzles are what you'd expect in a robot apocolypse: very technological, a strict sense of rules behind each one. All give off an extra feeling that speaks to me as "yep. Puzzles caused by robots alright."

By the end though, I didn't feel particularly emotionally affected. Which was weird because I did feel for the characters. I gasped at plot twists, I shivered at the Big Bad, and my heart felt like it was stepped on when spoiler stuff happened. But I suppose it was just brief moments of emotions rather than a lasting impact. Maybe apocolypse stuff isn't my thing. Maybe it was that the darkness of the plot sort of negated any victory. I won but it didn't feel like a win. Maybe that was the point.

Whatever, I'm rambling. TL:DR: its a good game. Really. If you play point-and-clicks or apocolypse games are your thing, check it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977519420', 'num_games_owned': 1058, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 531, 'last_played': 1417538657}
review: The first point and click I've ever finished. Great aesthetic, well written dialogue, puzzles that make you feel clever without being overly obtuse. It's an amazing game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022964277', 'num_games_owned': 991, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1417552331}
review: It is an excellent point and click adventure. It is a little short (taking me only 4 hours) ,and it would fast forward through text randomly if I didn't switch the text and voice option. However, For the price it's at it is well worth it in my opinion. It had great puzzles that really made me think in order to figure them out. In the end I would give this game a 8/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044469313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1558750143}
review: the Art alone makes it worth it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197987213114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 771, 'last_played': 1570916311}
review:
A true gem among adventure games. 

The puzzles are most of the time very manageable without becoming menial or to hard.

One of those rare games that you think about 2 weeks after you have finished it and even now months later I still think about this game's world from time to time. 

It doesn't tell you everything, but will let you figure out things about the world yourself. I've read other reviews stating that the story in never told which is nothing but nonsense. This game will tell you a story about a series of well defined characters but will leave large parts of the world unexplained but with enough hints to give you a good ground to figure the rest out your self. This is not a weakness but a strength. Leaving mysteries makes a world grow and leaves place for the players imagination.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972566358', 'num_games_owned': 1866, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 450, 'last_played': 1527389516}
review: Cool environment, interesting characters, good sci-fi/post-apocalypse story. Thoroughly enjoyed this point and click adventure. Some puzzles were quite confusing or non-sensical, but most are decent. I wish I could increase the resolution, but that seems to be a common thing with Wadjet Eye games. Overall it didn't detract too much from the experience. Occasionally the sidekick got annoying. Occasional crashes, once was catastrophic (had to restart from the beginning, thankfully I remembered everything), but usually stable. I'd recommend it if you like this sort of game and you can get it in a bundle or discounted.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993200821', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1474745449}
review: I've been heralding this game as a triumphant return to adventure games done right.  It's got a good plot, the puzzles make sense, and everything is quite smooth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028169638', 'num_games_owned': 108, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 732, 'last_played': 1379152333}
review: Great story, a mature and really deep one. I think its one of the best point & click game I ever play. The only minus is the poor graphics (pixels!). But still ist a great game and I really enjoy plain it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987665992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 936, 'last_played': 1417774350}
review:
Sehr empfehlenswert!
Primordia ist ein Point n Click Adventure, das den Vergleich mit Genrevertretern wir Monkey Island und Day of the Tentacle nicht zu scheuen braucht. Die Grafik ist stimmig, die Charaktere (allesamt Roboter) sympathisch und vielf√§ltig. Die Geschichte, die in einem postapokalyptischen Szenario spielt, zieht einen sofort in den Bann. Leider ist das Spiel komplett in englischer Sprache und die Dialoge laufen zu allem √úberfluss sehr schnell ab.
Trotzdem ist das Spiel auf jeden Fall den Kauf wert, ich habe beinahe eine schlechtes Gewissen, weil ich es sehr g√ºnstig durch ein Bundle erhalten habe.
Ich kann nur hoffen, dass es einen Nachfolger gibt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053265014', 'num_games_owned': 1339, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 866, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1451834456}
review: A marvelous point'n'click adventure! Unique world design, great atmosphere and story, accompanied with nice music and a perfect voice acting. Its puzzles can be hard sometimes, but I think they're still easier to figure out than in older point'n'click games (e.g. Broken Sword or Flight of the Amazon Queen). I recommend it with whole heart!

author: {'steamid': '76561198018729054', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 513, 'last_played': 1516513226}
review: A truly beautiful game. Magnificent story line, art and voice acting. I have not enjoyed any game as much as Primordia in quite a few years. This game can't be missed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083623701', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 973, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 973, 'last_played': 1417040939}
review:
In all honesty, if you don't like point and click games you should still pick up this one. This was my first point and click game, and I absolutely fell in love with it. The story is very intriguing, the voice acting is top notch, and the setting and atmosphere are very immersive.

The only warning I'd give is the challenging puzzles to solve. Some are straight forward and easy, others can make you pull your hair out. Don't let that dissuade you from the game though, the story and the world are very much worth the effort. 

Give Primordia a shot, you won't regret it. If you are still uncertain about shelling out the full cost, wish list it and nab it when it hits a sale. A must have point and click adventure!

author: {'steamid': '76561198000705826', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 602, 'last_played': 1411906305}
review:
Beeindruckend atmosph√§risch und fesselnd trotz minimaler Grafik.
Mit einer faszinierenden Geschichte und unerwarteten Wendungen.

Eine Perle im Point&Click Genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060161681', 'num_games_owned': 399, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1037, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1554415911}
review: Maybe one day I will actually try to finish the puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981941599', 'num_games_owned': 458, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1445389977}
review: A strong visual identity, excellent voice acting, and a modernized interface designed for immediacy make PRIMORDIA an excellent addition to any games library. Really outstanding are the multiple endings, some of which are only possible if you discovered alternate solutions to other puzzles, earlier. Veterans of the point-and-click style will find lots to enjoy, here. Newcomers will find this game to be a tour-de-force of what this style has to offer. Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964177692', 'num_games_owned': 603, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1374476537}
review: This game has great writing, great characters, an original sci-fi setting and it's a classic point and click but most of the puzzles make sense as opposed to randomly throwing things together.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056980805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 1182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1182, 'last_played': 1415418647}
review: I greatly enjoyed the story and the setting. The puzzles were mostly logical and having crispan provide hints every now and then was good for when you quit playing for a few days and try to remember what you were working on. Wish it was longer or they had more in the same setting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045823827', 'num_games_owned': 267, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1392841808}
review: If you like point and clicks this game is for you. I'm not really a fan of point and click games except maybe a little Myst. The game has great art, great voice acting and a wonderful story with multiple endings. I wish for a sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972298154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 566, 'last_played': 1411887317}
review: A great point-and-click story reminiscent of the good-old-days of adventure games. You play as a robot navigating a post-apocalyptic world of scrap and sand in search of a thief. The writing is good, the logic puzzles are fun (although there was one that stood out as a stumper), and the art is fantastic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001076866', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 854, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 764, 'last_played': 1456030285}
review:
Klasse. Ein √ºberragendes Spiel, verpackt als klassisches Adventure. Was als einfache Suche mit Sidekick (ein kleiner, ulkiger, fliegender Roboter) nach einem gestohlenen Gegenstand beginnt, entpuppt sich schnell als globales und metaphysisches Dilemma, das die eine oder andere philosophische Frage aufwirft und das viele unterschiedliche Enden des Spiels zu l√§sst. Und von Enden passiert nur eins auf Knopf-Druck. Alle anderen erfodern noch etwas Erforschung und Hirnschmalz. Ein Ende erfordert auch eine unterschiedliche Vorgehensweise bei fr√ºheren R√§tseln. Bei einigen R√§tseln gibt es auch mehrere L√∂sungen. Das Inventar bleibt w√§hrend des gesamten Spiels √ºberschaubar, wilde Kombinationen und unlogische Puzzles gibt es nicht. Der Sidekick des ernsten und fokusierten Protagonisten ist witzig und unterhaltsam und lockert damit die durchweg ernste Atmosph√§re etwas auf (vergleichbar mit der Laterne aus Zork: Der Gro√üinquisitor oder Arthur aus The Journeyman Project 3: Legacy of Time). Hin und wieder gibt es Easter Eggs und Anspielungen auf andere Spiele (so tauscht ein H√§ndler einen Wasserchip gegen ein G.E.C.K.) Das Spiel ist kurz (habe etwa 9 Stunden gebraucht und bin kein Adventure-Pro), beh√§lt dadurch aber seinen Faden und seine Spannung und verliert sich nicht endlosen Nebenplots, die vom eigentlichen Plot ablenken.

Wer also von klassischen click & point Adventures begeistert ist, kann hier bedenkenlos zuschlagen. Wichtig ist nur, dass man sich nicht von der Grafik abschrecken l√§sst, die zwar grob und gering aufgel√∂st, aber trotzdem unglaublich stimmungsvoll ist. Adventure-Neulinge sind mit dem Spiel auch gut beraten, da die R√§tsel nicht zu √ºberfordernd sind, es auf Wunsch auch die eine oder andere ingame-Hilfe gibt und das Spiel sich nicht z√§h in die L√§nge zieht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033980198', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 658, 'last_played': 1401581241}
review:
Best point-and-click game I've ever played.  The puzzles are challenging and require patience but aren't as frustrating as point-and-click games made in the 90's - some can be solved in multiple ways and may effect the ending of the game.  The storyline is extremely captivating and offers a pretty different look at religion despite being a sci-fi game through and through.

I highly suggest not reading any spoilers!  This game is all about the immersion.

9.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198060616666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 969, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1419713774}
review:
An amazing cyberpunk point & click adventure filled with humour, the voice acting is simply fenomenal, and all the characters are so unique.
The atmosphere is absolutely fabulous, it reminds me alot of "Beneath a Steel Sky" which is also an amazing point & click that i absolutely loved.
The companion robot¬¥s voice could sound a little more robot¬¥ish, but once you get used to it, you¬¥ll find yourself completely immerged into the games storyline as horatio and is companion struggle to get their stolen item back.
I seriously recommend this game to anyone that loves a good story and/or Cyberpunks.
This is without a doubt, a must have.
- 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198040789519', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1703820675}
review:
"Line up the toy soldiers, two hundred abreast. The bravest of brave, the best of the best. Wind up the toy soldiers to march on their way. The city is fallen, no reason to stay. Two hundred abreast, my sisters and brothers. Now only three left, forget all the others." 

Primordia is a point and click adventure game that more than rivals titles like "I Have No Mouth and I Must Scream, Machinarium, Botanicula, etc." It takes place in a post human world, where advanced AI have claimed what is left of the wasteland that is the planet. 

The voice acting in this game is top notch, incorporating even the talents of Logan Cunningham. The characterization of the entire cast though, hinges on the environment they are thrust in. And how each sentience has chosen to deal with their circumstances. 

The game itself is quite serious in tone and changes in severity depending on which ending you achieve. Though there are many breaks from this dark nature when Horatio and Crispin interact with one another, often ending in clever word play or sarcastic optimism. It's something I hope they continue with a sequel or a run off featuring different characters. This is the type of game that would make a wonderful animation on the silver screen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984072136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 570, 'last_played': 1414092541}
review:
I Absolutely LOVED this game.
the Narrative, the voice actors, the puzzles...
i havent played a game like this in YEARS!!!

Worth every penny.
even though its pretty short
(there are some really tough puzzles to the end out there and there are lots of endings which are also amazing on their own)

If you enjoy games that actually make you think and don't hold your hand you will love this game.

Highly recommend.
will be replaying this and posting it on YT definetly!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197989127216', 'num_games_owned': 318, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1413813787}
review:
Phenomenal adventure with a deep story and a lot of lore.

All that in a depressing world, where hu(mans) won't exist anymore and (man)built machines build machines. Just like in "mans" nature, they also destroy themselves, just to reach more power and progress.

Cons: -The logic of some puzzles is just not understandable.

Rating: 8/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998042847', 'num_games_owned': 916, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 542, 'last_played': 1355904000}
review:
Das schlechte an Point-and-Click Spielen heutzutage ist, dass man jederzeit online nachschauen k√∂nnte, wenn man nicht weiter k√§me. Bei diesem Spiel ist das anfangs auch nicht notwendig. Man denkt sich: nicht zu leicht, bockt voll, gutes Spiel. Und dann, ab einem bestimmten Punkt (und ich werde ihn nicht spoilern), wird es einfach nur unfair und kryptisch. Nach stundenlangem ALLES-mit-ALLEM-kombinieren, Dialogoptionen durchgehen, Pixel f√ºr Pixel absuchen, schl√§gt man "verdammtnochmal" nach, liest... und denkt: was haben sich die Entwickler dabei blo√ü gedacht?!

Update:
Wie ich am Feedback sehen kann, hab ich mich vielleicht nicht klar genug ausgedr√ºckt...
Ich hab nichts gegen Youtube Tutorials oder andere online Beschreibungen, Erkl√§rungen wie man eine Sp√ºlmaschiene repariert oder einen lecker veganen Kuchen backt... Dieser kollektive-on-demand-Wissenspool ist wirklich praktisch. Aber man sollte das bei Games einfach nicht machen m√ºssen.
Nun verlangt das Spiel, an besagter Stelle [spoiler]dem Redlien Text[/spoiler], eben nicht das Verst√§ndniss von Kausalzusammenh√§ngen oder kreativem Nachdenken.
Beispiel: Erinnert sich jemand an diese Nummernkarten, die fr√ºher als Kopierschutz bei Spielen dabei waren? Stell dir einfach mal vor, du willst daddeln und kannst nicht, weil diese Karte verloren gegangen ist. Ach ja, wir sind in den fr√ºhen 90ern und du hast kein Internet.
So ist Primordia!

author: {'steamid': '76561198041490711', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 570, 'last_played': 1410067169}
review: I very well told story.  A great point and click adventure game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069087749', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1412899492}
review:
I really liked this game. It had great atmosphere, nice voice acting, and the story really *worked*. The world was well-developed, the characters were interesting, the sidekick adds a bit of humour. The multiple different endings is also a nice touch that you don't always see in adventure games. 

I think this is one of the best adventure games I've played lately. Really nice work.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989389547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1577586950}
review:
I hate point and click adventure games. . . I find them to be obtuse and difficult for no real reason. On the other hand, I had to play this one. It looks incredible, the vibe is so amazing... I still boot it up just get to back into the feeling that this game sets. Game play is as expected for a point and click I suppose ... click on a lot of things, combine them in ways that make no sense. 

The story is excellent, the humor is witty... this game gets a 9/10 for me just because of the atmosphere alone.  . . oh and dont forget the incredible gritty sound track.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076721797', 'num_games_owned': 913, 'num_reviews': 774, 'playtime_forever': 731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 578, 'last_played': 1417657294}
review:
A fantastic point-and-click adventure brimming with atmosphere and clever puzzle design, with barely any flaws to speak of.
So let's get those out of the way first. The biggest flaw is that the game occasionally has pixel-hunting puzzles, which are never good. Bad developers. Only time in the game I looked at guides was when I was missing something from pixel hunting (random LCD screen, bah, random floating junk, what even?)
The palette's also a bit dull overall; I get the point of having so much brown but it gets a little tiring to look at after a while, though the game's gorgeous looking otherwise.
That aside, only the postitives left. The two protagonist characters each have quite a bit of personality to them and play off each other well for plenty of amusing moments, though the game still keeps a fairly serious and dark tone throughout. The other various characters are all quite unique and memorable and serve the overall plot in interesting ways, usually having their own mini-arcs. The backstory and worldbuilding is also very rich, not outright saying a lot but leaving the pieces scattered for the player to put together. 
The puzzles are also generally good. Plenty of the standard item-trading things but there's no moon logic present there. And there's straight up logic puzzles on occasion, too, which are probably the most fun. There's no need to memorize strings of numbers or information, either; the game auto-saves all relevant data in the main character's datapouch, as well as providing a map for quick travel. It's got a lot of old-school adventure game design with a more modern feel to it, making it both well-crafted and elegant in execution.
There's a lot to like here and little to dislike, I heavily recommend it to, well, pretty much anyone really, but especially point-and-click enthusiasts, because this is certainly top-tier in that regard.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039843270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 944, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 849, 'last_played': 1465265280}
review:
What an amazing game! 

If you are a point & click adventure lover, like myself, you'll feel good with this game. :D
If you are not into adventure games, but appreciates good stories and atmospheres, you'll like it also.

It reminds me of Beneath A Steel Sky, another amazing cyberpunk adventure, but Primordia is darker.  

Worth mentioning:
 - Awesome atmosphere (what can I say? Mysterious cyberpunk raining scenarios are awesome... Hey Gemini Rue!)
 - Very good story
 - Challenging puzzles (but resisted walkthroughs, I have a trauma regarding The Dig... :( The last and only I "cheated")
 - Nice background arts
 - Good voice acting (like all Wadjet Eye games, I must say)

author: {'steamid': '76561198006356894', 'num_games_owned': 2663, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1417198357}

I recommend it

author: {'steamid': '76561197980409388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1411575892}
