The narrative and characters are believable and intriguing, and the art-style and music fit together perfectly. Gritty cyberpunk post-apocalyptic story exploring what it means to be human (sort of).

author: {'steamid': '76561198061830960', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1375657325}
review: A point-and-click puzzle game set in a post-apocalyptic dystopian robo-future, this game satisfies many things: it's well-written, well-acted, easy to grasp mechanically, gorgeously drawn, and addictive. Not to mention there are multiple endings, every one of which was incredibly satisfying. It's not long, but it doesn't need to be. I cried twice while playing, which is more than I can say for longer, more popular games with supposedly gripping stories.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035771275', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 773, 'last_played': 1434591811}
review: Frustrating, beautiful, brilliant, compelling and unforgettable. One of the best games I've ever played, with characters so human you will forget they're actually robots.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031091629', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 723, 'last_played': 1398072673}
review:
I'm sorry to say that I was rather disappointed with this game. I think the trailer made me expect too much from it (what else is new). And the first half of the game itself made me expect too much from the second half. I can't really say how without spoiling, unfortunately. Let's just say that I expected some pretty grand moments that the game never even came close to delivering. But I would still recommend this game, as parts of the story are pretty interesting and some of the puzzles and conversations are cool.

I do have to talk about Crispin though. It feels like they tried to make a Wheatley-esque character who follows you everywhere, and is kind of annoying but also endearing and adorable. Unfortunately they made Crispin too much of a smartass, so he comes off as not very endearing, not even remotely adorable, but still quite annoying. His lines also get very tiresome, as they are often just lame puns and jokes, and he doesn't have a very large number of them. And aside from scripted scenes, his comedic presence didn't change in response to the increasingly minatory plot, which often ruined the tone.

Lastly, the voice-acting generally isn't very good. The villain probably has the best voice-acting. The voices themselves? Very good, well-chosen, well-suited to their characters. But the acting itself wasn't very good. It's fairly boring and I got tired of listening to everyone speak pretty quickly. Perhaps this was intentional because they were robots, but you can make someone sound robotic without sacrificing solid, emotive acting (case in point: [i]Portal[/i]).

author: {'steamid': '76561198101060074', 'num_games_owned': 348, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 477, 'last_played': 1417868919}
review: Great game! The graphic is old-style, but beautiful, and the plot is engaging. All the puzzles in the game are logical, funny and never frustrating. I definitely want to play it again at some point in time, to watch the alternative endings.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995810377', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1400050291}
review:
To say it in a few short words: Entertaining, challenging, short. I found the world and the wealth of information floating within it to be quite stimulating. You could tell the write really knows the world inside and out in ways that are only scratched at in the game. A few spots did require me to look at a walkthrough, but only one had a completely out there solution that I never would have seen on my own. Most of the time I had just missed simple things. 

My one major complaint is just how short the game is. I finished it in only a couple of hours, though admittedly I missed a single side quest. I just really wish there was more to it. It feels like there was supposed to be, but things got lopped off. Oh well. For the price I paid I was happy, but don't spend over ten bucks on the thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976743217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1400708976}
review: It's cool! Bladerunner meets Broken sword!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027355802', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 708, 'last_played': 1410701019}
review:
Excellent old-school point and click adventure. Great storyline and characters, easy to use interface. Left click to use, right click to look at, and several options to speed things up, such as the map and the data pouch which records all important clues.

I needed help to reach the ending, and then help to get a good ending, but all the puzzles were logical and none felt random or unfair. You do sometimes need to go back to somewhere you've already visited and speak to someone again but much less so than in many games.

I found this walkthough useful: http://www.gamezebo.com/games/primordia/walkthrough-cheats-strategy-guide#chapter-2-finding-arbiter but it does contain spoilers, so I only used it when totally stuck.

The resolution is low and I found the visuals rather darker (ie harder to see) than I'd have liked but those were minor quibbles and I enjoyed the game hugely.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002231721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1277, 'last_played': 1449724477}
review: Cute point & click adventure with a balanced blend of both simple and more challenging puzzles, plus a decent storyline (although the ending/s seem somewhat abrupt). Pretty good overall, definitely worth the money I paid for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983609040', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 544, 'last_played': 1443161278}
review:
a favorite point-and-click, and among the best in the Wadjet Eye library.

Unique story, fantastic art direction, multiple endings

author: {'steamid': '76561197961088233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1507433092}
review: Great game.  If you loved any of the older 90's lucasarts games, this game is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979693740', 'num_games_owned': 5698, 'num_reviews': 313, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1399256306}
review:
Primordia is an attempt at a weighty story that somewhat misses its mark in execution.  As in all adventure games, things start innocently (loosely applied) enough as a giant robot looking like the mobile version of HAL crossed with a lobster (I know, right?) invades your home on a derelict ship and steals your power core.  You, Horatio, from a long line of previous Horatios, must now find a way to retrieve it.  It should be mentioned that everyone in this game, including you, is a robot, and as you begin to explore the world and meet its denizens, you'll find yourself wrapped in a robot existentialist's wetware runtime environment, rolling around in what amounts to be the robotic version of a Kafka story... okay, maybe not that weighty.  There's just something about the ending (of which there are many) that just never seems satisfying, even if you take all the steps to do the 'good' one.  That being said, Primordia still manages to tell its story with care and it's delivered in perfectly-bleak dialogue for a perfectly-bleak world.

Technically, the game suffers a little bit from a few questionable design decisions.  Being (I assume) an homage to the point 'n' click (PNC) games of yesteryear, the developer insisted on a low-res, 2D game - which is great - but instead of doing what most modern games do which is make a hi-res game look low-res, this game is actually 800x600.  This isn't really that big a deal until you notice that often the character sprites don't 'belong' to the scene.  In classic adventure games, different sprites were created depending on where the character is supposed to be standing; in Primordia, the technique used instead is simply scaling down the larger sprite with the end result being a much crisper sprite on a purposely-blocky background.  Not a dealbreaker, but it can be a little bit distracting.

Other design decisions that were made are quite inexcusable in a modern PNC game.  Despite the genre being declared 'dead' for years, the truth is that the genre has thrived (loosely applied) throughout the decades and made many advances, all of which are ignored by Primordia.  For instance, in most modern PNCs, there's a hotspot-highlight button to speed along play; Primordia does not have that.  In most modern PNCs, you can usually double-click an exit to skip the slow plod of the character walking offscreen; Primordia does not have that.  To be fair, it -does- have a map system for quick travel.

Finally, there is what is known as adventure-game-logic and Primordia is rife with it.  If you're unfamiliar with the term, it is a criticism of classic adventure game puzzle solutions and how they often make little logical sense.  For example, if you needed to sharpen a pencil, logic would dictate you find a pencil sharpener, but older adventure games were known for instead making you combine a stick with a piece of glass and some tape in order to whittle the pencil... while you stand in front of a pencil sharpener.  While the puzzles in Primordia aren't quite so asinine, two extremely dense puzzles spring to mind that are just bad ideas.  Like older adventure games, you could totally sit there and work it out and feel that ego boost, but I find it hard to believe that most players won't be looking for a walkthrough when they encounter them.  That being said, most of the game is paced out well so long as you can get your head into that mindframe of the 90s and just tough it out.

All in all, Primordia is an accomplished title and a lot of love went into it, especially in the art department.  For a game entirely populated by artificial beings, there is a sort of haunting organic decay that pierces almost every piece of art in the game.  Similarly, the voice direction is quite good and despite Crispin - your sidekick floaty robot buddy - sounding a hell of a lot like Otacon from Metal Gear Solid (it doesn't fit, believe me), every one of the actors gets what the director is trying to accomplish and paints a beautiful, if desolate, piece of work.

By all accounts, I did not enjoy (but did not dislike) Primordia particularly because I found a lot of the puzzles to be purposely obtuse and the story was not one that resonated with me.  However, that does not make this a bad game and so I cannot possibly give it a thumbs down.  For some people, the story is a mindblowing, harrowing look at the nature of existence, life, its foundations, and its possible future.  It is a fascinating perspective, to be sure, but I was left unsatisfied.

Thus, if you're looking for a new PNC game, there's no reason to steer clear from this one.  What I present above are not detractions, but warnings.  PNC veterans will not bat an eye at anything that goes on in this game, but fans of modern PNC games might find a lot of things in Primordia to be frustrating.  Stick with it and it mostly rewards you - just remember that it's more about the journey than the destination in this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964292875', 'num_games_owned': 738, 'num_reviews': 238, 'playtime_forever': 3013, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3013, 'last_played': 1399079186}
review: An excellent adventure post-apoc neo-noir robot adventure game about the world without humans. You control Horatio robot and his sidekick Crispen and must explore the desert wastelands and the ruined former human cities in search of a power core to power your own spaceship. Along you get to meet amazing characters and find the story about the fall of humans and the rise of the robots. I love this game and highly recommend it . 9 /10

author: {'steamid': '76561198002675684', 'num_games_owned': 1492, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 450, 'last_played': 1465490738}
review:
I absolutely adored this game, the story was compelling, the length was just about right. The puzzles whilst difficult where not so obtuse as that you could never figure them out aside from one. Only one time I found myself blindly trying to use as many different objects with as many different things as possible.

You genuinely feel a connection with the characters who I believe are voiced very well. The graphical style is wonderful as well.

As far as point and clicks go, this is one of my favourites. 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198023044574', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 563, 'last_played': 1417313341}
review:
Amazing game. You end up really caring for the characters and the atmosphere really draws you in. First tip though: if youre like me you will immensely hate your sidekick at first. It takes awhile... a good while.. but eventually i warmed up to him and ending up liking him as well. Beware though, he's super irritating at first in my opinion.

It's a super hard game though. You'll be looking up guides for sure. Although there are a few times it seems impossible anyone can figure it out without cheating, it at least makes sense. Example: Move the cat off the couch without entering the room. other games: put the phone in the microwave which god knows why you wanted to, but it scared the cat and now hes gone. Instead the solutions are more like: search the house, find a mousetrap, ignore the mouse hole, find a ball inside of your neighbors vacuum cleaner and use the mousetrap to shoot the ball into the room for the cat to get up and chase.

Very rewarding though!

author: {'steamid': '76561198089832553', 'num_games_owned': 452, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1398578527}
review: Wow. Just wow. Fantastic game. I've missed story telling with this level of interest and depth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032514143', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 875, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 864, 'last_played': 1399232375}
review: Ambientazione favolosa, storia che prende, personaggi ben caratterizzati

author: {'steamid': '76561197971614524', 'num_games_owned': 571, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2255, 'last_played': 1383571270}
review: Very good game. I felt it was too short even with the alternate endings. Engaging story line that leads you to want more. Well I want more!

author: {'steamid': '76561198003420249', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 976, 'last_played': 1420504871}
review:
A very strong adventure game in the mold of Day of the Tentacle or King's Quest. One of its features, missing from many other games of this genre, is a subtle hint mechanism to help when you are completely stuck. In the old days, this kind of "stuckness" was a death knell for a game that none of your friends had already beaten. Today, there's a different kind of problem, because you go all too easily to the internet to look up the answer. You do it begrudgingly, the first time, easier the second, and on the third time, you accidentally see how it ends.

But back to the game in specific: a nice balance of humor and seriousness. I dig the universe the story is set in, which brings some pretty serious gravity to the plot, but you have a zany sidekick who really does actually grow on you. The writers did a great job making you care about the characters... who are robots... Addtionally, in stark contrast to many of the "Press a button to select your ending" problems some games have presented us with recently, there are something like ten seperate endings which are... all pretty different.  All in all, bravo, very fun game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970744865', 'num_games_owned': 408, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1389096267}
review: Very memorable game. Messed my head once you reflect on it lol

author: {'steamid': '76561197983319995', 'num_games_owned': 1604, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 443, 'last_played': 1397510484}
review: A post-apocalyptic game with robots, recommended. Only thing that lets it down is it's short play time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079134182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 517, 'last_played': 1385484593}
review: I enjoyed the experience of this game. While the puzzles weren't exceptionally difficult (I guess I followed the logic of the developers well enough), but the climate and setting were exceptionally immersive for me. I advise playing it. However, expect to play it only once - twice at most.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028040879', 'num_games_owned': 280, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 487, 'last_played': 1482985291}
review:
Good story. Enjoyable. Play it. That is all.

Seriously, I understand the main character, I know when someone steals my things I go to a distant city, solve the riddles of my own creation and blow stuff up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009356603', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 1089, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 721, 'last_played': 1648196907}
review:
Gemini Rue meets Machinarium. Great story, great voice acting from all except Crispin IMO. It's a point and click game with old style graphics, but the original and futuresque story makes up for it. The mood is brought to life with the scenery and music. I enjoyed searching for answers and learning about the world. Primordia and To The Moon are games you can talk about, have a life discussion about once they are over as they deal with deeper and hypothetical life scenerious.  I appreciate games that cane bring more to the table than kill bad guy, game over. 

My only complaints are some of the puzzles are really difficult to achieve without outside help (info kiosk words). I do not like using outside help, but one puzzle requires a typed guess, that's ridiculous.  The hardest achievement isn't impossible, but requires finding the right post in the forums (I just bumped it to the top recently for those struggling for 100%).  Even though there are multiple endings, they take place at the very end (obviously) so it's not like what you did earlier in the game  really mattered, unless you were trying to get the achievements.  

Overall 8/10, I would have given it a 9/10 if that one puzzle was really impossible to figure out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007370112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 673, 'last_played': 1417215707}
review: Very fun adventure game that has a great story and setting, pick it up if you are a fan of old school adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043825929', 'num_games_owned': 2612, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1418682970}
review:
Primordia is the third Wadjet Eye P&C adventure I finished. 

I liked the other two (Gemini Rue; Resonance) for their mature stories, so it is only natural that I would like Primordia as well. But what a nice surprise to say that this game is even better!

Resonance tried cool stuff with the character switching, but I found it confusing at times. I was stuck multiple times in Gemini Rue (which obviously could be me being stupid) and think that the game sometimes had no direction to push the player to.

Primordia is just a pleasant ride from start to finish. Some of the code puzzles are a bit hard, but never frustrating. The story is just great. I loved the dark and gloomy tones and the sarcastic MC. Set in a dying world the game throws all kind of grey moral choices at the player.

Preach the Gospel of Man, fellow robots!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006321953', 'num_games_owned': 603, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 1330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 858, 'last_played': 1420960365}
review:
Brilliant story, universe feels alive and immersive, rich lore, many clever concepts regarding life / artificial life. Relatively deep philosophical themes, had me considering religion, justice and other moral subjects from new perspectives. Nothing is black & white, you can even empathise with the main antagonist. All this helps it feel original, mature and engaging.

Good puzzles, art, voice acting, music. Dialogue is neither too verbose nor too terse.

Warnings:
- low res graphics (but this can be conisidered stylised, and can help your engagement through imagination)
- not very long (about average for indie adventure, not necessarily a weakness)
- sub par animation

author: {'steamid': '76561198005400484', 'num_games_owned': 786, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1396382318}
review:
Highly recommended 
The game has many strong points from its lovely artwork that fits the theme to a T, a well written add the intriguing story that mixes good pace with foreshadowing, The puzzles are logical and in most cases can be simply solved with careful thought and the voice acting only serves to strength the atmosphere.

The only issues I have had with the game were a single crash during the intial time I ran the game and a slight bug if you try to use the steam overlay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030665841', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1584827252}
review: I came into this game not expecting much. I thought the art style was pretty neat, but as far as the story or gameplay, I really was not hoping for much. However, this game was amazing. Although at first- and even throughout much of the game, as many of the characters are lighthearted- somewhat comedic, the game's oppressive and bleak dystopian atmosphere was surprisingly dark and depressing. The game also did a good job at emotionally connecting you to Horatio and Crispin, which, really surprisingly for me, helped create a really sad feeling later on in the game. Very highly recommended. In fact, it may be one of my favorite games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025372423', 'num_games_owned': 326, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 960, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 452, 'last_played': 1677710089}
review:
Wonderful story. 
It is somewhat short, but all the same a fantastic adventure game in its own right.
Much recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002213174', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 1395529848}
review: Muy buena aventura grafica. Empiezas sin saber nada, y tiene un trasfondo de la hostia. Genial!

author: {'steamid': '76561197979919184', 'num_games_owned': 1190, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 544, 'last_played': 1392078331}
review: Ah the good 'ol days of point and click adventure games.   This game is no exception, with its riveting story of unexpected twist and turns you never know what clue will unlock the story.   This is story is had me sucked in from the beginning to the end leaving me with wanting to know more!  The puzzles are very well designed so you don't progress to quickly through the story but not so difficult that common sense isn't enough to solve it.  Maybe one day there will be a sequel, hopefully, I sure would like to think so.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962018718', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 591, 'last_played': 1385321286}
review:
[b][url=http://monthsbehindreviews.blogspot.com/2014/03/primordia.html]Click Here for the Full Review! [/url][/b]

Synopsis: A fantastically simple little adventure game. Explore the ruins of Earth to find the fiend that stole your power crystal, the device you need survive. In the process, find out what happened to man, and your surprising role in the end of the world. Make choices that change the final results of the game, and tackle puzzles that can be, at times, a bit too challenging. Enjoy the humorous back and forth between the main character (voiced by the narrator for Bastion) and his flying sidekick. A great game to play in short bursts if you tend to get stuck, or in a longer sitting if you have the fundamentals of combining items in you inventory together to form the key piece you need.

Multiple playthroughs, or saving at critical moments, are required in order to see all possible endings, of which, there are at least 7, but what happens after those possible ending scenarios depends on what you accomplished during the game - who  you saved, who you let die, etc. Took me about 7 hours during the first playthrough, largely because some of the puzzles are a bit tricky (oh, wait, I can use the Signal Transmitter on that blue light to solve this puzzle...huh.). A second playthrough took about a third of that time. I found the environment and story the game told, as well as the solidness of the gameplay, well worth my $2.50 investment, but it wouldn't be a bad deal to get it for a bit more than that, because I've rated this one 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977555139', 'num_games_owned': 589, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1394999181}
review:
This is the best games I've been playing for years (and I'm playing AC4 now).
It has a great depth, plot, atmosphere and length (maybe a little too short).
Playing Primordia was like meeting an attractive, inteligent woman :)
It was a pleasure, a well spent time, a lot of thinking - thinking about life, world around me, Ukraina and Russia, my role in it etc.
I recommend this game to every thinking human, every adventure game fan, every cyberpunk fan.
It's an art, not a simple game and it should be rewarder for it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198010395257', 'num_games_owned': 3304, 'num_reviews': 463, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1373607288}
review:
I‚Äôm a sucker for graphical adventure games, though they don‚Äôt always pan out. All the same, Wadjet Eye hasn‚Äôt let me down yet. This one‚Äôs a bit of a different take. Basically, the human race is gone and all we‚Äôre left with is machines just trying to get by and survive. Unfortunately, there‚Äôs not a whole hell of a lot else I can say because I haven‚Äôt played this one much.  So why recommend it, then? First and foremost, everything is dripping in ambience.

The artwork, animation, sounds, music‚Ä¶all of it is perfect and fitting. In a way, it almost reminds me of New Vegas in that you are nomadic and are forced into going into ‚Äúthe city‚Äù at an eventual point that only serves to further the plot with all kinds of twists.  Nevermind that there are returning voice actors from other Wadjet Eye titles that do an outstanding job and the puzzles are no joke‚Ä¶though not necessarily heavy-handed either. Again, I haven‚Äôt played too much into it, but the game is cheap and a definite throwback to earlier graphical adventure titles. I highly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029213398', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 547, 'last_played': 1435510898}
review: Unlike a lot of other adventure games, the puzzles in this one are literal logic puzzles. You play as a robot named Horatio who lives a hermit-ish existance in a post-human world with his little buddy Crispin. All is grand till a mean robot busts up your place and steals your home power supply. So now it's a quest of revenge and such. Great little game. No major issues bug-wise since they've been patched out as far as I can see. I believe it's a total of 6 endings or so. It's not completely linear but there are parts that have to be completed in certain ways if you want the achievements. Late-ish in the game there is an achievement everyone hates that requires you to enter all key words into the kiosk. If you don't have the monocle, don't worry about it yet. I recommend 2 videos on youtube by Tomoch. Write the words he uses down then type them in, don't save half way through. Do exactly what he does. Click the mores on the screen, don't type more. If you do both of those videos by the letter you should get the achievement which many people still cannot get. Achievements aside, this is a golden adventure point & click game with challenging logic puzzles with a dash of humour.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001180003', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 646, 'last_played': 1383788953}
review: My favorite iteration to date of the classic adventure game. The controls are simple and intuitive, the puzzles are logical and never forced, and the characters and story are really well fleshed-out. If you ever played any of the old LucasArts or Sierra point-and-click adventures, give Primordia a try and see what a modern adventure game looks like today.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117173921', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1391303113}
review: Short but good. A few of the puzzles had me going to the internet for help, but most of it can be solved with logic. Slightly complex logic, but still logic. Every problem has a simple solution, and you'll feel like an idiot more than once before the games through. Great point and click adventure

author: {'steamid': '76561198072666262', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1389728346}
review: If you want a game that makes you feel completely and utterly alone, this is the game for you. It makes you feel so sad, lost, and empty. It's a great point and click game and everyone should play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034664624', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1393927651}
review: Awesome game! From the great soundtrack, to the visually appealing art style, this game really hit the spot for me. The storyline is compelling, and the multiple endings are great. The characters really come to life through the dialogue, and they have great personalities... I legitimately felt sad when one of the characters died. Overall, Primordia is one of those games that you ought to own. It makes you think, not just about what to do next, but also about HOW you should go about doing it. Will be playing this game again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055889291', 'num_games_owned': 392, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 517, 'last_played': 1389018638}
review:
One of the best quests which has that very special old school atmospehere and gameplay. The story is interesting and well-told. And one of features which makes this quest unique is quiet an amount of endings, so that you can act as you think right and get an ending you deserve. Some endings won't be opened if you make wrong decisions at the beginning of your story ;) 
The pixel art is splendid and I really like the voices.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971942320', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 407, 'last_played': 1393786222}
review:
Great point and click adventure, Beautyful graphics, dramatic story that is also really funny. multyple intressting puzzles and multyple endings.
Everyone that like the old adventures should at least try this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038156154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 577, 'last_played': 1355731200}
review: great game

author: {'steamid': '76561198001584625', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1393455468}
review: some puzzles are not as obvious as they should be, but a great story and game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054393567', 'num_games_owned': 772, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1417006449}
review:
Primordia is a point and click adventure where you start off as Horatio, a robot that desperately tries to get back his power source, along with his faithful sidekick. You inevitably end up in Metropol, the city of light, where you discover its history and remember your past. Personally, I find the story more interesting than anything wadget eye has had to offer so far (better than the blackwell series and gemini rue imho) and it is the main reason I recommend this game.

+ Interesting dialogues and story
+ Funny sidekick
+ Graphic style is old but pretty
+ Multiple endings

- Humor can be a bit silly at times
- Low resolution

author: {'steamid': '76561198015616767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 614, 'last_played': 1419399242}
review: If you like point and click adventures, post-apocalyptic settings, robots, or all of the above, I highly recommend checking out this gem of a game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970672461', 'num_games_owned': 2234, 'num_reviews': 195, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1417638256}
review:
Note: I have been informed that the puzzles have been improved since I played.

Primordia is a game about robots.  Unlike Machinarium, it is a very dark and gritty setting.  While that fits the game very well, it makes the artwork quite dull and dreary, amplified by the very low resolution the game runs at.  The story, however, makes good use of the setting and is well-written and even includes multiple endings, but that unfortunately is the extent of the the game that I enjoyed.

Primordia is the best example I have run into of a modern adventure game succumbing to the classic adventure game failing of very confusing and obtuse puzzles.  If you don't already need a guide to complete the story, and you probably will, trying to complete the optional achievements is even worse, essentially necessitating the use of a guide.

It's hard for me to recommend Primordia when there's so many better adventure games to choose from.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004536530', 'num_games_owned': 721, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1393201776}
review:
Very fun point and click adventure game.  Endings leave a little to be desired-- I really wonder which one is considered the good/true end, since they all seemed to be a bit of a let-down or cop-out.  Of course, when the end of the game came around I wasn't even sure as to what I wanted happen-- certainly not flying, that's for sure.

There were a few sticky parts which were trying-- Crispin's hints could be both obvious and unhelpful.  I ended up nosing into a guide at some points, especially at the information kiosk.  

Regardless, I do recommend this game, and would probably give it a 8/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000716257', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1392840101}
review: Liked the story, characters, voice-over and multiple endings. But it was a bit short.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088871730', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1392631229}
review: Really awesome story. I am not a big fan of point and click and this really kept my interest. Puzzles were challenging and characters were well developed. Thanks for making it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970587571', 'num_games_owned': 741, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1392585263}
review: This is an incredible old-style point and click adventure. It has beautiful backgrounds, great characters with an amazing voice-over, smart dialog and a rich and original setting. It¬¥s hard, it¬¥s intelligent, it¬¥s a must-play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999455331', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1392555698}
review:
Bottom line: I can recommend this game to fans of the genre, however it is not without it's flaws. It will probably be a rewarding experience if you are willing to approach it charitably. However, there are better games of this kind to play first (Gemini Rue, the Blackwell series and so on).

Pros: A very well crafted and engaging universe, with it's own history and mythology. Some excellent puzzle design in parts. A haunting atmosphere facilitated by a decent soundtrack (probably inspired by Vangelis' Blade Runner music). Fans of Beneath a Steel Sky will find much to like here.

Cons: Impossible to enjoy without a walkthrough on hand to get over the occasional obtuse puzzle solution. Could have done with more blind testing to deal with this, or a more robust hint system. Some of the voice acting feels a little innappropriate in tone - the sidekick character in particular.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999475503', 'num_games_owned': 753, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1563458405}
review: A magnificently fun point-and-click adventure, featuring the voice of Logan Cunningham (of Bastion fame) set in a beautiful and compelling sci-fi world.  Completely worth it just for the evocative scenery.  My only complaint is that it's too short.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992111055', 'num_games_owned': 490, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 404, 'last_played': 1383251447}
review: I really really like this game. The writing is very good and the world is very interesting. It is a little short but it is super cool. GG.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994376791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1392103841}
review: Point and click adventure game, personally my favorite in the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972329496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1391904647}
review: Great story, clever puzzles, interesting dialogue, and I loved the multiple endings.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045237399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1395013113}
review: Great point and click game.  Having fun so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027365060', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 683, 'last_played': 1380140033}
review: Probably the best game i've ever played !!!! THANKS SO MUCH !!!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198079264781', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1407687367}
review: definetely worth checking out,the story is intriguing,the dialogue is clever,and the banter between the 2 main characters is great to listen to,however expect to have to check a wiki at least once,some of the puzzles REALLY go against anything a normal person would think

author: {'steamid': '76561198086225050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 808, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1644189912}
review: Excelente, muy atrapante su historia y desarrollo del juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971631274', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2060, 'last_played': 1390219694}
review:
A beautifully pixel-rendered adventure game with a surprisingly deep and almost haunting plot that leaves you pondering well after completion. Players will experience nostalgia as they are transported back to the glory days of point and click adventure games with Primordia's art style, environments, atmosphere, script, voice acting, music, and puzzles. Additionally, the ingenious inclusion of multiple endings and Steam achievements create replay value (seldom seen in this genre) and the main character (Horatio) is wonderfully voiced by none other than Bastion's Logan Cunningham. 

I highly recommend this game to any and all adventure game fans.
developer_response: Thanks!

author: {'steamid': '76561197980464172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1926, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1634370787}
review: This game is amazing. One of the most unique SciFi stories i have ever heard. The world is fantastic and the character are unforgetable. The humor is a geeks dream. Computer nerds will have a ball. If you have any free cash and time Primordia is worth a look. Though i was never into the point and click adventures, Primordia's Imaginative plot and enchanting style pulled my attention every step of the way. The game's puzzles and tech based solutions will challenge your curiosity and cleaver problem solving skills. Though what i have seen so far are single solutions to problems, the non-linear flow of the main chapters of the game are in there own write part of the puzzle, "Where the hell am i going to find and LED Display?", trust me, Primordia will challenge and enchant you. Have a look and Bsod those that pass it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025169047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 432, 'last_played': 1389974535}
review: Beautiful storyline and very inspiring dialogs make this game a must have for all adventure game lovers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000267686', 'num_games_owned': 1365, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 874, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 874, 'last_played': 1389825036}
review:
I recommend this game. However I have to point it isn't going to be the best adventure you have ever played. I really liked how decisions mattered and it's nice to see an adventure willing to take risks and giving more than one solution for most puzzles. It has its faults, but it was still very enjoyable and I would recommend to anyone looking for an adventure to take your time. 

Getting every achievement may take you some time, though playing it more than once is cool for listening to the authors commentaries. So if you're into the games "meta," I extra recommend this to you. The writer namedrops loads of great novels and other games and stories as inspirations that helped shape this game, which only makes it the more sad that this game is only "not bad." Not bad is still recommended in my book.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053109924', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 918, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 918, 'last_played': 1362988800}
review:
This is a great point and click adventure game wth entertaining puzzles, engaging story, atmospheric music and lovely artwork.

Your little sidekick Crispin is genuinely funny and I will miss him.


I loved playing this, please let there be Primordia 2 :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198074169975', 'num_games_owned': 820, 'num_reviews': 694, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1429434779}
review: I'd say it's an average game. The story isn't bad but not fascinating. The real problem is that the screens are all about brown junk because of the universe and it's often difficult to locate objects...

author: {'steamid': '76561197997302239', 'num_games_owned': 1157, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 1065, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1051, 'last_played': 1542346594}
review:
I. LOVE. THIS. GAME.
Even if you don't like point-and-click adventures, I would be very surprised to know that we are friends and you haven't bought this game yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051593153', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 918, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1385626569}
review:
I have no idea why I bought Primordia... But I am glad I did!

The developers created a unique world with such an awesome atmosphere I just could not get enough of.

Horatio is a really cool and deep character and his sidekick Crispin keeps the humour alive and is defiantly the coolest sidekick of all time! I want one!

I can‚Äôt recommend this game enough to anyone that is looking for something new (or something old if you are old like me).

The game brought me back to the old Sierra adventure games, graphics and everything!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198010048647', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1417222449}
review:
It's been months since I beat Primordia and I still think about it from time to time.
My one nitpick is that there are a few disappointingly easy to miss parts of the game that (unless you have meticulous saves) you could lose the opportunity to try out without starting a new game. A lot of games solve that kind of problem by the use of chapters/episodes. Not this one.

Overall, Primordia is short, entertaining, and gorgeous.

I am in love with the voices and the art. Especially the character Primer. You'll know what I'm talking about when you get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961165322', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1003, 'last_played': 1388729710}
review: I absolutely loved this game and it was quite refreshing to play something that that nailed the cyberpunk genre on the head. The story and characters are amazing and combined with great voice acting immersed me in the world.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967704661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 887, 'last_played': 1624694247}
review: Words cannot describe my love for this game. As such, using as little description as possible: Even in subsequent playthroughs, although short and sweet, I am consistently reminded just how excellent an experience this is.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972781843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 817, 'last_played': 1419063290}
review:
Ahora que ya he completado el juego por segunda vez y he podido ver todos los finales puedo decir que esta es una gran aventura grafica como las de anta√±o. la accion se situa en un decadente futuro habitado por robots capaces de construir a otros robots y donde el recuerdo del ser humano ha pasado a ser poco mas que una superstici√≥n religiosa, la historia esta bien construida, bien conducida y plagada de personajes perturbadores. Se trata del clasico point and click sobre lo que no hay mucho mas que a√±adir en materia de jugabilidad. finalmente su punto mas fuerte, el apartado artistico de este juego es extraoirdinario, tanto los decorados como los personajes que encontraremos y las ilustraciones que de tanto en cuando nos regala el juego estan tremendamente curradas (al menos para mi gusto). tambien destacar algunos aspectos negativos, el primero es que esta totalmente en ingles y los dialogos no son especialmente facilones, asi que es interesante tener un nivel medio en el idioma, tambien la resoluci√≥n de algunos acertijos puede ser complicada en momentos puntuales haciendo necesario el uso de alguna "ayuda externa". en definitiva es una aventura con la esencia de los clasicos, una impecable historia de ciencia ficcion y unos graficos excelentes.

7,5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197999111837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1417978660}
review: Breathtaking view of a dystopian future in which humanity is dead and artificially intelligent robots struggle with the same questions humanity once had--its place in the world and its relationship with its creators.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988649543', 'num_games_owned': 1540, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 937, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 588, 'last_played': 1417190896}
review:
This is a great dystopian adventure game. Went very nicely with reading the Transformers comics.

If you like adventure games, and you like robots, this is the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071571224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1389371185}
review: One of the better indie adventure games. Very reminiscent of Beneath A Steel Sky.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041958336', 'num_games_owned': 417, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 862, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 917, 'last_played': 1498998645}
review: A very awesome game, well worth the price. Haven't played an amazing point and click adventure like this since the first 3 Monkey Island games. It is not quite as comical, but your sidekick Crispen does have some funny dialogue that lightens up the mood. Several very cool different endings. Really leaves you wanting more, played it through 2x but still can't get enough. If you are looking for a good point and click game, this is it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071501932', 'num_games_owned': 989, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1467573489}
review: A really cool point-and-click adventure game reminiscent of Space Quest and similar titles of yesteryear. Reminiscent, but not similar; it feels much more user-friendly and intuative than the series of old. The story is well thought-out and the artwork and soundtrack does a great job of transporting you there. If you like challenging games where you have to explore and figure things out logically, this one's for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027674034', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1585359164}
review: I LOVED THIS GAME.! Voice acting is great for an indie game.. really shines.! the story is also great and inspired me to write a short story in it's universe.. GET THIS GAME.!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046908772', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 738, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 738, 'last_played': 1389043007}
review:
A dark but not excessively dramatic game with a slight Planescape: Torment vibe to its atmosphere and side characters. The music is beautiful and well-chosen for the scenes that are meant to get to you (and they really do), and the voices feel spot on for most characters you meet. Some puzzles can get frustrating due to the combination of 'I don't need this right now' for interactable objects that you might or might not use in the future and objects that only become interactable when something else happens in a different area. However, dialogue usually contains hints on where you need to go, and your humorous floating [strike]skull[/strike] sidekick might have something useful to say as well, so pay attention. There's a variety of endings, and you're not restricted to the path of the good guy, though, by that time you'll be questioning your definition of a 'good guy' and how good your actions actually were. This game will definitely make you think and not just about solving puzzles. 

tl;dr Buy it. It's great.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993771670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 567, 'last_played': 1419599880}
review:
Primordia is a great example of what "point and click" game should be. I liked it from the beginning and to the end - it didn`t dissapoint me. I enjoyed it`s plot - the postapocalyptic world ravaged from past war. The mankind vanished and robots are only survivors. The game is about a fate of one of those robots - Horatio and his loyal sidekick Crispin. 
It all begins when an unknown robot steals UNIIC`s power core. Without it, it is a matter of time before our heroes will ran out of energy in the middle of the desert. And so it`s do or die. The journey to the Metropol "City of glass and light" begins.
While playing this game player will meet both new friends and enemies, uncover mysteries of Metropol`s city and Horatio`s past, listen to funny and well made actor dialogues, solve many puzzles. If you like "point and click" games or just good games then you will definetely like Primordia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060668694', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1378182527}
review: A beautiful point and click adventure. Emerse yourself in a futuristic, yet retro world where everything is alien. Long story short, if you enjoy storyline, brainstorming puzzles and robots, you'll thoroughly enjoy this game. Highly recommend to casual players and people who like a good adventure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021992728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3045, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1791, 'last_played': 1556549715}

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198043682538', 'num_games_owned': 336, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1388737056}
review: This game is awesome. It seems like a simple point-and-click adventure game at first but it's full of surprises. The puzzles in the game aren't complicated but are still challenging enough to make you stop and think about it. There are a lot of different endings and multiple ways to complete the end goal. It's world is very engaging and it was the first "point-and-click" game that I wanted to keep playing after it was over. Art style, music/sound, characters, and story are all wonderful. I am looking forward to see what else the developers are working on next.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004779187', 'num_games_owned': 1071, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1388730426}
review:
Fascinating setting and story. Characters are also well voice-acted and don't feel totally one-dimensional.
Definitely worth picking up and playing through if not just for the setting and atmosphere of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118853077', 'num_games_owned': 987, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 937, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1419791363}
review:
One of the most intelligent games I've played in a long time, I couldn't help but be swept up into its finely-crafted world. It has robots, Logan Cunningham, and Logan Cunningham voicing a robot. It has robot zombies and ultra-lawful super-paladin ladybot Batman who kills those robot zombies.
With clever dialogue and mind-stretching puzzles, this is a game I'd reccommend wholeheartedly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031765203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1388653448}
review:
Primordia is a sci-fi, futuristic, post-apocalyptic story where you play as a robot named Horatio. In the world of Primordia robots run the planet; "Man" is but long forgotten and a thing only of legend. The puzzles are decently hard but not overbearing. Some puzzles actually have multiple solutions and the game has multiple endings. There is a built in hint system that you have the option of using. The hints gently nudge you in the correct direction but do not give obvious answers. I liked how the story pokes fun/satirizes modern day society and its views on religion without making it overly obvious. It was done subtley and in good taste. The story is just really well done; it is one of my favorites and certainly memorable. Primordia isn't just a well designed game; it is also beautiful, sad, and poetic. Overall, definitely another great title from Wadjet Eye. 

Side note - There is an option to turn on commentary from the writers. I highly recommend turning on the commentary if you are enjoying the game - it provides a ton of context and for me made the experience even more so enjoyable.

9.5/10

Please upvote this review if you found it useful :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198040435844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1388598019}
review:
Another great game by Wadjet Eye. I first discovered the studio with Gemini Rue and this is what i believe make their trademark: Point n' Click adventure games written with talent, involving dark/noire universes, with great dialogues and cynical humor. The characters are great with superb voiceacting. The graphics take it back to old school 2D art, which i am very fond of. It gives a very classic look, but remain very serious on the plot, twists or endings. This one has many, by the way. I had fun discovering them all.

Some of the criticisms i could think of is, for exemple, a couple of particular scenes or plot resolutions going too fast or being technically rushed (but they are very rare, though) and also the game being very short. Still, at the end, i enjoyed a great story with very original characters. I really wish for the sequel "Fallen" they might produce later on. I hope so!

author: {'steamid': '76561198049893859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 583, 'last_played': 1378579120}
review:
Primordia is a beautifully crafted science fiction adventure game in the spirit of Lucas Arts' The Dig. The melancholic mystery of the lovingly rendered post-apocalyptic setting is off-set by often light-hearted dialogue and cleverly ironic story elements (Freud's ego, id and superego populate an enormous defunct robot's skull at one point). The gameplay is deceptively simple, but my actions and choices had consequences, as I learned on my second play-through, which surprised and thrilled me. Like The Dig, Primordia's adventure game format ultimately serves as a vehicle to tell a subtle and poignant sci-fi fable. I highly recommend this game.

7.5 / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198005907490', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1357545600}

author: {'steamid': '76561197969225362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1384051353}

author: {'steamid': '76561198042757315', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1423008184}
review:
This game is so amazing it actually pains me to delete it from my computer. It was an amazing experience and I URGE any and all of you to try it out. I am thus writing a review to leave my mark.

Gameplay : the puzzles are sometimes a bit contrived, but satisfying overall. It's all a matter of investigating the area and DON'T FORGET YOU CAN USE CRISPIN. He's essential to many puzzles and I got stumped because I didn't know I could use him as an item! Otherwise, despite being occasionnaly frustrating, the mechanics are very well implemented and its a joy to interact with the game's world. 

Graphics : All the graphics in this game are simply GORGEOUS. You can tell the makers put their heart into the art (pun intended), despite there being not all that much since the game is a bit short. But you can tell from the screenshots that this game really shines visually.

Audio : The real beauty of this game : the voice-over. The voice actor for Bastion's Narrator is the main character here, and he doesn't disappoint! And neither do the other characters! Each and every robot has a unique personality, and I loved just examining every little detail just for more of the voice talent. There's even a robot that only speaks in rhyming riddles! And the music, simply entrancing. When you play this, be sure to put up the volume!

Story : As usual, you are an amnesiac and you live with your faithful companion Crispin. While short, the adventure is really gripping, and charming- despite the post-apocalyptic setting. Similar to Machinarium, the world is only populated by robots, and they live in a big city of lights! There's two main sections to the story : exploring the desert, discovering various different areas, and exploring the city, which sadly wasn't that big. Unlike the desert, which had a map with a few area markers you could jump to, the city was only a few connected screens, which blocked you with puzzles. Despite the city being a bit small and the story short, it ends (according to the good ending) on a good note and offers the possibility of a sequel. 

At least... I hope...

I give this game a 9/10, with frustrating puzzles as the only negative point. Try it out! Don't worry, there's plenty of comic relief thanks to Crispin :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198002171450', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1458275069}

author: {'steamid': '76561198022574788', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1388016252}

author: {'steamid': '76561197987964398', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1577512126}
review: While short, taking me only 6-8 hours to play start to finish, this game sucked me in and got me emotionally involved in the characters more than any other game I've played in recent memory.  As the first point-and-click adventure game I'd ever played, it took me by surprise and was a complete joy to play.  I highly recommend this game to anyone looking to spend some time digging into an amazing story and meeting some great people.  ...I mean robots;)

author: {'steamid': '76561197976867301', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1374676225}
review:
A non-combat, old school point and click adventure game with awesome story, occasional humour and excellent artwork. The universe that this game is set in is very detailed and every environment tells a story of how the world became like it is.
I would buy any game set in this universe just to see more of it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198041575021', 'num_games_owned': 636, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 529, 'last_played': 1387717585}
review:
I bought this game out of blue, just from curiosity and nostalgy for the old games. So I expected absolutely nothing from it... And had found a beautiful jewel, proudly shining through the pixels of sepia-colored design. 

I don't want to talk about the plot - you should walk through the whole story by yourself, to feel & understand the world and its inhabitants, to see the whole story from your point of view and to decide, what will happen at the end. I will just say that if you're looking for a game with not-so-simple story, with ability to choose how to solve difficult situation, with an almost alive (figuratively, of course) characters - this game is what you are looking for.

P.S. If you're scared off by the drawing style - believe me, I's bringing absolutely unique feelings about this game. It's totally charming and I couldn't imagine this game any other way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087141622', 'num_games_owned': 1444, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1544156513}
review: This game has a beautiful world full interesting charaters. I have never really liked adventure games but this one is the EXCEPTION. author: {'steamid': '76561198021321108', 'num_games_owned': 690, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1060, 'last_played': 1419863860}
review:
I first bought Primordia just because I thought the graphics were cool with it's dark and gloomy artstyle. But the game surprised me really good with it's intelligent puzzles and challenges as well as hidden easter eggs. All dialouges, characters and the alternative endings really make it worthwhile and I'll cheerish the time I had playing Primordia.

It's not a game for everyone, but you'll love it if you're into puzzle or point-and-click games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049010621', 'num_games_owned': 673, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 645, 'last_played': 1418361530}
review:
Let me just say, I adore this game. As someone who enjoys point-and-click adventure games as well as cyberpunk themes, this was a match made in heaven.

The story revolves around Horatio and Crispin, two robots who live in a wrecked ship. Horatio is a believer in Humanism, that humans are the creators, which is a frowned upon idea in the world the live in. They live far away from the city, isolated, until their power supply is stolen and they are forced to go to Metropol. As they search they discover the corrupt system that the city is operating under and Horatio's past. 


The characters themselves were enough to keep me playing. I enjoyed each one's own personality, their dialog, their story, it was all well done. The art style very well sets the tone for Primordia and was pleasing to look at while playing. The story was actually surprisingly well done and with multiple endings it just increases the replay value as well as my interests. It was challenging enough to where I felt incredibly accomplished once I finished it, but easy enough to where I didn't rage quite and ignore it for days. I was easily absorbed into Primordia's world and it's certainly a game I will replay more than once (and already have).

Overall, worth the money and the time if you enjoy this genre. A must have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061450910', 'num_games_owned': 936, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1417126551}

review:
Interesting unusual story about far feature, where robots face with very similar problems we have. Fun jokes, great quests, fascinating ambience. A little bit poor graphics, but it's completely makes up with I've described above.
Play it, if you like a postapoplectic, robots and not casual games.

Thanks to the creators. \:)/

author: {'steamid': '76561197997050459', 'num_games_owned': 235, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1387008828}
review:
I've never liked adventure games, mainly because I'm terrible at puzzles, but the art style of this game made me curious, so I pirated it. Turns out the storyline was amazing (if a bit on the short side) and the music was excellent. So I bought it. 

Seriously, do yourself a favor and play this game, it's incredible.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987091094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1378764800}
review:
Primordia does 2 things well: dialogue and environment. Despite the less than crisp resolution of the game, the backgrounds and landscapes are imaginative and beautiful. The dystopian world is set post-human inhabitation, and robots--having gained self-sufficiency--are the survivors. Interactions are varied, and the clash of philosophies keeps you interested. It is an alien world, one that I was happy I visited.

I needed a guide to get through this game. Solving puzzles requires assistance or large amounts of time. Direct question puzzles were difficult. Seriously difficult. I was able to figure them out because I have enough probability knowledge to know how to crunch the numbers. Otherwise, I got stuck, alot. The technical jargon naming of items, though justifiable, made some item combo puzzles vexing. I did not even know what some words meant, and few times I would simply not even try.

It lasts about 6-8 hours, and is a fun ride. It harkens back to Monkey Island and other wonderful point-and-click adventures, but it also brings the same frustrations. Regardless, it is worth the asking price for a weekend game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012622262', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1383435258}

author: {'steamid': '76561197980312349', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1357632000}
review: Great scumm style game.  I've always loved this style and the immersive storylines that can be had with it.  Like The Dig, this game is immersive and otherworldly, with a soundtrack that completely meshes with the bleak landscape of the game.  The gameplay is as polished as any of the old school lucas arts, and I think it proves that there's limit to how a game can use a really old style of gameplay, and so long as there is a decent story, still be amazing.

Mancher mag sich an "beneath a steel sky" erinnert f√ºhlen, doch Primordia hat - vor allem durch den sehr guten Soundtrack sowie die englische Vertonung der Charaktere - mehr emotionale Tiefe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019715562', 'num_games_owned': 1401, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1417134435}
review:
Primordia is a point-and-click adventure game with a "classic" look. The story is set in a sci-fi world, where all humans have died and only robots remain. Even though the game has an interesting setting, the story was kinda dull.

Graphics-wise the game looks like the classic point-and-click adventures of the 90's. The world looked interesting with its post-apocalyptic look, but often the graphics were quite low-res, which is unfortunate. 

Music was pretty nice although I didn't pay much attention to it. However, I thought the voice acting was pretty bad even though most reviews online say it's great. The voices didn't seem to fit the characters, which made me dislike some of them. Especially the voice of the droid companion was kinda annoying.

The puzzles were kinda hard, because they weren't very logical and sometimes required you to backtrack to a previous area to get an item that wasn't available there before. It would have been fine, if you had to use a certain item to get that other item i.e. the item was there, but you couldn't get it yet. The "appearance" of the needed item wasn't indicated in any way. So basically the puzzle design was quite bad.

Overall it's an average point-and-click adventure that suffers from bad puzzle design and a dull story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002604604', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1848, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 863, 'last_played': 1466176888}
review:
Primordia is, at it's core, a nostalgic trip to the old days of the Point-and-Click Adventure genre of gaming that at this day and age has almost been completely forgotten and lost.  And what a welcome blast from the past it is indeed.  Following the travels and trials of Horatio and Crispin, this game tells an amazing story with all the conventions of the P&C genre.  But it's not QUITE to same as the games of old, such as King's Quest, or Broken Sword.

For starters, the game tells you outright that you cannot die, or can you take an action that renders the game "unwinnable", a flaw that made many of the classic staples of point-and-click, like King's Quest 5, atrocities of game design.  The locales don't require meticulous pixel hunts to find that one item you need in order to progress.  Travelling the maps is expidited by a fast-travel system that easily lets you jump from place to place.  Combining items is no longer a nonsensical MacGuyver mish-mash of parts, it's all explained and makes perfect sense.  No longer do you need a notebook to take down vital information, a handy item in-game records all the most relevant information for you, and your helper will at times offer a light nudge towards the next possible objective.

And that's just the mechanics.  The game's art and sound, two of the major foundations of point-and-click, which lives and thrives (or fails and dies) off it's atmosphere, are in full force.  The discoloration of the game's settings isn't just to be "realistic", it's a compliment to the setting and aesthetic.  And the music is highly atmospheric.  From the haunting melody of the game's menu theme "Primordia" to the tune of "The City of Glass and Light", the music compliments the setting as much as the color palette.  The characters are all fully voiced, and the voice work is clean and quality, with voices befitting each character and role.

Of course, Primordia isn't perfect.  For starters, the biggest and possibly most glaring flaw, is just how SHORT the game is.  Even if the puzzles make you spend extra time (and at first, they will), you'll likely only wind up spending 5-7 hours on this game.  It's basically over before it seems to really begin.  While it follows the classic story-telling formula, the climax of the story seems to be on you before you know it.  A point in the game that feels like the 50% is more like the 75% mark instead.  And before you know it, you're already at the final scene.  Even with multiple endings (which can be achieved by just reloading and making a different choice) the game feels painfully short-lived.  You'll be left wanting to hear and see more.

The music, while perfectly fitting the mood, never seems to stick with the player much.  I couldn't tell you a moment in the game and point out the music for it, besides the music at the main menu.  Which isn't to say the music is bad, because it's not.  But it's not catchy much.  Or very present.  The music mostly serves as a background to the game, ambience.  And it does it's part amazingly well.  I just wish that perhaps the music felt a bit more powerful at certain scenes.  Speaking of sound, the voice-acting and sound effects are a bit off as well.  Some scenes would have effects, like gunshots, with NO sound accompanying them, which removed something important to the scene.  And the voice actors themselves, while very good, still felt a bit rough.  Horatio's voice actor in particular, either does a stellar job, or seems a bit too stoic when you'd think a situation would call for a more forceful, emotional or venomous delivery.

Overall though, Primordia definitely feels like it was a game that SHOULD have existed back in the Golden Age of the adventure genre of PC gaming.  It feels like a game that I missed from my childhood and I'm just getting to sit down and enjoy it now for the first time in years, and it's not even that old!  But it takes me back to that time in gaming that I've almost forgotten and reminded me of what games I use to partake of, and that's a feeling I can't being to say how much I enjoy.  If you are a person who enjoys the point-and-click genre, grew up in that era, or want a relaxing, easy-paced game that can still deliver a great story, Primordia is worth every possible virtual cent you pay for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029882737', 'num_games_owned': 259, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1383187519}
