author: {'steamid': '76561197971532050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 214, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1357891200}
review: Wadjet's "Beneath a Steel Sky" vintage adventure game from december 2012.  A must for fans of resonance or Gemini Rue. It is a shame they added a sidekick who is just an annoying  smartass . Look for future special editions that just delete the floating pest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043175428', 'num_games_owned': 452, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1409795260}
review: A super-dooper-alheooper puzzling game about robots 'n' stuff! BUY IT NOW! THE MECHANICUM DEMANDS IT!

author: {'steamid': '76561198004499559', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 669, 'last_played': 1356076800}
review:
Short but very good. Its set in a post apocolypse setting, with all robots. The story follows our hero and a robot built by said hero on a journy to get back somthing stolen from him...

Its an adventure game, not a lot of action, most things are acomplished by trying to use items on things in the world, or on eachother. Most of the puzzles are pretty simple, and the game isnt very long. The story is very well writen and the voice acting is top notch. The games reselution is SUPER LOW, but the art work is still atractive....would have been nicer at a higher reselution but eh, what can you do.

For $10 its kind of short (assumeing you get every puzzle right instantly, or dont want to see a diffrent ending that requiers you to play with diffrent outcomes) but is still very sweet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044661776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 938, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 936, 'last_played': 1387754188}
review: An amazing storyline, excellent dialogues and very fun retro point-and-click action. Recommended to every fan of Machinarium and other marvelous titles of the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030734654', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1031, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1031, 'last_played': 1357286400}
review: Such an an amazing game. To anyone who enjoys a good scifi story, buy it! Or if you're just a fan of the old adventure/logic games a la Sierra or Lucas Arts, this will DEFINITELY be a welcome addition to your library. I'm so happy to find good new games of this genre, especially one like Primordia.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970716162', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1356595200}
review: Best adventure game to come out in a long while. I got so attached to the story that I replayed it to get all the achievements and possbile endings. You can also get hints from your sidekick if you get stuck for too long.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984112729', 'num_games_owned': 426, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1467381109}
review:
Amazing point-'n-click adventure. The art-style is amazing, the story is wonderful and gets you hooked right on! The puzzles are challenging enough, and you usually won't get stuck for long. Game lasts a few hours (without using any walkthrough), but you'll have to replay it if you want to get other achievements.
The audio and soundtracks of the game are great, and you really feel immersed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993149101', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1403649196}
review: What if Tyrian was a point and click adventure? This is a masterwork.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986457772', 'num_games_owned': 1097, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1356422400}
review: The flaws:  It's very short, lasting around 6 hours if you don't linger too much on the puzzles, which are sometimes (later on in the game) reliant on numbers and math to an extent that there was no way I wouldn't be pulling out a guide.  Worse, when I found the numbers needed to solve a puzzle, I wondered how the writers even arrived at that solution.  Evidently, I cannot math.  (Thankfully, though, plenty of other puzzles are subtle yet logical, and a pleasure to work out.)  Some of the dialogue here is pretty cornball, clashing with the dreary dystopian setting, but then again I suppose that fits with the tradition of this style of game.  Beyond these issues, Primordia enjoys an aesthetic drawing from Giger, Moebius, Dune, and probably a bit of Machinarium and/or Beneath a Steel Sky, with music that recalls Blade Runner and Kaiba.  The scope of the story and its setting suggests far more than the ground you actually cover, but just that it seems so sprawling is wonderful.  Primordia feels like a labor of love.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036616979', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1356508800}
review:
Fun little puzzle solver. Short (I finished my first run through in about 6 hours) but with a lovely little story. Most of the puzzles are solvable with a little thought, although from the look of the achievements I haven't unlocked, there are a few puzzles I either missed or got locked out of by my story choices.

I'm not sure what the full price was, but if and when this shows up as flash sale, its very worth a $3-4 sale price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077281776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 723, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 617, 'last_played': 1510829029}

author: {'steamid': '76561198010298365', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 528, 'last_played': 1356681600}
review:
An astonishing point-and-click adventure game, probably one of the suprise hits for me this year. The voice acting is charming and phenomenal, the art syle is a lovely combination of baroque/railgun-gothic themes with a dash of cyberpunk, the story is well written with many endings/paths, and the soundtrack is suprisingly good. Unfortunately it is somewhat short, but is still a must-buy for any post-apoc junkies, adventure game enthusiasts, and technophiles out there.














I am Chrysalis Faustbuilt, version 69.

And my primary directive is to ENSLAVE you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991781177', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1355472000}
review:
As a person who has never played a single adventure game before in his life, Primordia caught my eye with its visuals and premise. From its art style, well done puzzles, top-notch voice acting, and great story, its an amazing little gem that you should not pass up. The challenges are usually rough, sometimes easy, but are always rewarding. The writing itself is enough to keep you going; witty, and like everything else, masterfully done. If you‚Äôre thinking about trying it out, definitely do so!

Word to the wise: If you think it's a clue, it is. Write it down!

review:
Definitely a must-buy for anyone looking for a good story. Some of the puzzles and items you need to find take some imagination- but then again, I suppose that's the point of an adventure game.
The music, the atmosphere, the desolate landscape and humorous exchanges between Horatio and Crispin make this game a definite jewel that shouldn't be absent from any adventure-gamer's library.

review: Bueeeeeena aventura grafica de graficos retros. Esta en pitingles y con voces. Es guai, aunque a√∫n me han quedado algunas dudas del argumento que creo que no tienen respuesta clara ... malditos.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985583657', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1355126400}
review:
There was an era of adventure gaming that I really loved: the 90s LucasArts-style era.  These were games that ran in 256-color MCGA mode and had MIDI soundtracks.  If you were fortunate enough to own, rather than download, these games, you might even have gotten the voice tracks.

This game is a lot like those.  It has some puzzles that make little sense and some arbitrary hurdles, but on the whole, it holds up very well.  The surplus of endings is interesting, as well.  Primordia doesn't have a very long playthrough, which is nice.  It's like a novella and it just hits the spot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021720244', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1478269060}

author: {'steamid': '76561197990152763', 'num_games_owned': 2031, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1355990400}
review:
I started this review thinking "i'd only reccommend this game if it was 10 dollars" then I saw the price and was like derp.

Its another good point and click adventure game, it suffers from the faults of the genre simply because its part of the genre. 

That being said I loved the enviroments, the art direction in this game is really solid they capture the distopian depression look very nicely, and the world feels larger than the game itself. I found myself wanting to see more places more locations as the game drew to a close. 

Puzzles are still suffer from "I missed a piece, lets backtrack... everywhere" issues, but, typically it involves how much you pay attention. This one likes to slap you with obvious solutions after you are predispositioned to go in an obtuse way.

Overall, if you love adventure games and want a healthy dose of post human robotland distopia, you should get it.

So get to upvoting games!

author: {'steamid': '76561198054966168', 'num_games_owned': 800, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1398026369}
review:
This game is actually really cool. I've always been a fan of point-and-click adventure games, and this is one of the best I've played in years. The graphics are amazing, the voice acting is superb, the writing and story are excellent and grammatically correct. It's nice to find an interesting, compelling science fiction adventure game, and I'd strongly recommend this to anyone interested in Sci-Fi and Adventure games.

I'd have paid three times what I paid for this.
